story:
Our WebSite 


How was the idea born?

A man called Marvin Heemeyer inspired us for this. People call him America’s Last Hero and we completely support this opinion.  He showed the world that even one man can stand up against the System, to fight what he believes in and defend his rights.


It is that kind of human perseverance, our relentlessness and power of will that we took as a foundation for our game.

Description

This game takes places in an alternate universe in the America of the 70-ies. A military experiment resulted in the vast majority of the population of a paradise island being infected and mutated.

The protagonist is an engineer John Kowalski, after the global epidemic he locks up in his garage and creates his killer-machine called the Sphere.

With his machine John attempts to save his daughter and the other survivors on the island. Hordes of mutated Bonker creatures and U.S. armed forces will stand in his way.

What makes this game entertaining?

Desperation is a hardcore vehicular combat arcade, it has a full motion picture storyline, multiple story branches, dynamic gameplay full of the spirit of survival and non-stop action.

The player will delve into a detailed universe with its own cultural values, atmosphere and style. In order to give the player a richer sense of the story and to reveal as much of the plot as possible we use graphical novel (aka comics) in between the levels.

Our characters are fully developed individuals with their unique personalities, views on life and motives.

Desperation is the story of a brave and courageous desperado.

In the game the player will drive an incredibly powerful and heavy 3 ton juggernaut machine that is upgradeable with additional heavy weapons and plenty of other features.

The enemy is a new breed that physically resembles humans – the BONKERS! 

They are strong and fast, they are intelligent and cruel as beasts. They are capable of mutating to an unnatural size and they evolve by joining into herds, which makes them a force that crashes everything that stands in its way.

There no rules, no escape plan, no one to come to save you, only self-reliance and a will to live!

How is this game paid for?

Desperation is standalone, not free-to-play.

Buy once, never make in-game purchases. Your upgrades depend on XP points with no real money involved.

BR – Black Rules. It’s not just a company. We are a team bound together by the endeavor to create an extraordinary cult game with no fear of thinking outside of the box. We are here to surprise our future users and make them happy.

That engine does your game use?

We use Unity 5. It’s a light and flexible piece of software that allows to create quality games and deliver them across all known platforms.

story:
The Darklight Project - An MMORPG Android Journey

Donate to help the development team produce the game in time to release by Christmas

Our Story:

The Dark LIght Project is a new MMORPG Android gaming experience designed for all players aged 10 years and up. We have designed our game to incorporate visually stunning graphics with an intriguing and captivating storyline, centered around enjoyment, playability, community-building and role playing.

We have already begun development with 14 programmers, designers, and world builders who are making steady progress on our basic prototype. We anticipate that we will be ready to release the first edition of the game just before Christmas of this year.

The Dark Light Project:

Fight the demented, malformed hordes of continuously spewed toothy beasts from the Pits of Thorix on a daily basis, travel the stars and visit alien cultures, slay dragons, griffons, go into the Pits themselves and seek to destroy the source of the beasts, hunt in the Crypts to destroy Dark Clerics or seek out the Alien Ant Queen deep in her lair on another planet once you've battled to find the lost portal keys to transport you to her planet light years away!

Impact:

Our team has been involved in literally hundreds of art and design projects and have contributed to the production of hundreds of Android, iPhone, and Facebook Games. What we are now trying to accomplish as a larger group is the creation of something larger than we could complete on our own, and to create something that will have a profound effect on the mobile game application community.

What We Need:

We need of $200,000 AUD to help us complete our project. This funding will be used towards expanding our present team and beginning a marketing campaign. If, for any reason, we are not able to reach our funding goal, we will start off small with our campaign goals and use the artwork we have created up to this point to produce a smaller-scale version of our product for market distribution, so our backers can be assured that your money doesn’t go to waste.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t make a donation at this time, there are still ways you can help support my campaign! Please take a few moments to share my information with your friends and family via social media, email, and through word of mouth.

Thank you in advance for your support!

Following are some screenshots and concept art as we work on it.

story:
What the heck is this?

This is my passion project. Something I have wanted to create for many years and with your help, were going to make this happen! Why? Cause it's damn awesome that's why. In today's world we are surrounded by products and advertisements and we get stuck in the drone of our day to day. This game is an escape from that, something you can play any where any time and allows you to interact in the real world! 

Game Screenshot Scanning a QRCode on a coaster in the local pub!


The idea comes from an old game I used to play as a child, it was called Barcode Battler. You would cut UPC Codes from cereal boxes and scan them into a device that would assign random numbers, you would press a button for attack and it would do some random mumbo jumbo and you would either kill the opponent barcode or it would kill you! I had so much fun scanning everything in our house trying to find that epic boss. I want to recreate this feeling of discovery and adventure and share it with everyone!


I have been in software development my entire life, and I have created numerous applications for the business world. I have created augmented reality apps for advertisement platforms, for art and discovery exhibits, for corporate based apps and now I want to transfer a part of that AR world to my game concept. 

The idea is simple, you scan any barcode any where; UPC, QRCode, it doesn't matter! The code instantly transforms into a 3D Bad Ass Monster in front of your very eyes! It's yours now! Collect as many as you can! Each scan becomes a chance to gain a new monster or item for your collection. 

Battle them together in one of many arenas that you can unlock! Fight them to level up there XP and skills to create your ultimate champion. 


We plan to create a multiplayer aspect where you can fight your friends collection for bragging rights! The ultimate goal is to have your monsters battle right on the desk in front of you star wars chess style! Seriously! 

(image taken from wired.com)

What We Need & What You Get For Making it Happen

I think this is a game that hasn't been created yet, a game that will WOW people and a game that will live on and expand into many many different genres. I can make this happen with your help, the bulk of the cost in this game is 3D development and character acquisition. We want LOADS of content in this game, were talking in the thousands here! Let's build the coolest game ever made!

We are looking for $40,000.00 Dollars to get a beta version completed. The more money we raise the better the content will be in our game. The money will be divided into 3 Categories:

  • $30,000.00 Mobile App Development
  • $5000.00 3D Character Development Acquisition and Graphics
  • $5000.00 Marketing


Why Flexible Funding Model?

There is much scrutiny over campaigns using the flexible funding options where the campaign does not need to meet the goal to keep the money. Why are we risking it anyway? Because we don't need to meet our entire goal to make this game happen. We have set the goal high because we want loads of content! But if we fall short it just means we will launch with less content to start with but that's okay too! BattleScan will still be awesome. Other games do not have this luxury because they need all of the content covered or the game wont work. So rest assured this game is happening whether we meet our funding goal or not more donations=more content, period.

With your donations we will make this game awesome! Everyone who donates more than $20.00 will get a special power-up in the game that can be assigned to any character! Use it wisely to beat your opponents into submission! All contributors get there name added to our VIP Contributors Page on the website with your IndieGogo Monster Level title. Plus all contributors will be invited to our closed beta! Game credits will be valued at 50cents per game credit. Buy choosing a perk with game credits your getting twice the credits for the money! Spend these on sweet power-ups and weapons for your characters.

  • $10 = *Scary Spider Level* A shout out on Twitter and Facebook and our utmost thanks for your support! 
  • $20 = *Man Eating Rat Level* Special Character for contributors only!
  • $40 = *Rabid Hell Hound Level* A special power-up only contributors get to aid you in your quest + BattleScan T-Shirt + Special Character
  • $50 = *Screaming Banshee Werewolf Level* BattleScan T-Shirt + Special power-up + Special Character + 200 credits for in app purchases ****best battle for your buck!****
  • $100 = *Ultra Ice Demon Level* A super special rare character only contributors can discover! + 400 Credits
  • $250 = *Epic Super Smashy Troll Level* BattleScan T-Shirt + Special Character + 1000 Game Credits + Invite to our launch party
  • $500 = *Bronze Hellfire Dragon Level* BattleScan T-Shirt + Special Powerup + Special Character + 2000 Game Credits + Invite to our launch party + Signed Poster from the development team!
  • $1000 *Silver Ice Dragon Level* BattleScan T-Shirt + Powerup + Special Character + 5000 Game Credits + Invite to our launch party + Signed Poster from the development team + 3D Printed BattleScan character signed by the CEO! 
  • $10,000 *Gold Lava Dragon Level* BattleScan T-Shirt + Powerup + Special Character + 5000 Game Credits + Invite to our launch party + Signed Poster from the development team + 3D Printed BattleScan character signed by the CEO! + We will name a game character after you
  • $20,000 *Platinum Diamond Claw Dragon* BattleScan T-Shirt + Powerup + Special Character + 5000 Game Credits + Invite to our launch party + Signed Poster from the development team + 3D Printed BattleScan character signed by the CEO! + We will name a game character after you + fly you first class, put you up in a hotel for the night and limo to the launch party!

The Real Impact

This is a game that both adults and kids can get behind and forces us to transition from just having our attention on the mobile phone to the real world! It's time to touch real life! Let's get  adults and children alike, active and engaged in moving about the real world instead of sitting on our butts! I think the game not only adds that awesome Collector/Adventurer feeling, but can encourage healthy living!

We have already built an entire prototype that works amazingly! But we have a long way to go from here! Take a journey with us and become part of something truly unique, epic and just plain freakin awesome.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is going to be providing 3D content to our game and this is simply a financial roadblock. If we can raise the funding we can make this game beautiful, fun and change the way we game forever!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate money but are a 3D Artist or 3D movie editor Graphics developer or Programmer and would like to get involved reach out to us through our website www.battlescan.com and let's get moving!
Please share this campaign with everyone you know! Use the indiegogo sharing tools, please share us on all platforms!

story:
Indiegogo short link: http://igg.me/at/playfault
 

We will be updating this project page with new graphics and information, but the perks will not change! We may add more perk types or levels if there is demand.

UPDATE: The same heroes in the "High Five" perk are available as an add-on item in your cart when you select any other perk.

 

 

    
 

We here at Strange Matter Studios, with the support of our backers, are completely invested in building a next gen 3D action-MOBA game. All of us here were passionate Paragon players and desire to see the game's soul return---but with all of the potential we knew it had. That's exactly what we have been working on all year, and exactly what we continue to pour our hearts into everyday. Our upcoming Paragon-inspired game, Fault, has the feel of Paragon, but with a focus on competitive-level play and mechanics that will keep players returning for more. For newcomers, we hope you see the potential of the genre and choose to support our studio on this journey of innovation. And for our beloved community that has been holding it's breath for over 1.5 years, we hope you are able to fall in love with this project as you watch it evolve into the game we have always wanted.

In-engine screenshot:

In-progress HUD:



Our philosophy is that the gameplay and game mechanics are foremost. If you've been watching our Twitch game page or checking out Fault content on YouTube, you've seen the game we've made up to this point. Having already developed a fully-functional and feature-filled 5v5 MOBA, we now need your help to fill in and polish the remaining components. Every dollar helps us keep matchmaking servers running and to push larger and more impactful updates. We plan to generously reward our contributors who are helping us realize our goals. Thanks for the consideration of your support of Fault and we hope to see you on the battlefield!


    
 

Our game and map design revolves around action-packed, competitive play. Players should never be isolated from action or allowed to simply go into "autopilot" in lane. To achieve such a game, we needed inspiration from many sources, so we drew from Paragon and many other MOBAs. As a result, you'll see influences from more than just Legacy and Monolith Paragon. The aesthetic of the map is clearly Monolith. We liked the pace and action in Monolith games more, but we wanted the scale to be larger and players to have more options of pathing when traversing the map, more akin to Legacy play. As for itemization, we wanted an open store so any item could be built at any time, allowing players to express their skills by reacting to their opponents' builds without restrictions. Lastly, we wanted every choice the player makes to be impactful. So we designed the Aspect/Faction system (a fusion of League's rune system and Paragon's deck affinity system) to allow the player to make impactful gameplay decisions both before and during the game. All of this adds together to make a system that can be as versatile or targeted as the player chooses. As for game times, we want games wrapped up around 30-40 minutes. All of these designs are still under construction, and will be continuously adjusted as we experiment and tweak during Alpha tests.

Episode 2:

   

 

    


Everyone at our studio works tirelessly in their free time to make this Project happen (just look at how far we've come in the past 11 months). We have done this purely as volunteers, often sinking personal funds into the studio's necessities along the way. But now, with the support of the community, we have finally hit the point where we know that financial support will accelerate even further the pace of updates and content for our players.

First, why is the goal flexible?
Meaning we keep the funds regardless of if we reach our goal.

To quote Indiegogo: "Choose flexible funding if any amount of money will help you reach your campaign objective and you'll still be able to fulfill your perks."

Because our perks are deliverable regardless of hitting our goal, flexible funding is the appropriate funding type for our campaign. Fixed goals are when "you have a strict go/no-go threshold." And that is not true of Fault. Strange Matter will continue our work regardless of if we hit our goal. So the purpose of our campaign is to accelerate progress and to recruit skills/services that are outside the skill sets of our current team. A fixed goal would imply that if we don't reach the goal then we won't be able to continue working, and that simply isn't true. 

Why $100,000 USD?

We chose the goal by considering what our needs are and what is realistic for our backers to provide. This amount of capital will give us sufficient funds to bring the game into a state that is ready for marketing to the gaming community at-large (see the next section). In order to attract all backgrounds of gamers, Fault will need to have the fit and finish of a AAA-level game. Right now, we have some truly impressive skill sets on our team, but in order to hit the AAA standard, there are tasks that we would prefer be tackled by specialized experts. The next section describes how the money will be utilized. In this way, there is no wasted time nor money. 

With funds beyond our goal, we will be able to start looking at features well beyond the scope of our current team. This primarily includes brand new character models and animations, as well as brand new level assets that meet the quality expectations of a Paragon-like game.


 

    
 

We already have optimized pipelines for making heroes, items, and improving upon 3D art. So the money received will go into the additional features and content required for the polish and upkeep of the game.

  • Hero animation and particle effects - We know that the look and feel of the game, especially one similar to Paragon, is paramount. So these funds will allow us to get the expertise needed to polish hero animations and improve particle effects for hero abilities where they are lacking.
     
  • Code-base - Our players deserve a virtually bug-free experience on dedicated servers that run smoothly. Thus, much of the funds will go to getting professional help or consultation for elements in the code that are best-tackled by specialized programmers. With enough funding, our first full-time employee would likely be in this department.
     
  • Servers - The price of servers adds up, especially when running many at once to support quick match load times. You buying an early access key will easily cover your server usage up to the full release of the game (late 2020) and beyond! Based on our current data, we can guarantee that no more that 5% of crowdfunding will go toward this purpose. 
     
  • Sound - We want nothing short of Paragon-level sound for upcoming heroes and sound reworks.
     
  • Art - We will need 2D art to fill the item store, menus, and loading screens. Additionally, we will need concept art in order to produce new skins and heroes when we have the funding and pipeline to achieve it.

    In the interest of transparency, you should also know that any money received for content in Unreal Engine is subject to the 5% royalty fee. This includes crowdfunding.


     

    
 

  • The satisfaction of supporting the rebirth of your favorite game, but in an even better form!
     
  • Early access - Starts in the first quarter of 2020! Servers will be up 24/7, so play whenever you like! Spread the word too, because in order for Early access to be successful, we will need a lot of players. All Early Access keys come with 5 heroes unlocked by default: Gideon, Sparrow, Steel, Greystone, and Khaimera. Account progression during early access will stay for full release.
    See the "What costs money and why?" section for more details.
     
  • Holiday access - Dec 20th 8 pm EST to Dec 29th 2 am EST -  Want to play Fault over your Holiday break? How does over a whole week of 24-hour servers sound? You will have to play the Alpha build, which comes with some Alpha-level bugs, but check out some recent gameplay, people are having a blast playing and the extra support we receive can go a LONG way. All holiday players will have ALL HEROES UNLOCKED for the holiday event, after which the heroes will be locked again based on the accounts perk level (for Early Access). Note: These are likely to be North American servers only, unless we sell enough keys to support EU matchmaking as well. Stay tuned!
     
  • Coins - Pay-only currency within Fault. 1000 coins will be roughly equal to $10. We will roll out coin rewards when Early Access starts.
     
  • "Tough" Gideon - A Gideon cosmetic skin exclusive to people who support us at the silver level and higher on IndieGoGo. See image below. It will never be for sale in our in-game store. We reserve the right to make a recolor of this skin as an incentive for the launch of console editions of Fault. We will try to roll out this reward as the keys get claimed, but this task is low priority and we don't guarantee they will be out until Early Access (so please wait until then to contact us about this reward).
     
  • "Action Hero" Twinblast - A Twinblast cosmetic skin exclusive to people who support us at the founder level and higher on Indiegogo. See image below. It will never be for sale in our in-game store. We reserve the right to make a recolor of this skin as an incentive for the launch of console editions of Fault. We will try to roll out this reward as the keys get claimed, but this task is low priority and we don't guarantee they will be out until Early Access (so please wait until then to contact us about this reward).

How do I claim my perks?

At least 24 hrs before each access event begins, you will receive a code at the email on your Indiegogo account for each key in your bundle. Each code is redeemable on ANY playfault.com player account after logging into the website. Keys redeemed on our website will have their respective Steam Game Key sent out via the email on the player account. Holiday keys purchased after the 18th will be emailed redeemable codes within 24 hours. Email support@strangematter.co if you need help with anything.
 

    

Update: Holiday access extended!

 

    

This section is simply to explain how we are choosing to monetize our goods and why.
Are we going to take money for skins? Yes.
Are we going to take money for heroes? Also yes.
But both heroes and skins will also be unlockable by playing the game.

Some of you may wonder if this is fair, so let us explain. Strange Matter Studios doesn't just want to bring our favorite heroes back and say it's done... we want to create a game that can grow and thrive for years, and that's gonna take a lot of support. Being a small studio, we do not have the financial resources of studios like EPIC who get royalties on their engine and can afford to take financial hits in order to make game content more accessible to their players. We will have to use the same funds from selling the game to improve the game. Further, the standard of asset fidelity is set so high that we will need more funds than most other games to make our ideas a reality. So as a team we discussed this and decided it was best that we adopt a model that is established by many other MOBAs: unlockable heroes. But to show our respect to people who find it unfair to pay, we are making all of the content created from free marketplace assets (Heroes, Skins, and Emotes) unlockable, free of charge, by simply playing the game and using the earned in-game currency. Such a model still gives players the option to support the long-term development of the game by sending us some funds for an unlock. We hope you understand that we are trying to respect ALL of our community members: those that are happy to pay AND those that aren't. The primary benefit being that this model will help support the development of the game far after the "free" assets are exhausted.

We will be updating this project page with new graphics and information, but the perks will not change! We may add more perk types or levels if there is demand.
UPDATE: The same heroes in the "High Five" perk are available as an add-on item in your cart when you select any other perk.
 

 

     
We here at Strange Matter Studios, with the support of our backers, are completely invested in building a next gen 3D action-MOBA game. All of us here were passionate Paragon players and desire to see the game's soul return---but with all of the potential we knew it had. That's exactly what we have been working on all year, and exactly what we continue to pour our hearts into everyday. Our upcoming Paragon-inspired game, Fault, has the feel of Paragon, but with a focus on competitive-level play and mechanics that will keep players returning for more. For newcomers, we hope you see the potential of the genre and choose to support our studio on this journey of innovation. And for our beloved community that has been holding it's breath for over 1.5 years, we hope you are able to fall in love with this project as you watch it evolve into the game we have always wanted.
In-engine screenshot:

In-progress HUD:
Our philosophy is that the gameplay and game mechanics are foremost. If you've been watching our Twitch game page or checking out Fault content on YouTube, you've seen the game we've made up to this point. Having already developed a fully-functional and feature-filled 5v5 MOBA, we now need your help to fill in and polish the remaining components. Every dollar helps us keep matchmaking servers running and to push larger and more impactful updates. We plan to generously reward our contributors who are helping us realize our goals. Thanks for the consideration of your support of Fault and we hope to see you on the battlefield!
     
Our game and map design revolves around action-packed, competitive play. Players should never be isolated from action or allowed to simply go into "autopilot" in lane. To achieve such a game, we needed inspiration from many sources, so we drew from Paragon and many other MOBAs. As a result, you'll see influences from more than just Legacy and Monolith Paragon. The aesthetic of the map is clearly Monolith. We liked the pace and action in Monolith games more, but we wanted the scale to be larger and players to have more options of pathing when traversing the map, more akin to Legacy play. As for itemization, we wanted an open store so any item could be built at any time, allowing players to express their skills by reacting to their opponents' builds without restrictions. Lastly, we wanted every choice the player makes to be impactful. So we designed the Aspect/Faction system (a fusion of League's rune system and Paragon's deck affinity system) to allow the player to make impactful gameplay decisions both before and during the game. All of this adds together to make a system that can be as versatile or targeted as the player chooses. As for game times, we want games wrapped up around 30-40 minutes. All of these designs are still under construction, and will be continuously adjusted as we experiment and tweak during Alpha tests.
Episode 2:

   
 


    
Everyone at our studio works tirelessly in their free time to make this Project happen (just look at how far we've come in the past 11 months). We have done this purely as volunteers, often sinking personal funds into the studio's necessities along the way. But now, with the support of the community, we have finally hit the point where we know that financial support will accelerate even further the pace of updates and content for our players.
First, why is the goal flexible?Meaning we keep the funds regardless of if we reach our goal.
To quote Indiegogo: "Choose flexible funding if any amount of money will help you reach your campaign objective and you'll still be able to fulfill your perks."
Because our perks are deliverable regardless of hitting our goal, flexible funding is the appropriate funding type for our campaign. Fixed goals are when "you have a strict go/no-go threshold." And that is not true of Fault. Strange Matter will continue our work regardless of if we hit our goal. So the purpose of our campaign is to accelerate progress and to recruit skills/services that are outside the skill sets of our current team. A fixed goal would imply that if we don't reach the goal then we won't be able to continue working, and that simply isn't true. 
Why $100,000 USD?
We chose the goal by considering what our needs are and what is realistic for our backers to provide. This amount of capital will give us sufficient funds to bring the game into a state that is ready for marketing to the gaming community at-large (see the next section). In order to attract all backgrounds of gamers, Fault will need to have the fit and finish of a AAA-level game. Right now, we have some truly impressive skill sets on our team, but in order to hit the AAA standard, there are tasks that we would prefer be tackled by specialized experts. The next section describes how the money will be utilized. In this way, there is no wasted time nor money. With funds beyond our goal, we will be able to start looking at features well beyond the scope of our current team. This primarily includes brand new character models and animations, as well as brand new level assets that meet the quality expectations of a Paragon-like game. 


     
We already have optimized pipelines for making heroes, items, and improving upon 3D art. So the money received will go into the additional features and content required for the polish and upkeep of the game.


Hero animation and particle effects - We know that the look and feel of the game, especially one similar to Paragon, is paramount. So these funds will allow us to get the expertise needed to polish hero animations and improve particle effects for hero abilities where they are lacking. 

Code-base - Our players deserve a virtually bug-free experience on dedicated servers that run smoothly. Thus, much of the funds will go to getting professional help or consultation for elements in the code that are best-tackled by specialized programmers. With enough funding, our first full-time employee would likely be in this department. 

Servers - The price of servers adds up, especially when running many at once to support quick match load times. You buying an early access key will easily cover your server usage up to the full release of the game (late 2020) and beyond! Based on our current data, we can guarantee that no more that 5% of crowdfunding will go toward this purpose.  

Sound - We want nothing short of Paragon-level sound for upcoming heroes and sound reworks. 

Art - We will need 2D art to fill the item store, menus, and loading screens. Additionally, we will need concept art in order to produce new skins and heroes when we have the funding and pipeline to achieve it.In the interest of transparency, you should also know that any money received for content in Unreal Engine is subject to the 5% royalty fee. This includes crowdfunding. 



     

The satisfaction of supporting the rebirth of your favorite game, but in an even better form! 

Early access - Starts in the first quarter of 2020! Servers will be up 24/7, so play whenever you like! Spread the word too, because in order for Early access to be successful, we will need a lot of players. All Early Access keys come with 5 heroes unlocked by default: Gideon, Sparrow, Steel, Greystone, and Khaimera. Account progression during early access will stay for full release.See the "What costs money and why?" section for more details. 

Holiday access - Dec 20th 8 pm EST to Dec 29th 2 am EST -  Want to play Fault over your Holiday break? How does over a whole week of 24-hour servers sound? You will have to play the Alpha build, which comes with some Alpha-level bugs, but check out some recent gameplay, people are having a blast playing and the extra support we receive can go a LONG way. All holiday players will have ALL HEROES UNLOCKED for the holiday event, after which the heroes will be locked again based on the accounts perk level (for Early Access). Note: These are likely to be North American servers only, unless we sell enough keys to support EU matchmaking as well. Stay tuned! 

Coins - Pay-only currency within Fault. 1000 coins will be roughly equal to $10. We will roll out coin rewards when Early Access starts.

We will try to roll out this reward as the keys get claimed, but this task is low priority and we don't guarantee they will be out until Early Access (so please wait until then to contact us about this reward).

We reserve the right to make a recolor of this skin as an incentive for the launch of console editions of Fault. We will try to roll out this reward as the keys get claimed, but this task is low priority and we don't guarantee they will be out until Early Access (so please wait until then to contact us about this reward). 

Permanently Rename an Item - Yes, that's right, master level supports can collaborate with the Game Designers for Fault to rename an item (of their choice) permanently. The new name must match the style and theme of other items in the store, but each item can be personalized by the backer within reason. The name must be agreed upon by the backer and the Game Designers. Additionally, we will consider engaging such items in the lore of the Fault universe when fitting.

story:
About Tonight we hunt

 

Tonight we hunt is action-platformer videogame based on ecuadorian legends, the gameplay is like classic Castlevania, Megaman and Ninja gaiden games. This game have been development by me, Sebastian Maldonado animator and artist from Quito Ecuador, i always has enjoy to make video games and this is the first great project that i am working.

(Tonight we hunt first mockup)

The game

 

Tonight we hunt gonna have 5 levels,  each level will be different in mechanics, the first level is ready and you can play it on newgrounds.com, is based in a legend from my country called "El demonio de la caja ronca" the demo is in newgrounds.com. Click here to play it

Also you can download the game here.

 

(concept art first level)

I am working on level 2 concept art and game design, is 30% complete, this level is based in a legend from my country (and all south america i think) called "El hombre del saco". levels 3, 4 and 5 are in pre production.

 

(concept art second level)

In this 5 levels we will know about Han, a young hunter that in his first mission must defeat one of the most dangerous demons, The Roaring Box demon, the story of the game are inspired by a lot of ecuadorian legends.

 

 

How can I help, you ask?

I started this project early in 2017, the game is now 30% complete,i need the funding to work full time in this project. I am working on art, programing and story of the game, also the music will be composed by Charlie Andrés Ruiz from Draco and the zodiac.

With financing i will finish the production of level 2, work on levels 3, 4 and 5, also pay the composer of the soundtrack and the distribution of the game on digital store steam.com

I need the funding for different things.

Art: i will work with other artists to create an amazing world, also to create weapons, objects and different stuff.

Animation: In animation i am working frame a frame technique, and this took me a lot of effort and time but the result is amazing.

Programing: I will hire a professional programer to optimize the game, also to make enemies behavior be better.

Sound and Music: i will work with Charlie Andrés Ruiz from Draco and the zodiac to create an amazing soundtrack that you can enjoy.

 

 

Get Cool Perks!

I think offer some special and unique perks. all the items will be made by me (physical editions, artbook and wallpapers) also you can become some of the NPC in the game.

 

 

If i can't get the goal, anyway i will finish the game but it will take me much longer, everything I collect will be used in game development, my goal with this campaign is work full time in this project.

What is unique in this game

This game is based on ecuadorian legends, the characters and enemies are based ecuadorian folklore, i hope that the people can enjoy a game with unique monsters and characters, also in each level the gameplay change a little to offer a great  and original experience.

 

 

Risks

I have been working in this game almost 2 years, because i really trust this is a good idea and a good game, i learned how to draw, animate and programing all by my own, and i sure that i can resolving  the problems that will be in the development of the game because  i really trust in this game.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute don't worry, you can help sharing this campaign, also sharing the demo of the game, the demo is in newgrounds.com. Click here

Also you can download the game here.

story:
Signs of the Sojourner is a narrative deck-building game about connecting and communicating with others. Unlike card-battlers, it challenges you to understand different perspectives and navigate social situations.

Your deck is your character, shaped by your experiences and relationships. Different decks will lead to different narrative paths as your cards impact your ability to communicate with various characters. Rather than building the most "powerful" deck, you will have to make decisions about who you want to be in this world and how you relate to others.

Set in a near-future earth-like world, you take over your mother's store after her death, traveling to diverse locations in order to acquire goods for the shop. This is a world where communities are more insulated, where travel is difficult, and where climate change has made life hard, but you'll still encounter optimistic stories, compassionate characters, and delightful surprises.

Ultimately the tone we're going for is melancholy but hopeful, relaxing and introspective. The world is filled with moments of humor and tenderness, while presenting realistic hardships and conflicts to overcome.

The core of the card game is about matching symbols with the NPC in order to build a connection and have a conversation. Complete a sequence successfully, and the conversation will move forward in a positive way, though ending in discordance will still move your story forward with a meaningful experience. Not only that, but different symbols represent different personality traits and communication styles.

Special ability cards will allow you to manipulate and drive the conversation and provide strategies to deal with symbols you may not yet have in your deck. These also represent character traits and manners of speaking--one character might chatter endlessly, while another diplomatically qualifies and clarifies their statements.

The patterns you form with the NPC will also impact the direction and outcome of the encounter. Agreement and concordance earlier in the exchange can lessen the consequences of later disagreements, while certain misdirections may open up new opportunities.

After each conversation, you are given the opportunity to gain a card from the other character, essentially learning from each experience. Eventually, you'll have even more ways to grow and change your deck, and discover what that means for your character.

Beyond what's in the demo, we have a number of additions planned to add depth without upping the complexity too much. While conversations will always be the central focus, you'll encounter several other event types--surprises while traveling, pit stops on the map, and environmental or communal events that use your deck in different ways. 

Your mother has recently passed away, and you must step into her shoes, traveling and collecting goods to stock in the family store and keep it afloat.

Depending on who you meet and how you interact with folks on the road, your perspective of who your mother was can play out in dramatically different ways. That understanding will trickle down to your relationship with your home in general.

A central theme of the game is that connection to your home and community, and your relationships with Elias and other neighbors:

After each trip, you'll return home with your goods and reconnect with your community. You'll see how your neighbors react to the things you've brought home and potentially attract new visitors to Bartow if you stock the right items.

Will the shop remain a pillar of the community? Will the town remain on the caravan route? Will you remain there at all?

Including your hometown of Bartow, there will be 10+ locations to explore. Each location hosts a small cast of characters with their own communities and stories to uncover. You'll meet fast-talking salesmen, feuding brothers, swindlers, and grouches, but also other young adults just leaving home for the first time, a mother struggling to support her child, spice farmers doing their best in a world that's leaving them behind, and many others.

For the final game, we're planning:

  • 15+ locations to explore
  • 35+ characters to meet
  • 30+ snacks to discover
  • 5+ trips out from home

We will release Signs of the Sojourner no matter what, but flexible crowdfunding will allow us to make it bigger and better based on however much we raise. The sections above describe the minimum of what we plan to add to the current demo. Below is what we'd love to add, but can't on our own. 

We're asking for $50,000 in order to add:

  • Larger main story/more content
  • ~20 total locations
  • ~45 total characters, including some special types
  • Expanded deck-building mechanics
  • New card types
  • New event types
  • Store skins and customizable flyers
  • Truck interior--your home on the road
  • Gibberish-style VO for all characters
  • Additional music - every character has their own musical layers

Many of these goals were drawn from the community, and we want your input to help us make it a game you want to play and the best that it can be. The community has already been incredibly supportive and bursting with ideas we want to make happen--and we're excited to hear from all the new folks we hope will join us on this development journey.

We appreciate any support in making this happen, and have prepared a variety of rewards:

We've been working on the game for 9 months and have put more than we're asking for into the project already, but we need this last bit to make it the best possible version.

We had said we would release the game in 2019, but the addition of these goals will push it into early 2020--well worth a short wait.

Echodog Games is a three-person indie company based in Los Angeles, California. Signs of the Sojourner will be our debut game. Besides the core team, we're very lucky to have found amazing and talented collaborators. Read below for more insight into the team and scroll even further for some audio sneak peeks!

                         

Echodog Games is just the three of us, but we’re collaborating with some really talented people. We have previous experience together as a team, hitting deadlines, shipping games, and using the tools. There can always be unforeseen problems that come up, but at worst Signs of the Sojourner may be delayed, never cancelled.

We will release Signs of the Sojourner no matter what, but flexible crowdfunding will allow us to make it bigger and better based on however much we raise. The sections above describe the minimum of what we plan to add to the current demo. Below is what we'd love to add, but can't on our own. 
We're asking for $50,000 in order to add:

Larger main story/more content
~20 total locations
~45 total characters, including some special types
Expanded deck-building mechanics
New card types
New event types
Store skins and customizable flyers
Truck interior--your home on the road
Gibberish-style VO for all characters
Additional music - every character has their own musical layers

Many of these goals were drawn from the community, and we want your input to help us make it a game you want to play and the best that it can be. The community has already been incredibly supportive and bursting with ideas we want to make happen--and we're excited to hear from all the new folks we hope will join us on this development journey.
We appreciate any support in making this happen, and have prepared a variety of rewards:




We've been working on the game for 9 months and have put more than we're asking for into the project already, but we need this last bit to make it the best possible version.
We had said we would release the game in 2019, but the addition of these goals will push it into early 2020--well worth a short wait.


Echodog Games is a three-person indie company based in Los Angeles, California. Signs of the Sojourner will be our debut game. Besides the core team, we're very lucky to have found amazing and talented collaborators. Read below for more insight into the team and scroll even further for some audio sneak peeks!



                         

Echodog Games is just the three of us, but we’re collaborating with some really talented people. We have previous experience together as a team, hitting deadlines, shipping games, and using the tools. There can always be unforeseen problems that come up, but at worst Signs of the Sojourner may be delayed, never cancelled.

story:
Hi there!

The Global Game Jam® (GGJ®)  is the biggest collaboration of game makers in the world, with an expected 50,000 game developers coming together in physical locations around the world in over 100 countries, creating 10,000 games based on just 1 theme in just 48 hours! Our event running in January 2020 will be the 12th year of GGJ.

Why do we need help?

Running GGJ centrally costs around US$350K a year, including staff costs for our Executive Director, Executive Producer and Technology Manager, as well as web hosting, online tools, video production, GDC related costs and GGJ NEXT costs.

Traditionally this budget has been covered by our sponsors. This year we are really thankful to all of our sponsors, especially our headline sponsor (Thanks Microsoft!), but we still didn’t quite manage to hit our planned fundraising target.

As well as the expected costs, we have been trying hard to plan and save so that we can bring you a fantastic, fresh, new updated website. This means fundraising for this and next year for us is even more important.

What we want to achieve from doing this

Redeveloping the GGJ website is a massive goal, and it comes with a large price tag, so we are turning to our community to help us out with helping to get a little closer to our fundraising goal for 2020.

If every jammer donated just US$1, this would fill the spot of a whole headline sponsor, and it would give us a real boost to get the new web project underway.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to contribute, but we would really appreciate if you could share this campaign with your friends, coworkers, your cat, and anyone else you think might be interested in helping. If you know any companies who might want to come in at at community sponsor level then please do let them know!  

Retweet, share on Facebook, use the Hashtag #GGJFundraiser and use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read our campaign, and if you are taking part in a jam for 2020, we hope you have a great one! <3

story:
About us!

We are a small indie studio located in the PNW, made up of 7 freshly graduated game dev students from Lake Washington Institute of Technology. Making it in this industry is tough. Getting your name and your game out into the world and in the hands of players is truly the dream of any Game Developer. So, we started our own studio from the ground up so we could make our dreams come true! That's where this campaign AND YOU come in! 

We need help with things like licensing, software, hardware and so on. All the bells and whistles to make this game ALL it can be!  

About IO!

Project IO is a first-person, survival horror video game set in the late 1950's, with an emphasis on exploration and narrative.

Players control a Journalist following up on a developing story at a new-age, high tech meat processing plant.

With only a flashlight to help guide you through the recently abandoned facility, you must follow the clues to discover what happened at this once prestigious factory. 

Gameplay:

  • Solve puzzles and avoid detection
  • Armed with only a flashlight, use it to uncover secrets and survive
  • Use the environment pieces around you to distract and confuse your enemies
  • Avoid letting the tension get to you
  • ​Stay quiet, try not to run.

Platforms:

  • Windows
  • Steam 
  • Xbox One

Check out our website! http://www.t124studios.com

What our team needs:

  • Help paying for our licenses! Maya/Unity/Substance and so on
  • Help paying for equipment/hardware! 
  • Help paying to get our name out there! Marketing is a huge part of getting an indie game off the ground. We can use all the help we can get to get our game out into the world and into the hands of people who LOVE horror survival games! 

 

What you get in return:

The Impact

For many of us on the team this will be our first opportunity to publish the game we've been so tirelessly working on. For the last year we have been building the world, the story, the experience and we just need a little help to get us to the finish line. Finally having the opportunity to share our interactive survival-horror story with the world. We BELIEVE in this game. We WILL finish this game. You can help us make this dream a reality by donating to our campaign.

Risks & Challenges

Our team is made up of hardworking full time employees that are full time employed outside of our studio. We continue to work on IO in our "free" time because we are passionate about the experience we are creating. 

Keeping this in mind we have a very tight and diligent production schedule and have worked out many of our pipeline kinks to keep production up and with the most efficient workflow.

** Our studio does NOT practice crunch culture, we value our devs as humans and their health and well being ALWAYS comes first **

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share our campaign on social media! Help us get the word out! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Follow us on social media!
