story:
Is this a joke?

No, we are actually making this game.  The security of our airlines is NOT a joke!

We have already created a successful VR game and have the team and skills to make it happen.

Gameplay

This game is important because it can be a great training tool for future flight attendants.  Not every flight attendant has formal training in martial arts, and without martial arts skills the world's flight attendants are ill prepared for their jobs in the current airline industry.  Voluntary Disembarkment can be the perfect training tool.

Game Features:

  • Find "volunteer" passengers hiding in their seats. Bonus points for passengers with lower ticket prices.
  • Knock out the volunteer with your fists, luggage from over head bins, or even the coffee pot.
  • Everything item on the plane is interactable.  That includes the snack cart, luggage, passengers, the cockpit, you name it.
  • Drag the volunteer through the aisle and toss them out the exit doors.  The farther the throw the more points you get.  Make sure you find and toss their luggage as well.
  • Start on a small bi-plane and work your way up to Commercial Airlines.
  • Passengers annoyance level increase as the game goes on, causing them to start demanding rights.  Remind them of their "rights" with a swift punch to the jaw and collect bonus points.
  • Collect rewards form the CEO for abusing your power.
  • Final Boss: Voluntarily disembark the CEO from his private jet.

Image a mix between Job Simulator, Drunken Bar Fight, and Baby Toss.  Every item on the plane will be interactable, some people will fight back, and every person can be tossed off the plane with no regard to their civil liberties or human rights.

As a contributor you can help us train flight attendants and airport security of tomorrow in proper disermbarkment techniques.  You cannot stop airlines from beating you, so why not invest in ensuring they do it properly: violently and without mercy.

Progress Photos

 

What We Need and Why we need it.

We are going to need a humble $30,000 to build the game.  That may seem like a lot, but when you factor in the costs of 3d models, development time, and the corporate lawsuits this project will inevitably lead to, we are probably better off being forcefully re-accommodated.  

The game is in the works, but the more funds we can raise the better experience we can produce.  That means better graphics, more game modes, more realistic blood when passengers "fall down".

The Impact

Executives, politicians and other authority figures get to abuse their power on a daily basis.   Most of us have morals holding us back.  Voluntary Disembarkment give you the experience of abusing your power without worrying about the moral or ethical considerations.  

The violence of our previous experience building a boxing VR game, will directly translate into creating the most realistic experience as a flight attendant on a corporate airliner.  We have also spent countless hours being delayed, lied to, and generally annoyed on planes.  This first-hand experience will help us create an accurate representation of the VR passengers annoyance levels.  Voluntary Disembarkment will be the boldest, most realistic flight attendant experience ever created.

Rewards

Everyone who contributes to our IndieGoGo (enough to qualify for the first reward) will receive the full game of Voluntary Disembarkment and all of its updates free, forever until the final release! The game is currently in its alpha stage. We plan on developing it over the next couple years yet, so there is much more to come. It will be digital download only.  There are many other rewards such as:

  • Naming in-game content
  • All the luggage will have various stickers on them.  You get to make your own design that we will slap on the luggage in the overhead bin.
  • Extra airliners that only our supporters will be able to access.
  • Custom t-shirts
  • Branded mouth guards to for future travel
  • Useless $50 Vouchers

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise Voluntary Disembarkment.
  • Send it to your friends, share it on facebook, write about it on your blog.
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools.

What if you do not reach your goal?

Last December our flight to Florida, USA was delayed over 3 hours in Dublin, Ireland.  It was a major headache.  On the bright side, we recently received a $1000 check from the airline thanks to the superior consumer rights in Europe. Unfortunately most countries, such as the United States, do not have those kind of protections.  In fact, you can be assaulted for being a customer.  We see the current events in the airline industry and our experience developing for VR as an opportunity to make a fun satirical game and raise awareness for consumer rights.

The more money we raise the more time we can dedicate to creating more environments and game modes and developing top of the line visual effects.   We believe will add more replay value to the game and improve the chances of our game becoming official training material of airlines everywhere.  

Once we finish Voluntary Disembarkment, we will donate 100% of the extra funds to a consumer rights organization protecting airline passengers, such as FlyersRights.org.  If we do not raise enough funds to complete the game, all proceeds will be donated.

story:
ENRICHED, DIGITAL MEMORIALS

The challenge of memorialisation is how to bring those memories to life and how to tell those stories to a new generation. Now through advances in technology, we have the opportunity to reinvent how we do things.

Instead of staring at the anonymous face of a memorial or headstone we can combine the latest technology to blend with the traditional and create an interactive and ongoing legacy for our loved ones for all time.

Through innovation and application of exciting new technologies like augmented reality we can create that has never been seen before in this space. All you need is a smart device with a camera and an Internet connection and you’re good to go.

WHERE IT ALL STARTED

The inspiration behind this project was my mother. When I lost her to cancer in 1997 it was devastating. I took great comfort in listening to her voicemails on my phone when I visited the cemetery.

This became something of a ritual for me, which meant I kept that mobile phone for over ten years. Then the technology didn’t allow for downloads or transfers. When that phone was stolen I had to go through the grieving process all over again.

That incredible loss made me realise that technology had changed so radically over the last decade yet that headstones and memorials has basically remained unchanged for thousands of years.


QR CODES & BEYOND

I developed Eternal Memoria to create permanent online memorials that celebrate the lives of our lost loved ones. Using QR code technology we link any memorial to a dedicated virtual archive that family and friends can update with images, video, audio, testimonials and more. As great as that is, it’s just the start…

I want to use technology to take it to the next level and reshape our ideas about memorialisation. Using that same QR code you can download a our E-ternal  app to your smart device, so when you look through it, at a memorial or headstone a video will overlay that memorial turning the surface into a virtual screen, giving life to those memories that has never been seen before in this space.

You call it augmented reality. We call it a living memory.



WHY DO WE NEED AR MEMORIALS

  • We want to change the way people think about memorialisation
  • We want the people being memorialised to be able to tell their own stories
  • We want to take that which was static and anonymous and create something interactive and immersive
  • We provide the means to facilitate the continuation of perception management as a legacy
  • We want to bring wonder and excitement to areas which are traditionally associated with sadness
  • We want to make memorials that people want to come and see, to come and hear, and then to feel


WE WANT YOU!

We’ve finished the prototype. Now we need you to jump on board so we can move into production sooner and create the most immersive and interactive way to deliver memorialisation that’s ever been done before.

We have a campaign goal of $30,000 so we can make the E-ternal app a reality. The future is already here; we just need you to bring it directly to your smart device.

With worldwide patents pending, we are set to revolutionise the memorialisation industry.

Your contribution will be used directly to:

  • Build the downloadable version of the E-ternal app for iPhone and Android devices

  • Licence our augmented reality platforms for E-ternal

  • Secure our worldwide patents for E-ternal

We want to make this the best app of its kind, so your support is greatly needed and appreciated. Your contributions will ensure we can create, make and test the most groundbreaking version of our app.



I am a graduate of the New Venture Institute's Venture Dorm program. This intensive entrepreneurial program is run by Flinders University in Adelaide, South Australia and provided me with the platform to incubate and launch my idea and secure my first customers. I self-funded my permanent online memorial business and successfully launched Eternal Memoria in mid-2016. Eternal Memoria has gained great momentum in a traditional space that has been slow to innovate.



I will continue to self-fund the development of my E-ternal app, but you supporting me now means I get there that much faster!

There has been and will continue to be challenges and resistance as we blaze a trail in the traditional space of memorialisation. I strongly believe that AR will greatly enrich the experience at the cemetery or memorial. Funding this campaign is a chance to break new ground and adopt a new technology never seen before in this space.

And just because you can’t contribute you can still help is make E-ternal a reality.

  • Share on your social networks

  • Like our Facebook page and YouTube channel

  • Check out the Indiegogo share tools and start spreading the word!


'How we are remembered matters more than how we live our lives'

Nizar Rasheed

story:
Vermont Gaming Lounge

VGL will be Vermont's premier place for virtual reality.  Hosting two treadmill apparatus' equipped with the HTC Vive Virtual Reality Headset, We will be able to offer the most immersive experience available to date.  The company consists of two brothers, Jamie Danaher and Adam Fletcher, equal partners, who have gamed since they could hold a controller.  We have a combined experience of 20 years in PC repair, 10 years of Web Design and Marketing, and 50 years of gaming experience.

Vermont Gaming Lounge will be more  than a place to try out VR.  We specifically put "lounge" in the name because we want people to come and hang out.  As much as we are a store, we desire to be so much more.  Developing talent in gamers, helping them get sponsored,  and hosting local tournaments, will be key tenets of our store.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Vermont Gaming Lounge needs your help:

  • We are trying to raise $6000 to cover the cost of opening the store, the purchase of the VR Units and peripheral equipment, Store initial inventory and related expenses.
  • We have several tiers of rewards for donations.
  • If we don't reach our goal, the project will continue, but may be delayed as we entertain other financing options or other obstacles.
  • If we exceed our goal, we will be increasing the number of VR setups.

When you contribute to Vermont Gaming Lounge, you are making a direct impact on the realization of VR in VT.  

  • There is no place like it in Vermont
  • Our team is passionate about VR and Gaming
  • We're making VR affordable
  • We will buy and sell used consoles and games
  • We promise to match the price of any competitor in the local area for our games

Risks & Challenges

Something like this has never been accomplished in Vermont.  This means that we are paving the way, and may stumble or hit a roadblock at times.  We are committed to seeing the realization of this store, but can't guarantee it, as other outside factors may prohibit us from doing so.  Some of these factors may include commercial license agreements from Steam, HTC, EA, and others.  We have agreements in the works with some publishers, but others have yet to respond. There may also be other hidden or as yet unknown obstacles to our success, which we wiil  try to overcome.  We promise to be transparent and update the campaign daily.

**EDIT**  Our updates are posted on our facebook page! Come check it out!

 https://www.facebook.com/VermontGaming/

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!  We know not everyone will donate, but if you can get our message out there, you'll be helping is in the next best way! We are also looking for donations of older consoles, games, and accessories.  Please share this page, post it to social media, tell your friends, share it with the mail carrier!  Indiegogo has some great share tools at your disposal, help us grow our sphere of influence!

 

THANK YOU!

We are also looking for donations of older consoles, games, and accessories.  Please share this page, post it to social media, tell your friends, share it with the mail carrier!  Indiegogo has some great share tools at your disposal, help us grow our sphere of influence!
 
THANK YOU!

story:
Equis Digital Studio

We are a fairly new game development studio and have been on the market for approximately one year.

  • Game development is our passion. we grew up playing games and now we make our own.
  • Swords of Colossus is our newest creation and perhaps our favorite one, with nearly two hundred hours in development since mid March 2016. With a estimated release date of Q1 2017 we still have a lot of work ahead of us.
  • By helping us and contributing you can keep us developing games, avoid delays and most important, realize our dream to bring you high standard quality games.

We wouldn't have made it this far without the help of a really talented musician called Clayton Stroup. Clayton from the start hit off with the perfect tracks for our game but not only that he was humble enough to join in on a revenue share deal knowing we could be in for all or nothing.

Thank you Clayton!

Production Costs

We've estimated the following costs during phase one of development: $1200

  • 50% Goes to Clayton Stroup for composing over 8 different tracks to the game so far. Getting Clayton paid is important to us because he deserves every single penny for the amazing work he has done.
  • $35 for copyright costs.
  • $100 will be used for Google Play store. (Android Version)
  • $100 will be used for the Apple developers key. (IOS version)
  • $100 will be used in applying for the Steam green. (Win, Mac versions)
  • $265 will be used to pay for the manufacturing of limited game related products such as T-shirts, figures and other memorabilia.
  • If the total goal is not reached we would like to use 80% of the funds to pay for music and art created so far and hold back on less urgent steps.

The Impact

No amount is too small!

  • If not successfully funded, we would like to create a free browser version of the game. (downside is extend loading periods due to streaming. But it's free!)
  • If 600 viewers chose to donate $2 we would reach our goal incredible fast!
  • Help us achieve this dream and share Swords of Colossus with the world on Computers and Smartphones.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest fear is production delays due to budget.

  • We must keep moving forward with production.
  • We will not allow budget to affect the quality of the game, even if it means delaying release for a few months.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

  • Please share this with friends and family.
  • Please share on social media.

And that's all there is to it. Thank you for taking your time!

story:
Because Why not?

I've always wanted to build an ultimate high-end pc like this before, and now it can be possible with your help!
I will record the building process and upload it to youtube so you'll see how I spent your money.

The parts

As you can see I set the funding goal on the exact amount of money I need for this project. Including Indiegogo's fee.

Why can't I do this from my own money?

With my salary, it would take my 21 months at least to get this amount of money. (If I save every penny, but then I would die from starving)
If I only count the money I can acctually save monthly (wich is $50-$60) It would take at least 140 months. Yes that is 11,5 years. I guess you get it why I can't finance this project on my own.

Why backing this project is good for you?

I don't know. Maybe you'll feel better by making me smile. :) (<-See? I'm smiling already, because I know You're a good person.)

story:
In a Nutshell

MMOExaminer was created by a group of journalists who got fed up with having to read gaming news articles that are clearly influenced by outside factors and do not necessarily present the truth. We plan to create a completely truthful, direct and honest news source that will bring you facts and not sponsored information. 

What is MMOExaminer?


MMOExaminer is currently a newborn project that needs YOUR help to grow. We are a team of professional journalists who strive to reshape the current state of video gaming journalism. We want to create a news portal where news are not influenced by sponsors and where you will get what you came for. 

Quality & Experience

We are all writers who have worked with well-known MMO news sites, like the creator of the project who is a full-time writer at MMOSite.com. Based on our previous experiences we have plenty of past mistakes we can learn from and we now know how we can satisfy our readers. 

We Are Gamers Too

Journalists often attempt to write about topics that they are unfamiliar with and do their best to put together information from various sources just to complete an article. We are different. All the writers at MMOExaminer are both journalists and veteran gamers who have been playing since the 90s. Because of this, we can combine our gaming knowledge with our experiences in journalism and produce articles that accurately cover any topic that is related to the industry.

What do we offer?

We want to provide our readers with the chance to read articles about MMO Games that inform accurately and right on time. We will be constantly interviewing gamers, developers and publishers to enable you to get a clear picture of gaming industries. We do not wish to write our posts based on what other sites have written, we wish to obtain information right from the original source so that we can write articles that contain unaltered details.

Global Monitoring

We will be hiring people from all around the world in order to be able to provide gaming news from various regions, from East to West. We will be covering NA and EU developed games as well as Asian MMOs and much more. 

News 24/7

MMOExaminer will provide you with posts all day long, regardless of your timezone. We have journalists from various parts of the world who will post articles on a daily basis without a break. 



MMOExaminer consists of journalists with a great experience who had worked for sites like MMOSite and because of this, we will be able to provide you with high-quality posts that are carefully formulated and proofread. No lazy, short posts that are full of errors and typos. Every single article will be checked.

Constant Content

MMOExaminer will provide you with something to read every day, every hour. You will be able to check back all day and find something new to discover. We will cover all sorts of MMO categories from MMORPGS to MOBAs, online shooters, online sports games and much more. We will also be covering retro games to satisfy veteran gamers.

Streamer Support

If we manage to reach our goal on IndieGogo, not only will we pay attention to streamers. but we will also strive to promote them and even sponsor them. We will launch a section on MMOExaminer.com where streamers can apply to get sponsored, and we will do our best to help them.



The current video gaming journalism is packed with posts that are heavily influenced by sponsors. This results in inaccurate presentations of MMO games that do not inform the readers the way they should. At MMOExaminer, all of our reviews, previews, discussions and news posts will be uninfluenced by any external entity. We will tell you the truth whether it's good or bad. We will be posting news without being influenced by advertisers, publishers and developers.

We Will Listen

MMOExaminer will be interactive. We will be constantly communicating with you guys in order to meet your demands and cover the things that you want to read about. We will listen to feedback and take criticism as something to build our development upon.

We Will Communicate With Gamers

It is the gamers that keep the industry alive, and we want to let our readers see what other gamers think. How they see games, new content, eSports, how they beat endgame and so on. We will be interviewing gamers from a variety of MMO games on a daily basis.

No Ridiculous Giveaways

When we run a giveaway, it will be something you guys actually want to get. We recently began our first event through which we are giving away an actual World of Warcraft Legion Expansion to a lucky reader. We will strive to reward our readers with nifty gifts that will put a smile on your face.


MMOExaminer needs your support to be able to create a quality news source. To be able to employ professional and skilled journalists we need to be able to pay them. Our current funds will not be able to keep us going for a long time and because of this, we decided that Indiegogo is the right place to ask for help. 

We are also in need of a far better website system that can allow readers to fully enjoy our content and to get informed efficiently. If our fundraiser goal is fulfilled we will build a completely new site that will have all the necessary functions of a gaming news portal. 

As you can see from our rewards section, those who support us will not go unnoticed. We will be doing our best to become worthy of your support and to create such a unique gaming news portal that will stand out from the current generic video gaming journalism lineup. 

The funds that we receive from this Indiegogo project will all go into paying our writers, travelling to gaming related events and maintaining the website. We want to provide quality service, and for that, investments are necessary. 


Journalism is a dirty business with plenty of obstacles that need to be handled. Writers can end up leaving and we have to consider the fact that we might not be able to obtain enough funds for our project. But our team is very optimistic, and because we are all experienced journalists we know that our plans will succeed, one way or another. There are technical challenges that we must overcome, and those can often result in delays, but since we all know what we are doing, the chances are very low.

story:
Research tells us that parents consistently over estimate their child’s happiness.   And with teenagers, who knows?   The last person they want to share anything with is a parent.   So how do parents stay on top of their child’s well-being but more importantly ensure their emotional resiliency?   They turn them on to K’Bro! Here’s a chance to give your child a game that’s good for them and fun all at the same time.  K’Bro teaches emotional literacy, self-advocacy and better coping skills.

At K’Bro, we’re committed to giving kids, and parents, the tools to be able to recognize when children need an intervention either by a trusted peer, parent or therapist.  As the child plays the “Am I OK?” game or uses other features in the app, K’Bro anonymously captures data about your child’s emotional state that informs the “Am I OK?” index.   We use artificial intelligence much the way Siri works today to analyze when your child’s behavior is worrisome and when it’s not.   Parents can choose to subscribe to K’Bro to receive weekly updates and alerts if warranted with conversation starter tips.  Actual comments by kids remain private protecting their privacy and willingness to share.  K’Bro is always free to kids so they will know for themselves if they’re doing OK and use the many features within K’Bro to build emotional resiliency all on their own.

Introducing K’Bro

K’Bro is an emotional resiliency app that is addictingly fun to play while developing skills to manage difficulties in a child’s life.  Moreover, it can be an early indicator that something is not quite right, facilitating parental engagement and other interventions.

Part game/part anonymous sharing/part knowledgebase, K’Bro is a safe place to share your thoughts and emotions and get advice on how to deal with life’s challenges while getting validation on how well you’re doing through the “Am I OK?” index.

Deep learning using semantic search and natural language processing of emotions expressed and issues raised via anonymous sharing will produce a daily “Am I OK?” index score to let kids and their parents know how well they’re doing, alerting parents when there is cause for concern.

K’Bro Am I OK? Game

K’Bro captures four emotions out of 12 (six positive options and six negative options) for four categories in a child’s life:  School, Family Life, Social Life and Everything Else.   This helps K’Bro pinpoint if a child is not doing OK and which aspect of their life is where they’re having issues.   For example, grades may be falling, but it’s really the relationship with their coach that’s at issue.  The game is "addictingly" fun because once they’ve shared their emotions, they play a fun runner game competing with their friends to see who captures the most acorns. And their positive use of the game is rewarded with additional acorns.

K’Bro Deal With It! Feature

K’Bro provides a knowledge base dedicated to adolescent topics to help kids figure out to handle things on their own.  If they don’t find the answer they’re looking for, they can ask the My Tribe community anonymously how other kids have handled similar issues.   Kids get the chance to vote “good idea” or “bad idea” on feedback others provide and to block anyone whose answer seem inappropriate.

K’Bro Speak Up! Feature

K’Bro created “Speak Up!” to help kids practice advocating for themselves.  In many ways, it’s the letter you write to process your emotions but never send. It’s also the opportunity to provide positive or negative feedback to someone as part of self-advocacy even with you the parent!   Kids have the option of asking My Tribe to provide feedback on their response by rating it “Helpful” or “Hurtful” to ensure your child sends a productive message to accomplish their self-advocacy goal.

 

K’Bro What’s Up? Feature

What’s Up? is where kids get to practice gratitude on a daily basis.   Each day they’ll be asked three questions to highlight what’s going right in their life.   If they have a “not so OK day” on the index, they’ll be reminded of all the stuff that’s going right to help give them the emotional boost they need to start to feel better.

What kids say about K’Bro

It's a great app that helps kids who suffer with family, school, and daily issues and it comes with an addictingly fun mini game.

I found this to be a fun, addicting game!

It helps you get through tough times, and keeps your parents off your back with their checking in daily.

A game that lets you ask questions that you wouldn't talk to your friends or parents about.

Important app about communication and how you feel.

A good way to help you feel better or just try to get friends to beat my score.

What parents say about K’Bro

As a parent, I would pay any amount of money for my child's health & happiness.

Emotional health and resiliency in my teens is very important to me – I’d pay even more to ensure that for my children.

It would be good for my child to be more aware of his feelings and options and to get support from sources other than his parents.

If my child would use it, I see benefits from it. Teens can be oppositional, especially if the recommendation is coming from their parent.

Kids need avenues to freely express themselves without being judged or supervised by a parent. It sounds like this would be a great vehicle for kids to be honest with themselves and gain better self-awareness.

 

The Science of K’Bro and Why It Works

 

Emotional resiliency is all about being able to bounce back when things get tough. We can’t stop our kids from experiencing stressors, but we can teach them the tools to successfully navigate their increasingly complex lives.  K’Bro’s mindfulness-based check-ins help youth learn to identify, express, and regulate their emotions in a healthy way.

 

Where the funds will go?

  • 20% will go to enhancing game play to keep the game engaging and increasing in-app features
  • 40% will go to conducting efficacy testing and refining the predictive analytics of the Am I OK? index
  • 40% will go to enhancing the conversation starter tips for parents to make them more specific while maintaining the child's privacy

The Impact

Childhood mental disorders that alter the way children learn, behave and cope with their emotions affect 13% to 20% of youths under age 18, according to the CDC. They also cost families and society at large an estimated $247 billion a year in treatment, special education, juvenile justice and decreased productivity.

While the prevalence, early onset and impact on society make childhood mental problems a major public health issue, only 21% of affected children actually get treatment because of a national shortage of pediatric subspecialists and child and adolescent psychiatrists, according to the American Academy of Child & Adolescent Psychiatry.

Suicide and substance abuse are on the rise.   Suicide is one of the leading causes of death in the U.S. with boys ages 10 to 14 showing the 2nd highest increase in suicide rates.   Suicide is a cry for help that is often heard too late to be helpful.   While we now that people inherit a predisposition towards addition, neuroscience has found that it is extremely common for people with addictions to have a reduced capacity for dealing with emotional distress because somewhere along the way, they either didn’t develop or due to trauma lost their emotional resiliency.

Making matters worse, fewer medical students are specializing in children’s mental health careers, while the current crop of professionals are aging out of the workforce. The dearth of providers means troubled youngsters in underserved rural and urban areas are less likely to get timely care.

THE VOID:   Of the approximately 35 million children ages 9 to 17, 21 percent, or more than 7 million, have a diagnosable mental or addictive disorder that causes at least minimal impairment and don’t receive treatment.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge to K'Bro is building a large enough database to tune the data model to accurately report a child's status on the Am I OK? index and to provide the most insightful conversation starter tips for parents.   Deep learning and semantic analysis - aspects of artificial intelligence - are quite mature as a technology and K'Bro is being advised by technological leaders in this space.   The more data is added the more accurate the index becomes.   K'Bro will work with "gold standard" assessment tools until we have achieved the reliability to meet validity standards.  The app has beneficial aspects to youth without the index but the index is critical to the parent subscription.  The challenge is a "when" problem, not an "if" problem.

Meet the Team

Patrina Mack is CEO and founder of K’Bro

Patrina is a board member of the Mental Research Institute.  Prior to founding K’Bro Patrina founded Vision & Execution in 1999.  V&E served its clients as interim sales, marketing and product development support for global clients.  Prior to that she lead the SaaS product development for NetGravity launching globally through IPO until being acquired by Doubleclick.   Before that she led new product initiatives domestically and internationally for PacTel Corporation through its spinoff and IPO to become AirTouch.

Cailin Currie is K'Bro's Clinical Trial Director

Cailin is PhD Candidate in Applied Developmental Psychology and Instructor at Portland State University.  Her area of study and practice has focused on assessments that are developmentally calibrated to investigating the unique perspective of adolescents.  She has experience in all areas of large research projects including grant writing, survey creation and measurement work, development of study design and measurement creation, qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis.

As part of her clinical research she has worked on large multi-million dollar grants from institutions including the William T grant Foundation, Gates foundation, Howard Hughes Medical Institute, and NIH on school-based program assessments on children and adolescents social, emotional, and psychological functioning.  She has also created partnerships with stakeholders in the public schools, universities, and businesses.  Her training as a researcher is supplemented by previous experience working in institutionalized settings as a unit coordinator and staff developer at a 99 bed residential mental health facility before beginning her research training.

Louis Monier, Technical Advisor

Louis Monier was a founder of the Internet search engine AltaVista. After he left AltaVista, he worked at eBay and then at Google. He left Google in August 2007 to join Cuil, a search engine startup. He was Vice President of Products at Cuil. He also was the co-founder and CTO of Qwiki with Doug Imbruce. Qwiki won the TechCrunch Disrupt Award in 2010  and was recently sold to Yahoo.   Louis was the Chief Scientist of Proximic until July 2013, and then founded a health technology company, Kyron.  He is currently Chief Scientist at Import.io and serves as Advisor, Investor and Deep Learning Faculty member at Holberton School in San Francisco.

Monier received a Ph.D. in Mathematics and Computer Science from the University of Paris XI, France in 1980 and worked at Carnegie Mellon University, Xerox PARC, and DEC's Western Research Laboratory.

 Greg Renard, Technical Advisor

Grégory “Redo” Renard is CTO & Chief Visionary Officer at xBrain, and previously was CIO at Wygwam sarl, Usilink, Regional Director at Microsoft, and Professor at ISEN.   Grégory began his career in 1996 in academic research around new technologies and created his first company in 1997 in the field of web development.   Greg is an expert in artificial intelligence and big data working on unsupervised deep learning, bot, personal assistant, connected things and voice/semantic search for more than 15 years.

Through his professional activities in the various companies he created, his publications (books, blogs, etc.) and conferences, he is recognized as an expert on computer technologies (especially from Microsoft with the title of Most Valuable Professional since 2003 and as Regional Director since 2006) then as a futurist and architect of innovations.

Grégory continues to advise many large companies on their strategy and organization innovation.  He is also a professional technical futurist speaker in different European universities and corporate events in France, Europe, and US.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the campaign you can still make a difference!

  • Please help us get the word out and share with schools, parent's groups, sports organizations and other groups involved with adolescents.
  • It's easy to do using the Indiegogo share tools!

    

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Research tells us that parents consistently over estimate their child’s happiness.   And with teenagers, who knows?   The last person they want to share anything with is a parent.   So how do parents stay on top of their child’s well-being but more importantly ensure their emotional resiliency?   They turn them on to K’Bro! Here’s a chance to give your child a game that’s good for them and fun all at the same time.  K’Bro teaches emotional literacy, self-advocacy and better coping skills.
At K’Bro, we’re committed to giving kids, and parents, the tools to be able to recognize when children need an intervention either by a trusted peer, parent or therapist.  As the child plays the “Am I OK?” game or uses other features in the app, K’Bro anonymously captures data about your child’s emotional state that informs the “Am I OK?” index.   We use artificial intelligence much the way Siri works today to analyze when your child’s behavior is worrisome and when it’s not.   Parents can choose to subscribe to K’Bro to receive weekly updates and alerts if warranted with conversation starter tips.  Actual comments by kids remain private protecting their privacy and willingness to share.  K’Bro is always free to kids so they will know for themselves if they’re doing OK and use the many features within K’Bro to build emotional resiliency all on their own.
Introducing K’Bro

K’Bro is an emotional resiliency app that is addictingly fun to play while developing skills to manage difficulties in a child’s life.  Moreover, it can be an early indicator that something is not quite right, facilitating parental engagement and other interventions.
Part game/part anonymous sharing/part knowledgebase, K’Bro is a safe place to share your thoughts and emotions and get advice on how to deal with life’s challenges while getting validation on how well you’re doing through the “Am I OK?” index.
Deep learning using semantic search and natural language processing of emotions expressed and issues raised via anonymous sharing will produce a daily “Am I OK?” index score to let kids and their parents know how well they’re doing, alerting parents when there is cause for concern.
K’Bro Am I OK? Game

K’Bro captures four emotions out of 12 (six positive options and six negative options) for four categories in a child’s life:  School, Family Life, Social Life and Everything Else.   This helps K’Bro pinpoint if a child is not doing OK and which aspect of their life is where they’re having issues.   For example, grades may be falling, but it’s really the relationship with their coach that’s at issue.  The game is "addictingly" fun because once they’ve shared their emotions, they play a fun runner game competing with their friends to see who captures the most acorns. And their positive use of the game is rewarded with additional acorns.
K’Bro Deal With It! Feature

K’Bro provides a knowledge base dedicated to adolescent topics to help kids figure out to handle things on their own.  If they don’t find the answer they’re looking for, they can ask the My Tribe community anonymously how other kids have handled similar issues.   Kids get the chance to vote “good idea” or “bad idea” on feedback others provide and to block anyone whose answer seem inappropriate.
K’Bro Speak Up! Feature

K’Bro created “Speak Up!” to help kids practice advocating for themselves.  In many ways, it’s the letter you write to process your emotions but never send. It’s also the opportunity to provide positive or negative feedback to someone as part of self-advocacy even with you the parent!   Kids have the option of asking My Tribe to provide feedback on their response by rating it “Helpful” or “Hurtful” to ensure your child sends a productive message to accomplish their self-advocacy goal.
 
K’Bro What’s Up? Feature

What’s Up? is where kids get to practice gratitude on a daily basis.   Each day they’ll be asked three questions to highlight what’s going right in their life.   If they have a “not so OK day” on the index, they’ll be reminded of all the stuff that’s going right to help give them the emotional boost they need to start to feel better.
What kids say about K’Bro
It's a great app that helps kids who suffer with family, school, and daily issues and it comes with an addictingly fun mini game.
I found this to be a fun, addicting game!
It helps you get through tough times, and keeps your parents off your back with their checking in daily.
A game that lets you ask questions that you wouldn't talk to your friends or parents about.
Important app about communication and how you feel.
A good way to help you feel better or just try to get friends to beat my score.
What parents say about K’Bro
As a parent, I would pay any amount of money for my child's health & happiness.
Emotional health and resiliency in my teens is very important to me – I’d pay even more to ensure that for my children.
It would be good for my child to be more aware of his feelings and options and to get support from sources other than his parents.
If my child would use it, I see benefits from it. Teens can be oppositional, especially if the recommendation is coming from their parent.
Kids need avenues to freely express themselves without being judged or supervised by a parent. It sounds like this would be a great vehicle for kids to be honest with themselves and gain better self-awareness.
 
The Science of K’Bro and Why It Works

 
Emotional resiliency is all about being able to bounce back when things get tough. We can’t stop our kids from experiencing stressors, but we can teach them the tools to successfully navigate their increasingly complex lives.  K’Bro’s mindfulness-based check-ins help youth learn to identify, express, and regulate their emotions in a healthy way.
 

Where the funds will go?

20% will go to enhancing game play to keep the game engaging and increasing in-app features
40% will go to conducting efficacy testing and refining the predictive analytics of the Am I OK? index
40% will go to enhancing the conversation starter tips for parents to make them more specific while maintaining the child's privacy


The Impact
Childhood mental disorders that alter the way children learn, behave and cope with their emotions affect 13% to 20% of youths under age 18, according to the CDC. They also cost families and society at large an estimated $247 billion a year in treatment, special education, juvenile justice and decreased productivity.
While the prevalence, early onset and impact on society make childhood mental problems a major public health issue, only 21% of affected children actually get treatment because of a national shortage of pediatric subspecialists and child and adolescent psychiatrists, according to the American Academy of Child & Adolescent Psychiatry.
Suicide and substance abuse are on the rise.   Suicide is one of the leading causes of death in the U.S. with boys ages 10 to 14 showing the 2nd highest increase in suicide rates.   Suicide is a cry for help that is often heard too late to be helpful.   While we now that people inherit a predisposition towards addition, neuroscience has found that it is extremely common for people with addictions to have a reduced capacity for dealing with emotional distress because somewhere along the way, they either didn’t develop or due to trauma lost their emotional resiliency.
Making matters worse, fewer medical students are specializing in children’s mental health careers, while the current crop of professionals are aging out of the workforce. The dearth of providers means troubled youngsters in underserved rural and urban areas are less likely to get timely care.
THE VOID:   Of the approximately 35 million children ages 9 to 17, 21 percent, or more than 7 million, have a diagnosable mental or addictive disorder that causes at least minimal impairment and don’t receive treatment. 

Risks & Challenges
The main challenge to K'Bro is building a large enough database to tune the data model to accurately report a child's status on the Am I OK? index and to provide the most insightful conversation starter tips for parents.   Deep learning and semantic analysis - aspects of artificial intelligence - are quite mature as a technology and K'Bro is being advised by technological leaders in this space.   The more data is added the more accurate the index becomes.   K'Bro will work with "gold standard" assessment tools until we have achieved the reliability to meet validity standards.  The app has beneficial aspects to youth without the index but the index is critical to the parent subscription.  The challenge is a "when" problem, not an "if" problem.

Meet the Team
Patrina Mack is CEO and founder of K’Bro
Patrina is a board member of the Mental Research Institute.  Prior to founding K’Bro Patrina founded Vision & Execution in 1999.  V&E served its clients as interim sales, marketing and product development support for global clients.  Prior to that she lead the SaaS product development for NetGravity launching globally through IPO until being acquired by Doubleclick.   Before that she led new product initiatives domestically and internationally for PacTel Corporation through its spinoff and IPO to become AirTouch.
Cailin Currie is K'Bro's Clinical Trial Director
Cailin is PhD Candidate in Applied Developmental Psychology and Instructor at Portland State University.  Her area of study and practice has focused on assessments that are developmentally calibrated to investigating the unique perspective of adolescents.  She has experience in all areas of large research projects including grant writing, survey creation and measurement work, development of study design and measurement creation, qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis.
As part of her clinical research she has worked on large multi-million dollar grants from institutions including the William T grant Foundation, Gates foundation, Howard Hughes Medical Institute, and NIH on school-based program assessments on children and adolescents social, emotional, and psychological functioning.  She has also created partnerships with stakeholders in the public schools, universities, and businesses.  Her training as a researcher is supplemented by previous experience working in institutionalized settings as a unit coordinator and staff developer at a 99 bed residential mental health facility before beginning her research training.
Louis Monier, Technical Advisor
Louis Monier was a founder of the Internet search engine AltaVista. After he left AltaVista, he worked at eBay and then at Google. He left Google in August 2007 to join Cuil, a search engine startup. He was Vice President of Products at Cuil. He also was the co-founder and CTO of Qwiki with Doug Imbruce. Qwiki won the TechCrunch Disrupt Award in 2010  and was recently sold to Yahoo.   Louis was the Chief Scientist of Proximic until July 2013, and then founded a health technology company, Kyron.  He is currently Chief Scientist at Import.io and serves as Advisor, Investor and Deep Learning Faculty member at Holberton School in San Francisco.
Monier received a Ph.D. in Mathematics and Computer Science from the University of Paris XI, France in 1980 and worked at Carnegie Mellon University, Xerox PARC, and DEC's Western Research Laboratory.
 Greg Renard, Technical Advisor
Grégory “Redo” Renard is CTO & Chief Visionary Officer at xBrain, and previously was CIO at Wygwam sarl, Usilink, Regional Director at Microsoft, and Professor at ISEN.   Grégory began his career in 1996 in academic research around new technologies and created his first company in 1997 in the field of web development.   Greg is an expert in artificial intelligence and big data working on unsupervised deep learning, bot, personal assistant, connected things and voice/semantic search for more than 15 years.
Through his professional activities in the various companies he created, his publications (books, blogs, etc.) and conferences, he is recognized as an expert on computer technologies (especially from Microsoft with the title of Most Valuable Professional since 2003 and as Regional Director since 2006) then as a futurist and architect of innovations.
Grégory continues to advise many large companies on their strategy and organization innovation.  He is also a professional technical futurist speaker in different European universities and corporate events in France, Europe, and US.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute to the campaign you can still make a difference!

Please help us get the word out and share with schools, parent's groups, sports organizations and other groups involved with adolescents.
It's easy to do using the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
ShadowCore VR

ShadowCore is a HeroFps-Lite, virtual reality, action-packed, shooter set in a dystopian cyberpunk reality. Focused on small to medium tactical engagements, it supports skilled shooting in combination with easy to access gear and an ever-evolving gameplay to keep you immersed.

It is now available on steam as early access. And more information available on our website, facebook, twitter and youtube.

Elite cyborg assassins fight for their objectives in a 5v5 battle

Total 5~7 heroes will be available to choose from in our full version

Playable hero classes in steam early access version:

- The Raid is a damage class.

Equipped with assault rifle, hand grenade launcher and "Auto Aim" special ability. 

 

- Flatline is a support/sniper class. 

Equipped with a sniper/smg gun, hand energy shots weapon and can see through walls. 

 

- IceBreaker is a tank class.

Equipped with a mini/emp gun, deployable shield and aoe armor drop.

 

Hero classes currently in development:

- 4th hero will be a support/melee class. 
Equipped with a double pistol, vibro claws, drone controller and can shoot energy balls in 360 degree.
 
 
 

 

- 5th hero will be a support/healer class.

This healer class uses nano bots to heal those around him. His weapon shoots outs a beam to heal, his wrist weapon is an aoe healing grenade, when activated his shoots and his ult buffs everyone in close parameter.

 

- 6th hero will be a melee class.

This melee class uses an energy whip/spear and a shield and have a special ability that targets grouped enemies. 

 

 

Maps playable in current steam early access version:

- Vertigo : A rooftop area

 

- Refuse : A trash processing facility area

 

Maps we are working on:

- Sci-fi forest map

 

- Sci-fi laboratory map

 

Game Modes:

- ShadowCore VR currently has 2 game modes: Hacking and ShadowCore, basically King of The Hill and Capture the Flag game modes.

We are integrating VR simulations for these game modes.

 

Other features:

- Free locomotion with snap turning

- AI bots

- Hot-join in game

 

Things we are working on:

- Porting to PSVR

We are enrolled as Sony Playstation Development Partner. And once the full version of this game is ready, we will port this game to PSVR with AIM support as an indie game.

- Dedicated matchmaking server for cross-platform multiplay.

We are working on a dedicated matchmaking server to support cross-platform multiplay between PSVR, Oculus and HTC Vive players.

- Bot refinements

Current AI bots need refinements and better behavior, which we are currently working on.

- Single player missions

Ground work has been done with AI bots and part of the team is working on single player experience. The plan is to make the single player missions a story-based one with VO narrations.

- Integrating VR simulation elements and class-specific movement system

We are designing gameplay elements with VR in mind and a class-specific movement system.

- Our story/script is complete and single player missions are being worked on.

 

Challenges we are facing:

- Server maintenance cost

We will need to have a dedicated matchmaking server to support cross-platform multiplay between PCVR and PSVR users.

- Map design cost for the single player missions

The current lack of support for multiplayer games lead us to make a decision to do single player missions. The current maps are designed to support multiplayer and we are trying to reuse them and get the best single player experience out of it. If we could get enough funding, we will design single player specific maps.

 

About Us:

We are hard working people gathered together to achieve a dream. We have a common goal to make this game one of the kind in VR gaming. Some of us have experiences in working for AAA games. At this stage of development, your support is vital for us.

story:
Key Features

  • Collect hundreds of items - Common, Uncommon, Rare, Epic, Legendary classes of loot with over 100 unique weapon models with tons of rare variations with unique stats.
  • 4 Person Multiplayer - Connect with Friends or make new allies in glorious multiplayer. Multiplayer encounters will put your teamwork to the ultimate challenge.
  • Fast-paced Combat - Attack, dodge, jump, block in real-time to defeat your enemies or avoid getting hit.
  • Procedural Dungeons - Explore procedurally generated dungeons full of enemies, loot, and a boss at the end.
  • Character Customization - Change the appearance of your character to make them unique.
  • Mining / Gathering - Between fighting enemies you can take a moment to mine or gather resources necessary to improve your chances of survival.
  • Upgrade Weapons/Armor - Use resources to upgrade weapons and armor to improve your characters fighting capabilities.
  • Alchemy - Craft potions to help you survive.
  • Biomes - Explore maps in a wide variety of biomes including Forest, Desert, Snow Forest, Swamp, Volcano, etc

 

Stretch Goals

Vote on priority of stretch goals!

Pets

Have a companion animal/creature/dragon with you that also levels up and can be customized

Guilds

Create a guild with your friends with a guild hall where you can hang out

Character House Customization

Customize your character's house

Guild Hall Customization

Customize your guild's hall

Oculus Quest Version

Play the game in VR on Oculus Quest

 

More details and perks coming soon!

story:
Key Features

  • Next Gen Open World Business Strategy Online Game
  • More than 21 freely buildable high resolution 3D department models
  • More than 6 ship classes in high resolution 3D look
  • More than 11 different resources
  • All ships with various weapons, armor, engine individually extendable
  • All ships and departments with their own textures / graffiti / colors changeable
  • Explore unknown resources by recalculating all attributes
  • Combine existing Bluerpints to completely new and unknown Blueprints
  • Extensive Trade Feature - Dominate the AQUARYOUNS Stock Exchange
  • Minimalistic GISMO-HUD
  • Diplomatic feature with various P2P contract types
  • Alliance feature - team up with other players
  • Avatar system incl. complete customization
  • Story: 6 different characters and other nations
  • Story: Mysteries in the deep sea with different characters and nations
  • Initial languages: DE, EN

All in-game views shown on this site are PreALPHA status.

AQUARYOUNS World is a 3D online strategy and business simulation game and will set the focus on economic activity.

You starts as AQUARYOUN and leads his human civilization to glory and honor.

The underwater world on planet Earth is divided into different Zones with different environmental conditions, such as average temparature, current, algae growth, ...

(Different zones with different environmental conditions)

In each zone, humanity has marked hexagonal Plateaus for colonization. Neighbouring Plateaus are grouped in Clusters, and each Plateau is subdivided into 61 hexagonal Claims, which serve as basic cells for department construction.

(hexagonal claim on a plateau, preALPHA)

(Plateau Design 2.0)

You start with a single control center on one single Claim in the corner of a Plateau...

(Control Center, preALPHA)

...steadily building up your economy, spreading your influence on other Claims and trying to dominate the entire Plateau.

(Animation Department Building, Plateau Design 1.0, preALPHA)

You have to create complex economic cycles with factories to produce resources and process them into goods to create ships.

(Pioneer Ship, preALPHA)

(Factory with Guppy Ship, preALPHA)

The depth of the economic levels within AQUARYOUNS World will increase from time to time. We want to make a game for the arcade gamer, but for experienced economy gamers, too.

(View over the plateau, Plateau Design 1.0, preALPHA)

Beware of the other players and the NPC enemy that is already strengthening its economy in the same Plateau! As soon as you hold control of your Plateau, you will probably start wondering where to go next.

You can enter a specially created control room to see your influence growing. It contains a strategy table to show you all plateaus of the current zone as well as a detailed map of the selected plateau cluster as a hologram projection. This projection shows you the current diplomatic relations, available resources and current events.

(Tour control room, preALPHA)

AQUARYOUNS World' intelligent placement algorithm aligns the in-game spatial distances with the real-world geography. In combination with a location-based day/night-cycle, this will help you experience AQUARYOUNS World as a future version of our Earth instead of some random ocean planet.

Although AQUARYOUNS World is a online game, it will contain a classic DEMO mode in which players can taste the AQUARYOUNS World feeling. The DEMO mode will be playable without any registration. If the player thinks he is ready for the complete AQUARYOUNS World experience, he will have to sign up. This will push his current stage of the game (single player) to the server (multiplayer).

(Login Screen with DEMO Mode, preALPHA)

AQUARYOUNS will allow you to individualize the appearance of your avatar and civilization!

Custom textures, own colors, modifications for the 3D models of your ships, special logos and non-standard naming or your graffiti on your Claims.

Let your imagination run wild!

Perform research in your labs and even discover new and unknown raw materials by combining resources with different attributes and name any material that you were the first to discover!

(comes with Stretch Goal "Research System")

 

In the distant future, when climate change, tectonic activity and human experiments have caused the sea level to rise beyond all expectations and continents on earth have ceased to exist.

Humanity has learned to live underwater in the shallow regions of the one global ocean.

Nobody knows the secrets deep down in the ocean! Discover unknown areas and ...

... find out what Nepû means.

... get in touch with the Wæ,krÿs and learn why everyone thinks they are decended from wandering and businesses-making greed.

... discover what space actually has to do with our world ocean.

AQUARYOUNS World will come with more than 21 departments in detailed 3D optic.

(Harbor, preALPHA)

Build recycler to prevent an ecological catastrophe and to reclaim resources from the rubbish of your civilization. Or create a mighty trade empire by exchanging goods on the stock market for the universal in-game currency "Prions" (not to be confused with "Qurons" which are used to buy customization and individualization).

(Selection of more than 21 buildable departments, preALPHA)

Each one of the more than 21 departments provides his own inventory and business feature.

(Department HUD for Research, preALPHA)

(Department HUD for Generic Factory/Smelter, preALPHA)

In the large and detailed encyclopedia of AQUARYOUNS you will find information about each department.

(Encyclopedia HUD, preALPHA)

More than 6 ship classes will be available in AQUARYOUNS World.

Each class is based on a default model. You have the opportunity to customize...

  • the weapons,
  • the engines,
  • the armor...

by adding or replacing individual modules. Or you want to change a ship to a ground vehicle? With this hugh range of possibilities you can...

  • build pioneer ships and travel to other Plateaus, distant Clusters or even a complete different Zone. Land there and start working on another control center to spread your people and your influence.
  • make war with other players and beat your enemy to the seabed with a mighty submarine army.
  • train special ground units and troops to infiltrate your opponents' vessels and departments.

(Concept Arts Ships/Ship Classes)

(Concept Arts modularization of two ship classes)

AQUARYOUNS World comes with a minimalistic HUD interface, so that nothing will stop you from getting lost in its underwater world.

(Ingame HUD, Plateau Design 1.0, preALPHA)

Our Global Identification, Selection & Moving Object, short "GISMO"...

(GISMO presentation of all layers, preALPHA)

... is a single button that presents you with an arc-shaped context menu. The possible options vary with the selected elements (department, unit, terrain, …).

AQUARYOUNS World will initially be published in English and German with further languages to come as the game spreads around the globe.

You will be able to play AQUARYOUNS anytime, anywhere. After the Start of the EarlyAccess AQUARYOUNS is available on STEAM. Or simply open http://aquaryouns.games in your browser, desktop or mobile, and dive under!

We are also going to release AQUARYOUNS for Google Play Store, Apple App Store, Windows Store and Consoles as soon as possible.

AQUARYOUNS World is only one game of a series of AQUARYOUNS games, multiple games - all placed int one universe.

But what do we mean with "One Universe" and "Multiple Games"?

And what the hell is AQUARYOUNS?

We don't mean a game that is strategy and RPG, tetris-like and business simulation, point-and-click adventure and MOBA, all at the same time.

No. We don't.

We wouldn't want to play such a game. We mean several games of different genres that share the same world data!

What if...

...you could let your RPG character stroll right through the department block that you've built in your business simulation this very morning?

...your 5-minute mobile arcade game in the bus could boost the productivity of the factories in your business simulation?

...the war that your alliance started changed the point-and-click adventures all over the world – forever?

...you fought this war yourself in a MOBA game, affecting the outcome of a battle in the main strategy game?

 

Think of

as a complete big game world which will only work fine with more than one separate AQUARYOUNS game. We see all games in the AQUARYOUNS universe as singles released from the big music album "AQUARYOUNS" .

This principle of many games sharing the same world is one of the heart of AQUARYOUNS!

The AQUARYOUNS games will not only share the same timeline, ALL games will interact with each other. That means the data of an AQUARYOUNS World player will be shared with another AQUARYOUNS game in real time.

Everything is connected and live.

Let's try a thought experiment:

Assume that you are playing an AQUARYOUNS point-and-click adventure. You discover an interesting department in the AQUARYOUNS universe. Finding some quests and items, speaking with people or interacting with a certain room.

Suddenly everything changes around you. Your dialogue partner flees, the room is shaking, all lights turn to red. You want to know what's going on?

You switch the room and see that the whole department is deserted. After finding the control panel you notice the cause: The claim and the department is under attack (triggered through an action in in another AQUARYOUNS game).

Now you have to choose:

Leave the department and the claim as soon as possible or join the defence.

 

At the same time a player of AQUARYOUNS World receives the "department under attack" message. He'll see, that his building is under attack from an enemy player. He has to organize a defence and order support to the location.

Now both players, one in AQUARYOUNS World and another one in AQUARYOUNS Point-And-Click-Adventure, try to defend the same department although they play different AQUARYOUNS  games.

 

That describes the heart of AQUARYOUNS:

All games share the same universe at the same time.

Our greatest goal is to make the exciting vision of the legendary AQUARYOUNS universe available to all prospective seafarers.

It must not be, that the size of anyones Quron-wallet* decides if he or she can dive in or has to stay on land. AQUARYOUNS is not a sealed off underwater-area on our mother earth.

Everyone, whether big or small, should be able to experience AQUARYOUNS!

So we want to release some AQUARYOUNS games free to play. For us this also includes free content updates.

However we are just a small studio that needs a budget to continue working too.

In this case we have to find a fair way between undisturbed game pleasure and getting a budget.

 

Creating the best possible AQUARYOUNS-experience with a low-budget development process (and hopefully an active community of players and fans to guide the way) requires compromises.

One of these compromises will be that we won't release all these games all at the same time. We'll start with AQUARYOUNS World.

* Qurons are our ingame currency

Once AQUARYOUNS World has hatched from its EarlyAccess phase, we plan to launch AQUARYOUNS Arena soon after.

AQUARYOUNS Arena is a MOBA (multiplayer online battle arena) game, featuring 1-vs-1 and group-vs-group battles. A single Plateau serves as the arena for epic and action-packed battles that determine the outcome of the wars in AQUARYOUNS World.

A tetris-like / casual / arcade game for your 5-minutes-waiting-for-the-bus or the 15 minutes before you really turn off the PC and go to bed. Each game directly impacts the productivity of a factory in AQUARYOUNS World.

Compare your scores in local, regional and global leaderboards and become the best factory manager on earth!

A collection of exciting point-and-click adventures, set in the AQUARYOUNS underwater stage.

Visit your own Claim from AQUARYOUNS World or travel the entire ocean! Take on quests, gather items, and find out why Earth looks the way it does in the AQUARYOUNS game world!

Our greatest wish is to gather an active and strong community of players!
One of the reasons for launching this campaign in the first place.

Naturally, an Online Game like AQUARYOUNS needs many players to be fun. This makes Crowdfunding the perfect platform both for collecting the funding needed for the final development spurt and for gathering a great initial player community!

The more of you sign up for EarlyAcces and the more of you spread the word, the better a gaming experience AQUARYOUNS will become!

You can help. NOW!

 

 

Please register on our website https://www.aquaryouns.com as well!

After sign-up, you'll also get a unique sharing link to refer your friends to - and for every friend that signs up using this link, you earn points which translate to in-game Qurons!

Until now

  • We've already invested hundreds and hundreds or working hours in game design and development.
  • The core game mechanics are defined, and the world is set up and designed, lacking only a finishing polish.

Crowdfunding Campaign

  • The campaign will run until end of March.
  • It will provide us with enough funding to finish setting up the server infrastructure, correcting plenty of bugs beforehand, and hopefully allow us to go even further and include more content and features earlier – see the "Stretch Goals" section.

ALPHA

  • Pledge on the "Pioneer" tier or above in order to be one of AQUARYOUNS "First Pioneers" that prepare the ocean floor for human civilization!
  • We plan to launch AQUARYOUNS World as a Closed Alpha version in the second quarter of 2019.
  • The ALPHA version will include:
    • 21 different departments (some lacking part of their functionality)
    • 11 different resources
    • blueprint system
    • GISMO HUD
    • civilization profile with 2D avatar (Aquaryoun)
    • messaging system
    • bug report system
    • feedback module
  • During the ALPHA phase, very regular (up to daily) updates will be deployed that may affect all game aspects (game-play, UI and design, infrastructure,...).
  • This is when we need your feedback and constructive ideas most!

BETA

  • Pledge on the smallest level or apply on our Website https://www.aquarouns.com for access to the Closed BETA!
  • As soon as the Closed ALPHA passes the first tests and everything runs smoothly, we'll proceed to the Closed BETA phase, probably at some point in the third or fourth quarter of the year.
  • Throughout the entire BETA phase, we'll provide regular major and minor updates with new features and bugfixes. At the same time, we'll slowly start the development of the next AQUARYOUNS games.
  • All unlocked Stretch Goals will be integrated during the BETA phase.
  • Towards the end of the year, we'll open up access to the entire world (Open BETA).

Release Candidate

  • We don't want to make any promises for when AQUARYOUNS World will be released for good, since it strongly depends on the scope of the game, which in turn depends on how many Stretch Goals we'll achieve and how many new features will be requested by the community during the ALPHA and BETA phases.
  • There is no end to development: AQUARYOUNS won't ever be a one-shot-finished-title, but a living and evolving world!

Most of the Stretch Goals represent additional modules that give variety and depth to the game and thus will enhance your gaming experience, ultimately increasing your fun with AQUARYOUNS!

So, here's what you can help to unlock:

DJAMACAT Gamesports, that are an enthusiastic team of eight Game Geeks, who want nothing less than to break the rules of the known gaming world.
We combine more than 20 years development expertise with an extensive gaming practice and more than 5 years game business experience. Founded on 1 July 2017 is DJAMACAT Gamesports the first independent Gamestudio in the "City of Four Gates" Neubrandenburg, located in the beautiful north east of germany.

  • Three developers for backend,
  • two developers and one artist for the user xperience and interface,
  • one communications assistant,
  • one founder and

ALL TOGETHER defines the game mechanics!

We all work hard every day to achieve the goal to present you, our community, our vision of an living AQUARYOUNS Universe.
Eight geeks, well-chosen from the founder of DJAMACAT GmbH and creator of the original idea behind AQUARYOUNS:

Tommy Müller, a well-kept mid-thirties with a long live career in software development. As a fan of the Westwood Studios and driven by the desire to present the world its own game world, he began writing his first own software at the age of 14.

Now we have come together to bring the vision of AQUARYOUNS to live with the help of JAVA and Unity3D.

We are extremely excited about this project. We hope that you are, too.

So, go ahead and support this campaign! Now, it's up to you.

Key Features
Next Gen Open World Business Strategy Online Game
More than 21 freely buildable high resolution 3D department models
More than 6 ship classes in high resolution 3D look
More than 11 different resources
All ships with various weapons, armor, engine individually extendable
All ships and departments with their own textures / graffiti / colors changeable
Explore unknown resources by recalculating all attributes
Combine existing Bluerpints to completely new and unknown Blueprints
Extensive Trade Feature - Dominate the AQUARYOUNS Stock Exchange
Minimalistic GISMO-HUD
Diplomatic feature with various P2P contract types
Alliance feature - team up with other players
Avatar system incl. complete customization
Story: 6 different characters and other nations
Story: Mysteries in the deep sea with different characters and nations
Initial languages: DE, EN
All in-game views shown on this site are PreALPHA status.AQUARYOUNS World is a 3D online strategy and business simulation game and will set the focus on economic activity.You starts as AQUARYOUN and leads his human civilization to glory and honor.The underwater world on planet Earth is divided into different Zones with different environmental conditions, such as average temparature, current, algae growth, ...(Different zones with different environmental conditions)In each zone, humanity has marked hexagonal Plateaus for colonization. Neighbouring Plateaus are grouped in Clusters, and each Plateau is subdivided into 61 hexagonal Claims, which serve as basic cells for department construction.(hexagonal claim on a plateau, preALPHA)(Plateau Design 2.0)You start with a single control center on one single Claim in the corner of a Plateau...(Control Center, preALPHA)...steadily building up your economy, spreading your influence on other Claims and trying to dominate the entire Plateau.(Animation Department Building, Plateau Design 1.0, preALPHA)You have to create complex economic cycles with factories to produce resources and process them into goods to create ships.(Pioneer Ship, preALPHA)(Factory with Guppy Ship, preALPHA)The depth of the economic levels within AQUARYOUNS World will increase from time to time. We want to make a game for the arcade gamer, but for experienced economy gamers, too.(View over the plateau, Plateau Design 1.0, preALPHA)Beware of the other players and the NPC enemy that is already strengthening its economy in the same Plateau! As soon as you hold control of your Plateau, you will probably start wondering where to go next.You can enter a specially created control room to see your influence growing. It contains a strategy table to show you all plateaus of the current zone as well as a detailed map of the selected plateau cluster as a hologram projection. This projection shows you the current diplomatic relations, available resources and current events.(Tour control room, preALPHA)AQUARYOUNS World' intelligent placement algorithm aligns the in-game spatial distances with the real-world geography. In combination with a location-based day/night-cycle, this will help you experience AQUARYOUNS World as a future version of our Earth instead of some random ocean planet.Although AQUARYOUNS World is a online game, it will contain a classic DEMO mode in which players can taste the AQUARYOUNS World feeling. The DEMO mode will be playable without any registration. If the player thinks he is ready for the complete AQUARYOUNS World experience, he will have to sign up. This will push his current stage of the game (single player) to the server (multiplayer).(Login Screen with DEMO Mode, preALPHA)AQUARYOUNS will allow you to individualize the appearance of your avatar and civilization!Custom textures, own colors, modifications for the 3D models of your ships, special logos and non-standard naming or your graffiti on your Claims.Let your imagination run wild!Perform research in your labs and even discover new and unknown raw materials by combining resources with different attributes and name any material that you were the first to discover!(comes with Stretch Goal "Research System") In the distant future, when climate change, tectonic activity and human experiments have caused the sea level to rise beyond all expectations and continents on earth have ceased to exist.Humanity has learned to live underwater in the shallow regions of the one global ocean.Nobody knows the secrets deep down in the ocean! Discover unknown areas and ...... find out what Nepû means.... get in touch with the Wæ,krÿs and learn why everyone thinks they are decended from wandering and businesses-making greed.... discover what space actually has to do with our world ocean.AQUARYOUNS World will come with more than 21 departments in detailed 3D optic.(Harbor, preALPHA)Build recycler to prevent an ecological catastrophe and to reclaim resources from the rubbish of your civilization. Or create a mighty trade empire by exchanging goods on the stock market for the universal in-game currency "Prions" (not to be confused with "Qurons" which are used to buy customization and individualization).(Selection of more than 21 buildable departments, preALPHA)Each one of the more than 21 departments provides his own inventory and business feature.(Department HUD for Research, preALPHA)(Department HUD for Generic Factory/Smelter, preALPHA)In the large and detailed encyclopedia of AQUARYOUNS you will find information about each department.(Encyclopedia HUD, preALPHA)More than 6 ship classes will be available in AQUARYOUNS World.Each class is based on a default model. You have the opportunity to customize...
the weapons,
the engines,
the armor...
by adding or replacing individual modules. Or you want to change a ship to a ground vehicle? With this hugh range of possibilities you can...
build pioneer ships and travel to other Plateaus, distant Clusters or even a complete different Zone. Land there and start working on another control center to spread your people and your influence.
make war with other players and beat your enemy to the seabed with a mighty submarine army.
train special ground units and troops to infiltrate your opponents' vessels and departments.
(Concept Arts Ships/Ship Classes)(Concept Arts modularization of two ship classes)AQUARYOUNS World comes with a minimalistic HUD interface, so that nothing will stop you from getting lost in its underwater world.(Ingame HUD, Plateau Design 1.0, preALPHA)Our Global Identification, Selection & Moving Object, short "GISMO"...(GISMO presentation of all layers, preALPHA)... is a single button that presents you with an arc-shaped context menu.
