story:
We have dedicated hard work and sacrificed substantial time to bring this game in fruition. With your help it will be much easier to move mountains that seem not to move with just us. Below, I will go into depth about our game and why we need your help! 

As the spokesperson, or spokeswomen, for Xtreme Poker 2x, I believe poker lovers and beginners will love the thrill of our game! While being a  stay at home mom and home-based business owner, I decided to hop on the band wagon of Xtreme Poker 2x and help fulfill my fiancee's dream of a poker game that wont have players losing sleep or real money, that's enjoyable for all!

Your funding will help to finish what we call the Omega Phase for our game/app. This phase consist of these tasks:

* App static screen pages needed to represent app foundation.(STORYBOARD)         * Technical Writing which is a Original App Description (Professionally written to include APP details, beneﬁts, functions and features for Website and Marketing Materials)                                                                                                                                                 * Animation Demo will Create Original App demonstration, transform static pages into video presentation for marketing and presentation.(30-45 second demo)           * Programming Quote will be done by a professional at Zapporoo to finalize programming and go live with an additional fee.                                                                       * A "Coming Soon" home page will be designed and created as a original hosted "Coming Soon App Page" using our domain name. Hosting will be for 1 year from activation- renewable by us.                                                                                                             * We'll also get a Zapporoo Webpage: Encrypted webpage to include App Badge, App Animation, Multiple Static pages, and a Project Management System that includes:

*Password Protected  Admin Control Panel of Zapporoo webpage

*Direct email system to network App with buyers and investors      

*Create unlimited (URL) links for networking and project viewing

*Monitor online how often someone clicks onto our Zapporoo webpage

Currently, we've made a lot of progress and we're almost there. Some of the funding will also go to a separate marketing platform to create a buzz and awareness within my community. 
Here are some of the features to look for when we launch.

*Texas Hold'em, Omaha, 5-card Omaha, and Omaha Hi-Lo

* Live Chat

* Sit-n-Go poker tournaments

* Xtreme Poker Bracelet Games, with bigger pots!

* 25+ Virtual goods you can send people on tables

* Xtreme Mini Games – Scratch and win chips in between hands with our scratch offs and collect FREE chips every two hours!

* Practice your tactics and skills while playing different level players around the world

* Invite your friends, and make it a poker night anytime, anywhere on mobile devices, tablets and web. 

*Xtreme connect bonus – Pad your bankroll with $25,000 additional chips when you connect your account to Facebook! 

* Xtreme Poker 2x is a game for entertainment uses only. The game does not offer an opportunity to win real money. 

Everyone wants to be a millionaire, or maybe a billionaire. Our game gives you that rush of becoming a Xtreme Poker millionaire or billionaire in one hand and have alot of fun at the same. The game will also give you updates on your player ranking and skills, also poker advice. 

So whether your a beginner or your a pro this game will keep you on the edge of your seat, waiting on that next big hand!

We stress the fact that this is a FREE downloadable game app that can be played on any mobile phone or tablet. Our prizes within the game varies from FREE CHIPS, FREE AVATARS, FREE SPINS, or FREE SCRATCH OFFS to pad your in-app bankroll. There's many poker players that just love to play without the worry of paying to play. 

We may push left when we are supposed to push right, maybe fall on our head but will get back up and adjust to push forward! With every project there's some type of obstacles you endure. For the past year our team has worked great under pressure and always find a way to complete various tasks. This comes from trial and error. Rome wasn't built in a day, nor was this game thought of and completed in a day! With regards to development of the game, we have an experienced team, that's deeply connected to building outstanding  mobile apps. With modern tools and experienced professionals, we have set ourselves up for success. We've worked so hard to get this far and with minor touch ups we're very confident to have this completed on time. 

We will do our absolute best to deliver Xtreme Poker 2x and the rewards by their respective deadlines. However, there is always the possibility that problems may arise which could affect reward delivery. There may end up being changes in game or reward designs. story:
Summary

This project is to print the final deck in the Celtic Myth playing card series - one of the game components for Ard Rí, an original card game we've designed inspired by ancient Celtic culture and mythology.

Background

Two years ago we started a journey of discovery in producing three decks of playing cards suffused with Celtic mythology. Now we are completing that set with our final deck suggestive of the wild, chthonic forces of nature as opposed to the stabilizing, societal forces represented in our second deck. We've also designed an altogether new game, designed for use with our decks and capturing the heroic spirit of early society in Celtic Europe. 

Lugh and Balor, the embattled grandson and grandparent from the Second Battle of Magh Tuireadh, are shown in opposition to one another on the King of Clubs in each of the three decks. 
Lugh with his unstoppable spear and Balor with his irresistibly poisonous gaze. 

WHAT THIS PROJECT ENTAILS:

  • Printing the 3rd and final deck in the Celtic Myth playing card series
  • Providing the rules and final game components to ARD RÍ, a competitive card game designed for 2 to 5 players in which players take on the role of ancient Gaelic warlords and vie amongst each other to become High King.

What We Need 

We need $5,500 to print the third deck. The total cost, including fees and shipping of Perks, is approximately $10,500 - but we've got the rest covered. 

Please watch this video by James, which provides an overview of the deck:


What You Get

Each of the three decks are game components for the advanced version of Ard Rí, and while the other two decks are already in print, this deck won't be printed without your support. 

You can support our project for one deck or for many. As long as you provide support for at least one deck, we'll send you a free print-and-play copy of the rules. 

  • With your support, we will print this intricately drawn deck suffused with symbolism derived from Celtic history and mythology.
  • The deck will be printed by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC); the USPCC manufactures the very high quality Bicycle branded decks.

Add-ons

If you are interested in additional decks, or in the challenge coin featured in the Gallery (found at the top of the project page), please add $12 too your pledge.
Canadian supporters: please add an additional $3 to cover S&H for each item.
All other International supporters: please add $6 t cover S&H for each item.


The Impact

To play the advanced version of Ard Rí, all three decks of the Celtic Myth series should be used for a balanced game. That won't be possible without your support.

Third-Party Reviews

Immediately below are two reviews of the cards and the game:

   Article written by Will James, 7 June 2015

A Review of Ard Rí – a Celtic Card Game (written by Gary, 18 June 2015)

About the Game

ARD RÍ is a 2 to 5 player strategic competitive card game, designed for players ages 14 and up. Average game-play time is 30 to 60 minutes. The rules are provided in two versions: one with all English terms, and one with Gaelic terms.

In the game, players take on the role of ancient Gaelic warlords and compete among each other to collect the most wealth in order to force the other players to acknowledge them as the ARD RÍ (i.e. the High King).

There are two different types of cards in the game: 

  • Cattle cards, represented by the numbered cards and the Aces, and 
  • Warrior Cards, represented by the Court cards (i.e. Jacks, Queens, Kings) 

Cattle cards are synonymous with wealth and are worth the number represented on the card. For example, a 10 is worth 10 cattle-points, and a 4 is worth 4 cattle-points. Aces each represent a Bull and are worth 15 cattle-points apiece. The different suits represent different types of cattle. Cattle cards are played face-up into a player’s gort (i.e. their cattle-field). This is the open area in front of each player. 

Warrior cards are ranked such that Kings will defeat Queens and Jacks in battle, and Queens will defeat Jacks. When cards of equal rank battle, both are killed. Warrior Cards are initially played face-down into a player’s Roundhouse, which is the open area adjacent to a player'sgort. When they have proven themselves in Raiding or Defense, warriors are turned face-up and are considered "Proven". Proven warriors provide the player who controls them with additional benefits (though they also come with additional restrictions).

The game round: Play progresses through the seasons of the year, with each season providing players with the opportunity to engage in specified actions. For instance, Cattle are added to a player’s wealth in Spring, with Warriors flocking to banners in the Summer. Wealth is acquired from the wilds during the harvest time of Autumn, with the Harvest Feast of Samhain occurring at the end of that season. At the Harvest Feast, players are required to feed those Warriors they wish to remain under their banner. Winter is a time of hunting, raiding, and politicking, when fortunes can change in a heartbeat. 

Play continues until one player accumulates enough wealth or warriors to force the issue and cause the others to acknowledge them as High King. 

The game comes with three editions:

  • a Children's Edition (designed for children ages 5 to 13), 
  • the Basic game (described above), & 
  • an Advanced Edition which features special powers for each of the figures displayed on the Jacks, Queens, & Kings - drawn directly from the mythology.

Please note that while 1 deck can support a 2-player game, we recommend 2 decks for games of 3 to 4 players, and 3 decks for 5-player games.


About the Cards

Each of our decks in this series contains imagery hand-drawn from the history and mythology of the Celts, presenting illuminations rich with symbolism. The first two decks were printed and delivered to our crowdfunding backers last year (to whom we offer our deep gratitude). This final deck features vertically symmetrical (i.e. two-way) designs for the face-cards and back which showcase the more chaotic and elemental forces of Celtic legend and cosmology.

Our cards are uncommon in that our artist, James Acken (PhD in Medieval Studies), has used his background as both a scholar and artist to draw these images, creating a detailed tapestry of symbolism throughout.

While the usual suits are recognizable in our deck, we present them as the four jewels of theTuatha Dé Danann, magical items of immense power representing among other things martial prowess, wealth, abundance, and leadership.

Additionally, each Court card represents important figures from the Book of Invasions, Colloquy of the Ancients, and other medieval legends in an effort to evoke the highly involved symbolism of the Book Kells and other medieval artifacts. 

As with the prior two decks we successfully crowdfunded, this deck will be printed by the United States Playing Card Company (USPCC) and will contain:  

  • a custom back,
  • 12 custom-designed Court Cards (Jacks, Queens, Kings),
  • 36 custom-designed pip cards (unique to the set, but common across it) ,
  • 4 custom-designed Aces (unique to the set, but common across it),
  • 2 custom-designed Jokers, and  
  • 1 info card concerning the company or, possibly, a custom-designed Cut Card 
  • 1 info card detailing the symbolism of the card back and where one can go to find more information (www.culturlan.com). 

The court cards, can be viewed here:

The Card Back & Tuck Box

The Tuck-box features Classical Gaelic, the common ancestor of Irish and Scottish Gaelic.
An image of the card back can be found immediately below:

Risks & Challenges

We've successfully funded and printed two decks of Bicycle branded playing cards and we have a very good handle on the process. Additionally, we are working with great people at the USPCC Custom Division to print these decks. To top things off, the game has been playtested extensively and almost all of the card artwork is finished; we are simply waiting on the funds to go to print.

All of that said, there is always the chance of an unexpected delay.

We will work hard to ensure no delays occur, but should we at any point believe we are behind schedule, we promise to advise you of the issue and what we are doing to resolve it. We also promise to stay in contact with you at least once per week until project rewards are shipped. And if the project is funded, rewards WILL be shipped. 

We take the trust you place in us quite seriously, and we will work hard to ensure you never have cause to regret your decision to back us. We will do our utmost to be responsive to emails and comments. But there's no need to take our word for it. We encourage you to read the comments, updates, and reviews of our other projects on Kickstarter, as well as reviews of our products and company on sites such as Amazon. 

Feel free to email us with any questions, comments, or concerns you might have at <info@culturlan.com>. 

Thanks for your support!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but want to help, getting the word out is certainly our biggest challenge. Anything you can do to help in that regard would be most appreciated!

story:
Short Summary 

http://www.craftycard.net/

Hi, I am Emanuel Fierimonte, 29 years old, mechanical engineer with a strong passion for information technology and app development. Master degree internship at CIRA (Italian Center for Aerospace Research) and KIST (Korean Institute for Science and Technology). Now working for Italcementi as process engineer. Responsible for the knowledge sharing project of the company.

 it.linkedin.com/in/emanuelfierimonte

Hi, I am Marco Fierimonte, 24 years old, I am taking a master degree in informatics since passionate for programming.  I want to prove myself in the creation of app able to improve the everyday life.
it.linkedin.com/in/marcofierimonte

"Crafty Cards" is a mobile app designed to replace fidelity cards used in several shops to affiliate customers. Thanks to "Crafty Cards" mobile app, the customer won't need anymore to carry several cards in his wallet but he will use his own smartphone or tablet in a very confortable and smart way.
Moreover the customer will be able to easily find new offers and promote the most affordable one on the app itself and social networks, facilitating the economic growth of the commercial activities involved. 
Last but not least, "Crafty Cards" will reduce the use of paper in the world. 
The step forward of this application is the credit system between coupon maker and coupon user, the visibility tools, the "play to win a stamp" section and the smart pay section.

Thanks to your small contribute it will be possible to reach my dream of estabilish a SME and launch "Crafty Card" mobile app.  

What We Need & What You Get

The final target is to raise 5.000 € but the app will be developed even if such amount is not reached. Of course it will require more time and work without outsourcing opportunity. 

Here the foreseen cost breakdown:

  • mobile app design (500 €)
  • mobile app software development (500 €)
  • web site design (250 €)
  • web site code development (500 €)
  • market analysis (1000 €)
  • business plan (1000 €)
  • marketing campaign (1000 €)
  • app updates (250 €)
Each contributor will receive a number of "Crafty Cards" credits proportional to the contribute. 
"Crafty Card" creator (owner) will use credits to access to the app extrafeatures (in-app advertising, notify to customers, improve card design...). 
"Crafty Cards" searcher (customer) will use credits in the "play and win a stamp section" to have fun and save money at the same time.

The Impact

There are many reason you can feel pride to contribute to our campaign:

  • reduce the number of paper cards printed (save a tree)
  • reduce the utilization of cash money (cash free)
  • help people to find cheaper offers (save money)
  • help shop keeper to advertize them activities (economy growth)
  • reduce the number of cards in the wallet (easy life)
  • pay and receive a stamp at the same time (smart pay)

Risks & Challenges

We are at the beginning of this project and several challenges are in front of us. Of course thanks to your support it will be easier to overcome them. For instance we do have the capacity to program the app code but to have a professional result in an acceptable time we would need to outsource it. Same for the app and website design. Then we do not have experience in marketing campaign and we would like to ask the support of a specialized company. In order to launch the app in different app store and for different devices at the same time, we really need your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

We kindly ask your support in any form. If you can't support us with an economic contribute, please share Indiegogo page through social networks. Help us to realize our dream. 

Video introduttivo in Italiano!!!

story:
ISORIS

We are a small indie studio formed to do what others only speak about. With big ambition we are creating our own engine to support an all round fantasy RPG with deep lore and ever changing world.
We started our development on christmas and thus we managed to move forward with this great project! BOI will be a browser fantasy RPG with all the features players enjoy.

BOI helping OTHERS

With BOI we want to deliver the best gaming experience and at the same time use it to help as many talented people as we can. We know that there are a lot of talented writers, musicians and designer who would love to publish their work.
With BOI we want to give a chance to all these talented people and show their skills through our game.

 Our first story is about a young vocalist who volunteered to help us develop BOI. We introduced her to a studio so we could record her voice and as a reward she claimed PERK - You as NPC and this is how it worked out.
 


T-shirts for you!

If you support us with 30$ and claim our T-shirt perk you can choose between these two types of t-shirts:



Progress

  • Coming up with the main plot for the world of Isoris.
  • Creating all the necessary Concept art for environment, Races, Religions and Ancient Cultures.

We were searching for 4 month until we finally found a GUI designer most suited for BOI, to create a user friendly interface from heaven. Our design branch is currently creating playable characters and transforming dynamic sketches into high-res. pictures: 



Challenges

We are facing a big challenge in form of funds that are running low. Became our guardian angle in our pursuit of BOI.
story_txt:
ISORIS
We are a small indie studio formed to do what others only speak about. With big ambition we are creating our own engine to support an all round fantasy RPG with deep lore and ever changing world.

We started our development on christmas and thus we managed to move forward with this great project! BOI will be a browser fantasy RPG with all the features players enjoy.

BOI helping OTHERS



With BOI we want to deliver the best gaming experience and at the same time use it to help as many talented people as we can. We know that there are a lot of talented writers, musicians and designer who would love to publish their work.
With BOI we want to give a chance to all these talented people and show their skills through our game.

 Our first story is about a young vocalist who volunteered to help us develop BOI. We introduced her to a studio so we could record her voice and as a reward she claimed PERK - You as NPC and this is how it worked out. 



T-shirts for you!
If you support us with 30$ and claim our T-shirt perk you can choose between these two types of t-shirts:

story:
OUR STORY

In 2017, we've released AirportPRG as a test to see if we're capable of making a fun game. With 600 000+ downloads, an average rating of 4.4/5 stars, two Czech game of the year nominations and people desperately wanting more levels, the reaction was amazing and the game's popularity surpassed our wildest expectations.

Download AiportPRG yourself and see what we're capable of.

With your help and our experience, World of Airports will become a game that's bigger and better in every aspect.

 

GAMEPLAY

We're expanding on our first game and bringing in features that everybody's asked for, as well as things we wanted to do in the first game but couldn't due to time constraints:

  • Expand and upgrade your airport, manage buildings, handling facilities and staff
  • Handle airplanes fast to grow your airport's prestige and earn more money
  • Automate your airport so you can handle multiple planes at once
  • Establish flight connections with friends and other players
  • Take on missions and challenges in story mode, where you take over real airports
  • Buy and collect airplanes from historic, modern, and future era

 

COLLECT AIRPLANES

The base game will contain all the main airliners from B737 to A380 with many different liveries. Airplanes will be divided into four categories: small, medium, heavy and super heavy. Airplanes in each category will require different gameplay strategies and have different airport level requirements. The base game will contain these airplanes in particular:

  • F-27, ATR-72, E-190, RJ-85
  • A320, A330, A340, A350, A380
  • B737, B747, B767, B777, B787

More airplanes will be added via updates after the game is released. The game will of course also feature any airplanes requested by $500 backers.

 

BUILD AN AIRPORT

Build your own airport from scratch. Start as a tiny airport with a single runway and expand it to the largest airport in the world. You can buy, upgrade and customise your buildings, handling facilities, build brand new runways and hangars, widen the roads and build rail links to improve access to your airport, and a lot more.

You'll also be able get themed packs with real buildings from the most famous airports from around the world.

 

HANDLE AIRPLANES

We've taken the handling gameplay mechanic from AirportPRG, polished it and improved it based on feedback. Handling airplanes in World of Airports will involve handling the fuel, passengers, baggage, cargo, cleaning services, catering and de-icing the plane.

On big airports, upgrading gates will also allow for levels of automation, where staff know how to handle airplanes even without your guidance. It will allow you to have dozens of gates on your airport. Manual gameplay however will always remain the fastest and most efficient method of handling airplanes.

 

CONNECT AIRLINES WITH OTHERS

Get your own airline, buy and manage airplanes and establish airport connections with other players. Be a apart of a global economy and fly airplanes to and from airports owned by both real players and AI.

Handle airplanes fast and responsibly to grow your airport's prestige, and consequently get opportunities to fly planes to more attractive and more lucrative destinations.

 

LOOK AND FEEL

We're aiming for a recognisable art style for World of Airports. But more than that, the game will feature full day/night cycle, along with various weather conditions, which affect the way the game looks, but also plays. In winter, you'll need to de-ice airplanes, fog might make it difficult for planes to land, and so on.

 

TECHNOLOGY

In World of Airports we're accounting for a nearly indefinite airport growth from the very beginning and we're fully prepared for huge airport traffic with hundreds of airplanes and facility vehicles.

We're building the game already optimised in terms of game mechanics and graphics as well, so that when the game releases on Android and iOS, you'll get great performance on your device.

 

ABOUT THE TEAM

Our core game team consists of 7 people. We work at a Haug-land, a company that primarily develops software for logistics and manufacturing companies.

The reason why we make games from the aviation environment is because we love flying in real life, we love airport logistics, and generally all about airplanes. We even have our own flight simulators (Boeing 737, Cessna and a Robinson helicopter) under the FlyBoys brand.

We managed to make AirportPRG thanks to our passion. We put aside other commercial projects, sometimes (quite often :) working overtimes and on weekends. We wanted to know if we can make games, and if people are interested in what we make.

It turns out people really like what we make, and with your support, we'll be able to take everything one step further and create a game unlike any other.

 

FUNDING

"The goal is to keep our games free-to-play and ad-free."

Currently we're working on the game in our free time and from our point of view, the development is extremely slow. Most of the time that could be spent on the game is now spent on other commercial projects.

Reaching our goal will massively speed up the development of the game because we'll be able to dedicate part of our team to work on the game full-time, and put our hearts and souls into it.

We estimate that if we reach our goal, the schedule will look like this:

 

SPREADING THE WORD

If you can't donate, you can still help us by spreading the word. Send a link to this campaign to your friends, classmates, coworkers, or just anyone who enjoys great games.

story:
“Therefore go and make disciples of all nations…” Matthew 28:19.  

Members of Carlisle Evangelical Free Church (CEFC) will be answering Jesus’ call by participating in the Dominican Republic (DR) Missions Trip. We are excited to serve, pray, and spread the gospel with the wonderful people in the DR.  

WHAT WE WILL DO

On November 7th, 2015, our team will arrive in the Dominican Republic and serve in the following ways.

  • Sharing the gospel at an elementary school and middle school through Vacation Bible School programs that include games and crafts.

  • Meeting the physical needs of the poor by distributing food to poor families, providing gently used shoes, and teaching basic hygiene, and giving oral, personal, and feminine hygiene products.

  • Providing Bibles to the people in the community and praying with them

  • Exploring the DR with school children through a  fun-filled field trip.


WHAT WE NEED

The success of our trip depends on your support.  We need your prayers as we prepare to serve and for the lives God will have us touch.  We need your donation to help us finance this trip.  Your generosity will allow us to “go and make disciples” while allowing you to share in the eternal cause.  

Because our team has been assembled so that each member plays a specific service role, we are raising funds collectively for our team.  Any amount helps — $10, $25, $100, $500 or more! On the right side of this page, we've also listed some perks as incentives for our donors.  For instance $10 will feed a family of four for one week. Please help us serve more people in the Dominican Republic by making a donation today.


WHAT YOU SHOULD ALSO KNOW

We will include you on the email updates before, during, and after the trip. Donating here will allow us to add you to our mailing list for transparency to all supporters through frequent updates on all activities for this mission trip.  You should also know that your donation is tax deductible. At the end of this campaign, we will send out a report on how the funds will be spent and hopefully encourage you to travel with us next year. More importantly, we will be praying for God to repay your generosity to the spiritually and physically poor, according to His Word that “whoever is generous to the poor lends to the Lord, and he will repay him for his deed.” Proverbs 19:17


THE IMPACT

The impact of evangelizing isn’t always quantifiable. One great example of that is the story of one of mission trip members, Mr. Z. J. Jallah. When asked, he said "without the church's help during my teenage years, I may not have made it to college. For me, going to the DR is like coming full circle in that I get to share my growing faith, to others in challenging positions I personally understand." That's the kind of impact we pray that you will help us create by supporting this trip.


RISK & CHALLENGES

Understanding the associated spiritual, financial, and cultural risks, we feel empowered by Jesus Christ, directed by the Holy Spirit, and assigned by God to go and serve. We also understand the opportunities and challenges the DR presents because we ve been on this mission trip multiple times and have established a working partnership that extends beyond a short-term missions trip. Additionally, our team has combined over 20 years of global mission trip experiences.


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  1. Pray for our team as we raise funds for the trip, as we prepare to serve, as we interact with people in DR..
  2. Share this page link (Insert Link here) with your family and friends and ask them to support financially.
  3. Send us your email address to receive updates and feedback on our trip.
  4. Get regular updates on the trip at http://drmissioncefc.weebly.com/

Thanks for supporting us on this special Christ-focused DR missions trip.

story:
Story


In Quadrivium, the player can control different geometrical objects to pass the levels. These objects are incredibly advanced robots which explore and accumulate data from this fantasy-cosmic environment. There are 3 types of robots, but in the future we hope to develop more. 


Gameplay

Your main objective is to pass from a point to another without touching the red lines. Your impact with the red lines will be deadly and you will have to restart the level.

NADIR – Geometry  I

 CASE – Geometry II

 SPARK – Geometry  III

 At the moment these are the 3 playable characters:

In Menu

 There are 2 modes, easy for casual players, and hard for expert gamers



The game can be played from both top and bottom.


Risks & Challenges

As long as we won't have any health issues, there will be no risk that you won't receive the perks that you were promised.


Why Indiegogo?


This campaign helps us make our dream come true.
Developing is our passion and we try to express this through our game.

Right now the game is available only on the Windows Phone Platform. Because we are a start up we turned to Indiegogo to be able to keep the game constantly updated and eventually launch it on PC and Android platform.

story:
Hi, my name is Silja, I’m a psychologist and founder of PsycApps with help of my kick-*ss team, Med Bukey, James O’Brien, Prof Markus Maier and Collision Studios.

We are on the quest to put a big dent into the chilling mental illness numbers the World Health Organisation (WHO) published last year: by 2030 Depression alone will overtake Cancer as the no. 1 global disease burden! If you or a loved one has suffered from mental illness you know how devastating it can be, and we want to fight that with the new platform technology has provided for us: APPS!

At the moment eQuoo’s beta is successfully being tested in Australia and New Zealand as a positive psychology game that helps our players grow their emotional intelligence. But when we launch, we want to have implemented the artificial intelligence needed to set the foundations for therapeutic features as well: to develop a game that treats mental illness while being played.

How often have you picked up an app that’s ‘good’ for you, like a fitness or healthy eating app, and after a few weeks just faded out of it – even though you could feel it was working?! Well, with mental health apps it is even harder to get people to stick to their online therapy: illnesses like depression that takes away the joy in peoples lives, leaving them with low motivation and sometimes cognitive impairment. But there is a solution: research shows that the gamification of digital therapy keeps users interested and engaged!

It’s not an easy project, but with PsycApps’ team of psychologists and the developers from Collision Studios – the same company that helped develop the ‘Game of Thrones’, ‘The Walking Dead’ and many more games – we have the unique mix of academic and gaming experience to change therapy forever.

Your support of this campaign will help us finance the implementation of the AI that our budget just couldn’t stem anymore. With this, you are helping us lay down the ground works for a product that will be able to reach and treat more people than ever. When the statistics of mental health issues are as staggering as they are, a mental health product like this is needed.

Ask us anything - we're here to help!

Dr. David Susman

Clinical psychologist, mental health advocate, professor, writer. Sharing resources and inspiration for better mental health.

The EQuoo app is an innovative way to learn positive coping skills and strategies for better psychological health. The app's graphics are clear and engaging. The interactive learning format using a virtual couple and more detailed stories with other virtual characters was very effective. The concepts and skills were fun to learn and practice. Great app!

Dr. Duana Welch

Ph.D. in psychology, author of Love Factually: 10 Proven Steps from I Wish to I Do

I played eQuoo, curious about what I might learn as a former psychology professor and current relationship-science author. This program showed me my biases and how to balance them with reality, assessed my personality in line with other tests I’d taken, and presented games, interactive stories, and numerous examples to help me enhance my emotional intelligence. I think people who use eQuoo will become more adept in all their relationships, more knowledgeable about themselves, and ultimately, more resilient. Well done!

Rizwana Virdee

Psychotherapeutic Counsellor and YouTube Psyc Vlogger

As a therapist, having played EQuoo I was surprised with how much I learned. It made me stop, reflect & consider my answers. I felt pleased & satisfied when my choices were confirmed correct. It described my personality as I believed it to be, which is a positive open-minded person.

Consider your contribution to be a few (or a lot of) numbers in the code that will help the AI find behavioural patterns and be able to personalize and tailor the game experience in a way for us to deliver the therapy in the best way possible.

story:
Chi siamo?

Siamo un gruppo di giovani designer e architetti che si sono divertiti per anni a realizzare edizioni "fatte in casa" dei più popolari giochi da tavolo come il "Risiko Veneziano" e il "Monopoli di Padova" e abbiamo deciso di usare le nostre abilità per realizzare una startup dedicata.

Un esempio di Monopoli Padovano.

Come funziona la raccolta fondi

Chi partecipa al crowfounding può scegliere uno dei giochi che abbiamo già realizzato, o chiedere di farne realizzare uno personalizzato: Può partecipare chiunque voglia la versione dedicata alla propria località di un popolare gioco da tavolo con tabellone, pedine e carte, e per chi vuole accostare il proprio Brand al progetto.


Un esempio di Monopoli Padovano.

"Conquista la Laguna" - Il Risiko Veneziano

Come sono realizzati i giochi

I tabelloni sono disegnati da grafici professionisti e stampati su materiali plastici (spessore circa 3 millimetri) caratterizzati da una struttura omogenea e una superficie compatta, duratura e riutilizzabile infinite volte.
Le pedine sono stampate con una stampante 3D in materiale plastico e possono essere personalizzate nelle diverse versioni (Ad esempio Le Gondole nel gioco Risiko Veneziano).

"Conquista la Laguna" - Il Risiko Veneziano
Le versioni già disponibili
Simil-Risiko: Venezia, Veneto, Trento, Torino, Bologna Europa, Catalunia e la Silicon Valley.
Simil-Monopoli: Padova, Milano, Roma, Barcellona e Londra.

Dettagli tecnici e legali

Nessun gioco realizzato da "Zugo" potrà essere messo in diretta correlazione con il suo "padre" più noto per ragioni di copyright in quanto le grafiche e i nomi sono protetti da vari copyright e trademark, mentre il regolamento no (il brevetto è scaduto, e in ogni caso era difficilmente applicabile in Italia).

Nei giochi non appariranno il nome e le grafiche del gioco originali, ma saranno comunque utilizzabili con i regolamenti classici e le modifiche saranno limitate ad aspetti che non influenzano lo svolgimento delle partite come sono sempre state.

Chi siamo?

Siamo un gruppo di giovani designer e architetti che si sono divertiti per anni a realizzare edizioni "fatte in casa" dei più popolari giochi da tavolo come il "Risiko Veneziano" e il "Monopoli di Padova" e abbiamo deciso di usare le nostre abilità per realizzare una startup dedicata.


Un esempio di Monopoli Padovano.   Come funziona la raccolta fondi
Chi partecipa al crowfounding può scegliere uno dei giochi che abbiamo già realizzato, o chiedere di farne realizzare uno personalizzato: Può partecipare chiunque voglia la versione dedicata alla propria località di un popolare gioco da tavolo con tabellone, pedine e carte, e per chi vuole accostare il proprio Brand al progetto.



Un esempio di Monopoli Padovano.


"Conquista la Laguna" - Il Risiko Veneziano
Come sono realizzati i giochi

I tabelloni sono disegnati da grafici professionisti e stampati su materiali plastici (spessore circa 3 
millimetri) caratterizzati da una struttura omogenea e una superficie 
compatta, duratura e riutilizzabile infinite volte.Le pedine sono stampate con una stampante 3D in materiale plastico e possono essere personalizzate nelle diverse versioni (Ad esempio Le Gondole nel gioco Risiko Veneziano).



"Conquista la Laguna" - Il Risiko Veneziano

Le versioni già disponibili Simil-Risiko: Venezia, Veneto, Trento, Torino, Bologna Europa, Catalunia e la Silicon Valley. Simil-Monopoli: Padova, Milano, Roma, Barcellona e Londra.Dettagli tecnici e legali
 Nessun gioco realizzato da "Zugo" potrà essere messo in diretta correlazione con il suo "padre" più noto per ragioni di copyright in quanto le grafiche e i nomi sono protetti da vari copyright e trademark, mentre il regolamento no (il brevetto è scaduto, e in ogni caso era difficilmente applicabile in Italia). story:
-Game Play Video 4/6/2016-

       

Hi! Andrew Here. I am posting this video showing game play footage of one of our early alpha builds so you can see the rough direction we are wanting to go. This is an early alpha build in fact we have replaced all the art work with new stuff. I hope to showcase some of the art work next week. Also please check our Gallery in the Indiegogo for more videos that we have made.

 -Path of Meep: Added 3/24/2016-


The Path of Meep is one of two years struggling to make it to this point. We are not merely wandering around in circles with no design or idea for what we want to do with this game.

Meep the Legendary Spacebat is a return to the 2 dimensional "Space Shooter".  If you were not around in the mid 90s, a "Space Shooter" is a game in which you play a ship or robot of some sort and fly around. You try to dodge things that can kill you in one or two shots, gaining power-ups by blowing the bad guys out of the sky. Traditional "Space Shooters" usually have enemies that follow a pattern and don't react to the player. Even before enemies are programmed into the game, we plan them out so that way we can make the game have a good replay value. We do this by figuring out what the most common pattern would be then trying to mess with it.

We have actually engineered locations where a boss or mob could be put in. Indeed all of the power ups I created were specifically designed to showcase what we could do. The thing is, when you have 5 to 6 minutes to showcase a game and talk about all the things in it you can't really hit all that. Being concise has the price of skipping over a lot of details. In the video I say, “I love the art of it all.” That is 100% true, but what I don't go into that much is why.

When I was a younger man I was one of those guys who played around in Arcades a lot in the 80's. What always bothered me is on the side of the arcade box the art is around 10 times better than in the actual game. As the games got better people started experimenting with polygon counts and such and the arcade faded. In my initial attempt to do this game we had a demo.  You will notice that demo being played in the video.

As you read this, Margo is currently finishing up or has finished up if you're reading this after the 28th of next week-Full upgrades to everything you saw in the video. All the artwork you saw in the video after the game play point illustrates the changes. See, when we last showcased this game we had something that was of quality that quite frankly we probably could have made a small app out of.

I don't want to make a cash grab out of this.  My objective is to use the fact that we can actually have hand drawn animations in video games to its fullest. Reactionary and pattern based AI Enemies instead of something that just follows a pattern or something that just reacts, why not both?  That sort of AI exists in modern action games, beat-em-ups and FPS games but not in "Space Shooters".  If these exist in "Space Shooters", they are well hidden, or reserved for bosses.

I want to introduce elements such as evolving weapons, and using points like how some M.O.B.A.s use gold or coins.  The idea being when you go through the game you can have multiple different play styles. Meep can hold up to 4 weapons at a given time and store weapons in Echo's Shop. One of the first additional weapons we came up with, was the knife launcher which turns the basic attack from a rapid fire fireball into a rapid fire knife launcher that while it does less damage then the basic Meep shot, it goes through enemies using the same pattern. Meaning unlike the Meep shot, it can deal with crowds faster.

Plus, you are now a bat, in space, with a knife, that is on fire with blue flames. Meep's game play is going to have two types-infinite enemy and boss rushes like Meeppocolapse.  Then there is the main game play which is more like the traditional 2D dog fights and follows the story though around 8 levels, including but not exclusive to: Castle Raids, Ship Battles, Forest on fire, Duels with Magic wielding heroes that mistake you for an intruder, Epic fights involving Meep vs an automatic Vacuum Cleaner that has a laser gatling gun security protocol. Falling down into the core of a planet and much more!

When I wrote the game, I specifically left the environments open in certain areas so people could fill those open spaces in with unique OCs fighting in epic duels to keep back the army (or maybe being part of the army) as Meep pushes forward through the chaos.

When it comes down to it, this game is about giving a fully animated, artistic, and fun game to the library of games.  Giving another option to people who like the "Space Shooter" genre. I want to push some of the new ideas and philosophies in gaming, and use those to improve on the "Space Shooter" model. I like Toho, I like games like Ikuruga, that’s fine... but I really wish there was a "Space Shooter" that had a Castlevania style old school pacing and as I am currently not aware of one, my objective is to bring it into existence. Games like Castlevania and Super Ghouls and Ghosts were tough as nails not because of so much on the screen.

Alexander our programmer has never had a chance to practice his craft, so I am giving him a place to start growing his portfolio and he is happy to help us out. As I type this, Alexander is working hard on formulas, code and implementation.  So between him and the other artists on the team, I am happy and look forward to seeing a lot of cool designs come to life. The stage progression is wonderful and I look forward to watching it grow. It is often said but I mean this, sincerely, I hope you look forward to this as much as I do.  Together for great cupcakes and so I can entertain, and create a great game for all of you to play! Lets walk the Path of Meep Together!


We are Misunderstood Creature Entertainment (MCE)

What is that?

Misunderstood Creature Entertainment or M.C.E is a young gaming company. We wanted to do this project 1 year ago, but when we looked at our product at the time, we realized we could do better after further development.  Now, 1 year later, we have acquired a stable team ready to design a great game for you. We hope to succeed so we can design even more games in the future.

Our Hopes


  • We are hoping to not just build a good game, but something great. I would say epic but to me that word is used so much it has lost its punch. As Gamers ourselves some of us have noticed a sad fact:  Unless you are a fan of bullet hell games Space shooters are practically dead. 

  • Why is this?  Well it's because this genre really hasn't seen much advancement compared to all the other genres of gaming so prevalent in today's design world. While it is great to have good consistent designs, what if I want something different?  That's where MCE came up with the idea to take the initiative, and instead of waiting for that next great game to come-actually go out and make it.  

  • We as a team have worked day in and day out towards this dream.  Now, we need your help not only because it is important to us to be able to work on this, but because we want to get this game developed and out there for everyone to enjoy as soon as possible. 


Our Success and What it Means


  • By this Indiegogo succeeding we will be able to successfully fund the necessary people to work full time on this project and give it their full attention without having to concern themselves with part time work. In short by this being successfully funded you are allowing the artists, programmers and workers the ability to do their craft and produce for you a great product: A space shooter that  has full hand drawn animation, as well as enemy AI patterns and team attacks which make the player pay attention to more than the bullet locations on the screen. Having to fire and engage in 2D dog-fights in the sky with a variety of enemies: melee, ranged, even enemies that will try to trap the Player. This mixes with varied and multiple play styles with a variety of weapons to provide a challenging 2D Space Shooter Experience.  

  • Back when we demoed the proof of concept, I would sometimes notice people try to camp in one location on the left hand side of the screen.  They would die very shortly after.  However when they actually moved around and engaged the game they did very good.  This means a lot to me because that's the sort of feeling I want out of a space shooter.  I want to fire my attacks off and take out many enemies yes, but I also want to have to problem solve against enemy AI. I feel that while the space shooter genre has produced a lot of fun games, most of the enemy challenge comes from the sheer quantity of bullets and effects they produce in any given level, rather than a tactical challenge. While this is a game-play style I like a lot, I don't feel it's the only thing the genre can do.  So in Meep our goal is to present adversaries with unique advantages and disadvantages to the enemy AI patterns used. In addition we seek to support a protocol for encountering  other enemies at certain positions on the field and unleashing team up moves to change up the pace once in a while on the player. 

  • Everyone on this team wants to do this full time and give it their all but we need financial support to make that happen and that's where you come in.  



What YOU get for helping US, and what we are going to do with your cash 


As previously stated, this Indiegogo is all about you helping me hire full time the team that has been toiling away at this part time for a year, getting them the ability to finally focus full time on this project and be paid a professional rate to do so. Thus allowing them to give their full attention to this project free of distraction.  Ironically, I'd like to kinda think of this as you helping me hire them. So let me thank you ahead of time, as you virtually sit next to me at this table helping me out.  

Who are we hiring? Let me showcase to you the team you are going to help turn into full time developers...

 

Meet The Team 

Shawn Meadows: Background and Effects


Shawn  Meadows  is our background artist.  He has trained his entire life dedicating himself to making great and dynamic looking art backgrounds. He has worked on small commission projects which he successfully finished with our animator Margo Hopper. Thus they know how to compliment each others' style perfectly.  Anyone whose anyone knows how important and impressive it is to have a background artist who can compliment the art of your entities and things in front of them. It's sometimes distracting for a person to be playing a game where the art in the front is a clearly pixelated chibi sprite, but the background looks like a  work from Leonardo Da Vinci. 

I wanted the styles to match, so when I heard from miss Hopper that she knew someone who could  fill in, I tested them out with a new space background.  

What I got back was dynamic.  It wasn't just the little white stars no, this was some multi-color, dynamic space background with some images already prepared to enable our programmer to do some depth tricks and I was floored. Naturally of course, I then decided to hire him on.


Margo Hopper: Animator 


Margo’s style is exceptional and blossoming.  While working with us, she has increased from 12 frames of animation, to being able to go up to 60 frames of animation.  Margo has a really nice, dynamic cartoon style that fits perfectly in front of the style that Sean uses.  

Margo is an experienced artist, however this is her first big animation project. Most of her animations are 7-12 min shorts on commission work.   As such, for the past year I've seen her grow and both of us can't wait to have you exposed to the improvements in her style and technique.   Like with Sean, Margo is an artist committed to this project's success as is everyone on this team.  


Kris "The Alexander" Myers:  Programming


Next, there is Kris "the Alexander" Myers, our current main programmer. He is well versed in HTML and JavaScript. He also thinks sideways.  Don't understand what I mean? Allow me to explain - he's the type of guy who when he tests a game's code, goes out of his way to break it so he can then rebuild it better. In short, exactly what you'd want in a programmer. 

A college graduate and dedicated to make this project work, he has all the tools necessary to program a Game for PC or Mac. He is currently a father right now so he's got one of his dreams, but another dream of his was to be a game programmer. 

Well folks, I say let's give it to him and watch him soar! Alexander wants to work more on this then he is currently, but again we need YOU to do that.


Conrad: A Man of Many Voices


Then there is Conrad who does really great voice work. Conrad is on the level of Chuck Avery but he's not as known. He can do over 100 tones, accents and voice types!  No I'm not exaggerating.  He is really good at bringing characters to life.  In fact when we demoed the game, you would be shocked to know how many people were surprised or told me "No way!" when I told them that every voice in the game, every noise, is the same person.      


Harry Thompson IV: Project Lead and Designer 


Myself, I'm Harry Thompson.  I designed Meep the Spacebat for MCE.  The enemy patterns and the storyboard ideas are pretty much based on the designs I had a few years ago, but was never able to fully bring to life. Now that you're here, we can change that. 

Oh I should mention that guy in the corner over there...

Meet Andrew Albee, who is responsible for helping with media and financial management.  He is also going to be helping to keep you and anyone else who invests in this project abreast of the situation.  Speaking of which here is Andrew to explain why our target number is $108,300 and the math behind the funding requested for this project.


Andrew Albee:  Finances and Director


Alright, Hi!  I am Andrew Albee and I handle scheduling, planning and budgeting for Meep the Space Bat as well as Misunderstood Creature Entertainment LLC (MCE).


For most of the above and below Harry Thompson, our Project Lead has been discussing Meep the Spacebat and why we are doing an Indiegogo. I am now going to explain why the goal is $108,300 and why we have phases explaining what we do if we don’t reach that target shown below.


First and foremost, $108,300 is our target number for this Indiegogo. This will get us to a target number of $108,335, which is required to fully fund our Development Team, get our company set up in a studio and have the basic equipment we want to finish the game on time. We have done work on the game up to this point but we can not finish the project on schedule without help from future backers. Now we are prepared to finish Meep the Legendary Space Bat even if we do not hit our target for full funding, but first I want to explain how we get to $108,300.


For our artists, we need around $50,338.40 to have them working full time on this project. For our programmer, we need about $29,996.40 to have him work full time on this project. This total comes to about $80,334.80. At this point outside of me (Andrew Albee) and our Development Head Harry Thompson, we are fully funded to work on this project. An additional $28,000.20 allows Harry and I to set up a studio environment for the Company and get some development programs and equipment which we would like to assist our development team finishing on schedule. So that is how we get to a goal of $108,300.


Below are the phases mentioned earlier, with the first few being below $108,300. This is because we are prepared to pay our artists and programmers what we can in order to get as many hours as we can. Everyone on this team wants to finish this game. So we are working on doing just that. At $22,000 I can pay most of the team part time and continue to progress the project for about as much as they are working on the project right now. At $35,000 we can work on this project with half time pay. The higher the number goes, the more hours our team can focus on this project without doing a side job to get by, and the quicker the game can be finished. At $80,334.80 we hit a benchmark where the development team is able to focus full time on this project.


Every little bit helps at this point. Our team wants to finish this project, but we need help from backers and people who want to see this idea be finished and released. Thus we are doing the Indiegogo so we can make this a full blown realty.



Phases of how the Finances will Work:



PHASE 0 - Loading Game

====================================

$22,000 - We are able to hire on an additional animator and most everyone is being given a part time pay check to devote most of their time on the project.


PHASE 1 - Shattering Meteors

==========================================

$35,000 - All people involved in the project are essentially being payed half-time rather than full-time.


PHASE 2 - Destroying Swab-Es

==========================================

 $80,334.80 - While this number is literally the number required to pay everyone full-time to work on this project, it does not give us the studio and equipment we would like to finish this project as fast as we would want. 

Consider this a bench-marker.


PHASE 3 - Soaring to the Planet's Surface

=========================================

$108,335 - With this number we can get a studio set up and our Dev-Team is paid full-time.  However, we will not have all the equipment and tools that we would like though we can finish development for Meep at full-time.


PHASE 4 - Fully Powered up Meep

===========================================

$137,975.60 - With this number we are able to have a fully functional Studio with everything development wants to finish this project. We will have purchased several new pieces of equipment and programs we don't necessarily need to finish development but they will make the process a lot easier. Everyone can give their full effort to this project, and not worry about any side jobs or such things in order to pay for rent etc.   MCE can focus full force on Meep and we shall make a great game 

                                           

PHASE 5 - Bonus Option                      

 ===========================================

  $167,972. .00 - Same as previous, but now we hire an additional programmer to make development go even quicker. 

*$29,996.40 - Per additional programmer (it should be noted we are only going to be hiring extra programmers as a consideration should we get past PHASE 4)


PHASE 6 - Advanced Video Feed 

===========================================

$197,968.40 - At this point MCE will have its own mini studio 

2 programmers, 2 artists,  2 developers, 2 voice actors and an extra $4,285.20/month dedicated to upgrading all our tech which we will be showing off throughout development.  While the default web-cams and mics we have are nice, we would like to give you and everyone helping us the best quality in everything we're doing.  Thus the upgrades for everyone on the team. 

So those are our phases!  I am now going to hand you back To Harry Thompson.


Thank you Andrew and here's some more details on some perks we are excited about... 


More Exciting Details on the Perks 


Our base-line perk to buy the game is 15 bucks.

The expanded perk: Spacebat Savior, is a copy of the game as well as dedicating 5 dollars to Extra Life, helping children who haven't had the chance to chase their dreams as fervently as we are chasing ours for a mere 20 dollars. 

People who give at $100.00 will get to be in the game as a background character!  Our backgrounds currently have some empty spaces for animations, we're hoping some of you will help us fill up the villages, carts and audiences to battle sequences etc. We call this "Digital Immortality." It becomes unavailable when we have filled all the empty spaces in the game.  I expect to have room for around 120 different people.

At $220.00 dollars we are offering a collectors art book with a leather bound design which looks as close as we could get to the storybook in game. In it printed on its pages are the images of all the artwork in the game.  So you can show it off to your friends, get ideas for some cool fan art, or put it in a pile of other epic art books you happen to own.  

Another level of funding at $250.00 helps you work with us at MCE to create a boss for the Random Boss Roulette Arena!  There are going to be 5 bosses, 1 of them we are already working on! We won't tell you until this reward tier fills up, but when it does we will reveal the bosses we will want to work on with you. You also get three digital soundtracks and games.


For people who want all the accessories, you can get "Echo's Deal" for $450.00 

Designing a power up at $600.00! 

Even assist in level design for $1,500.00! 

As you can see, there are numerous exciting ways to get involved, and get swag! 


IF We Come Up Short.


Ok, no one wants to fail, but the fact of the matter is it happens.  However, we have made a commitment to this game and to all of our supporters.  Even if we do not reach our entire goal, we will work with what we have gathered and then get the rest through investment. 
However we want you, the fans to give us enough through this go-go that we at MCE don’t need as much as we would without you, and give you a little something extra you wouldn't necessarily have the opportunity for otherwise!  
While it might take a couple more months to complete than if we got funding, we will get this game done. If there's one thing we at MCE don’t like, its not finishing a good project.  As a Gamer, I know people who have gotten burned like that before and MCE is committed to not being those people.  

  

Why We feel We Need Meep


  • We need more than Toho and a handful of Space Invader clones.  Meep is the start of a series of games I want to make happen. I'm not trying to make a game for the sake of making a game, I’m building a franchise and Meep is a fun game concept to do it with. 

  • Meep's journey is for great cupcakes. Gradius , Raiden and R-type were revolutionary games of their time.  I want to see more of this game type and I want to see it given a treatment similar to that of what companies like Way-forward has done with old games.

  • For me I wanted to make the game about a creature instead of a ship or a girl.  I wanted to do a more traditional story, with some irony and parody and for that, MCE provides.

  • Now is the time to create a fun game that has more depth than the infinite runners we currently have.  I want to introduce newer mechanics such as team moves, etc into the enemy AI and to give a challenge for the player which forces them to adapt to enemy patterns lending a more strategic element than 5,000 bullets on the screen.

  • Of course there is also YOU:

  • Meep has successfully tested with multiple live audiences children and adults alike

  • In over 20,000 separate demo tests we never got a bad review

  • And for US as well:

  • MCE is committed to making great games happen because we as Gamers want to see more of these.  Together we want to make that happen for not just us but for you.

  • While this is our first project, everyone involved is skilled with their craft and dedicated to making this work.


Common Questions about Challenges to Us and Risks on Your End. 


I shall be listing some risks and challenges in bullet point form then I'm going to show you why you can trust in us and not worry. 

 - MCE is a young company

 - MCE has no previous IP's it has worked on.

 - $125,000 dollars is a lot of money  

                 

Our Responses to these concerns


  • MCE might be a young company, but the people in MCE and the Meep team in general all have varying degrees of work experience.  They know what it takes to get things done.  While none of the Meep team's Programmers or Artists have previous IP all of us have worked on projects before.

  • You can't solve Youth, that happens over time 

  • MCE currently has nothing but devoted workers that want nothing more than to do this game and give it the attention it deserves. While this is our first IP as a team, Conrad and everyone else on the team has been involved in successful small projects on their own or in smaller groups. 

  • Furthermore, with the year of work previous to this, our skills can create a great IP in Meep and I can tell you personally, everyone on this team wants to do more projects after this one.  We have no desire to just make one great thing and then go away, we want to make multiple things and are hoping you will stay. 


Other Ways You Can Help


I’m serious when I say I want to build a community.  Start talking to your friends and generating awareness.  If you wish to do some video feed of Meep and be involved with showcasing it you can email us at meepthespacebatisnifty@gmail.com 


This will allow us to talk to you and share some footage with you with only some minor stipulations. Please share this with as many people as you can and  get as many people to give as much financial support as you can.  
The more we generate, the stronger a game we can build.  
Our finances are based off of making a game within 7 months to a little over a year

And that's all there is to it.
