to do this game we had a demo.  You will notice that demo being played
in the video.
As you read this, Margo is currently finishing up or has finished
up if you're reading this after the 28th of next week-Full upgrades
to everything you saw in the video. All the artwork you saw in the video
after the game play point illustrates the changes. See, when we last
showcased this game we had something that was of quality that quite
frankly we probably could have made a small app out of.
I don't want to make a cash grab out of this.  My objective is to
use the fact that we can actually have hand drawn animations in video
games to its fullest. Reactionary and pattern based AI Enemies instead of something that just follows a pattern or something that
just reacts, why not both?  That sort of AI exists in modern action
games, beat-em-ups and FPS games but not in "Space Shooters".  If these exist in "Space Shooters", they are well hidden, or reserved for bosses.
I want to introduce elements such as evolving weapons, and using points
like how some M.O.B.A.s use gold or coins.  The idea being when you go through the
game you can have multiple different play styles. Meep can hold up to
4 weapons at a given time and store weapons in Echo's Shop. One of the
first additional weapons we came up with, was the knife launcher which
turns the basic attack from a rapid fire fireball into a rapid fire
knife launcher that while it does less damage then the basic Meep
shot, it goes through enemies using the same pattern. Meaning
unlike the Meep shot, it can deal with crowds faster.
Plus, you are now a bat, in space, with a knife, that is on fire with
blue flames. Meep's game play is going to have two types-infinite enemy and boss rushes like Meeppocolapse.  Then there
is the main game play which is more like the traditional 2D dog
fights and follows the story though around 8 levels, including but not
exclusive to: Castle Raids, Ship Battles, Forest on fire, Duels with
Magic wielding heroes that mistake you for an intruder, Epic fights
involving Meep vs an automatic Vacuum Cleaner that has a laser
gatling gun security protocol. Falling down into the core of a planet
and much more!
When I wrote the game, I specifically left the environments open in
certain areas so people could fill those open spaces in with unique
OCs fighting in epic duels to keep back the army (or maybe being part
of the army) as Meep pushes forward through the chaos.
When it comes down to it, this game is about giving a fully
animated, artistic, and fun game to the library of games.  Giving
another option to people who like the "Space Shooter" genre. I want to
push some of the new ideas and philosophies in gaming, and use those
to improve on the "Space Shooter" model. I like Toho, I like games like
Ikuruga, that’s fine... but I really wish there was a "Space Shooter" that had a Castlevania style old school pacing and as I am currently
not aware of one, my objective is to bring it into existence. Games
like Castlevania and Super Ghouls and Ghosts were tough as nails not
because of so much on the screen.
Alexander our programmer has never had a chance to practice his craft, so I am giving
him a place to start growing his portfolio and he is happy to help us
out. As I type this, Alexander is working hard on formulas, code
and implementation.  So between him and the other artists on the
team, I am happy and look forward to seeing a lot of cool designs come
to life.  The stage progression is wonderful and I look forward to
watching it grow. It is often said but I mean this, sincerely, I hope
you look forward to this as much as I do.  Together for great cupcakes
and so I can entertain, and create a great game for all of you to
play! Lets walk the Path of Meep Together!We are Misunderstood Creature Entertainment (MCE)What is that?
Misunderstood
Creature Entertainment or M.C.E is a young gaming company. We wanted
to do this project 1 year ago, but when we looked at our product at the time, we realized we could do better after further development.  Now, 1 year later, we have
acquired a stable team ready to design a great game for you. We hope
to succeed so we can design even more games in the future.Our Hopes


	We
	are hoping to not just build a good game, but something great. I
	would say epic but to me that word is used so much it has lost its
	punch. As Gamers ourselves some of us have noticed a sad fact:  Unless you are a fan of bullet hell games Space shooters are
	practically dead. 

Why is this?  Well it's because this genre really hasn't seen much advancement compared to all the other genres of gaming so prevalent in today's design world. While it is great to have good consistent designs, what if I want something different?  That's where MCE
	came up with the idea to take the initiative, and instead of waiting
	for that next great game to come-actually go out and make it.  
We as a team have worked day in and day out towards this dream.  Now, we need your
	help not only because it is important to us to be able to work on this, but because we want to get this game developed and out there for
	everyone to enjoy as soon as possible. 
Our Success and What it Means


	By
	this Indiegogo succeeding we will be able to successfully fund the
	necessary people to work full time on this project and give it their full attention without having to concern themselves with part time
	work. In short by this being successfully funded you are allowing
	the artists, programmers and workers the ability to do their craft
	and produce for you a great product: A space shooter that  has
	full hand drawn animation, as well as enemy AI patterns and team attacks which make the player pay attention to more than the bullet
	locations on the screen. Having to fire and engage in 2D dog-fights
	in the sky with a variety of enemies: melee, ranged, even enemies that will try to trap the Player. This mixes with varied and multiple play
	styles with a variety of weapons to provide a challenging 2D Space Shooter Experience.  



	Back
	when we demoed the proof of concept, I would sometimes notice people
	try to camp in one location on the left hand side of the screen.  They
	would die very shortly after.  However when they actually moved around
	and engaged the game they did very good.  This means a lot to me because that's the sort of feeling I want out of a space shooter.  I want to
	fire my attacks off and take out many enemies yes, but I also want to
	have to problem solve against enemy AI. I feel that while the space
	shooter genre has produced a lot of fun games, most of the enemy challenge comes from the sheer quantity of bullets and effects they produce in any given level, rather than a tactical challenge. While this is a game-play
	style I like a lot, I don't feel it's the only thing the genre can do.  So in Meep our goal is to present adversaries with unique advantages and disadvantages to the
	enemy AI patterns used. In addition we seek to support a protocol for encountering  other enemies at certain positions on the field and unleashing team up moves
	to change up the pace once in a while on the player. 



	Everyone
	on this team wants to do this full time and give it their all but we
	need financial support to make that happen and that's where you come
	in.  





What YOU get for helping US, and what we are going to do with your cash 
As
previously stated, this Indiegogo is all about you helping me hire
full time the team that has been toiling away at this part
time for a year, getting them the ability to finally focus full
time on this project and be paid a professional rate to do so. Thus
allowing them to give their full attention to this project free of
distraction.  Ironically, I'd like to kinda think of this as you
helping me hire them. So let me thank you ahead of time, as you virtually sit
next to me at this table helping me out.  Who are we hiring? Let me showcase to you the team
you are going to help turn into full time developers... Meet The Team Shawn Meadows: Background and Effects
Shawn
 Meadows  is our background artist.  He has trained his entire life
dedicating himself to making great and dynamic looking art
backgrounds. He has worked on small commission projects which he successfully finished with our animator Margo Hopper. Thus they know how to compliment each others' style perfectly.  Anyone
whose anyone knows how important and impressive it is to have a
background artist who can compliment the art of your entities and
things in front of them. It's sometimes distracting for a person to be
playing a game where the art in the front is a clearly pixelated
chibi sprite, but the background looks like a  work from Leonardo Da
Vinci. I wanted the styles to match, so when I heard from miss Hopper
that she knew someone who could  fill in, I tested them out
with a new space background.  What I got back was dynamic.  It wasn't just the
little white stars no, this was some multi-color, dynamic space
background with some images already prepared to enable our programmer to do some
depth tricks and I was floored. Naturally of course, I then decided to
hire him on.Margo Hopper: Animator 
Margo’s
style is exceptional and blossoming.  While working with us, she has increased from
12 frames of animation, to being able to go up to 60 frames of animation.  Margo
has a really nice, dynamic cartoon style that fits perfectly in front
of the style that Sean uses.  

Margo
is an experienced artist, however this is her first big animation
project. Most of her animations are 7-12 min shorts on commission work.
  As such, for the past year I've seen her grow and both of us
can't wait to have you exposed to the improvements in her style and
technique.   Like with Sean, Margo is an artist committed to this
project's success as is everyone on this team.  Kris "The Alexander" Myers:  Programming

Next, there is Kris "the Alexander" Myers, our current
main programmer. He is well versed in HTML and JavaScript. He also
thinks sideways.  Don't understand what I mean? Allow me to explain - he's the type of guy who
when he tests a game's code, goes out of his way to break it so he can
then rebuild it better. In short, exactly what you'd want in a programmer. A college graduate and dedicated to make this
project work, he has all the tools necessary to program a Game for PC
or Mac. He is currently a father right now so he's got one of his
dreams, but another dream of his was to be a game programmer. Well folks, I
say let's give it to him and watch him soar! Alexander wants to work
more on this then he is currently, but again we need YOU to do that.Conrad: A Man of Many Voices
Then
there is Conrad who does really great voice work. Conrad is on the
level of Chuck Avery but he's not as known. He can do over 100 tones, accents and voice types!  No I'm not exaggerating.  He is really
good at bringing characters to life.  In fact when we demoed the
game, you would be shocked to know how many people were
surprised or told me "No way!" when I told them that every voice in the
game, every noise, is the same person.      Harry Thompson IV: Project Lead and Designer 
Myself, I'm Harry Thompson.  I designed Meep the Spacebat for MCE.  The enemy
patterns and the storyboard ideas are pretty much based on the
designs I had a few years ago, but was never able to fully bring to life. Now that you're here, we can change that. 

Oh
I should mention that guy in the corner over there...Meet Andrew
Albee, who is responsible for helping with media and financial
management.  He is also going to be helping to keep you and anyone
else who invests in this project abreast of the situation.  Speaking of which here is Andrew to explain why our target number is $108,300 and the math behind the funding requested for this project.Andrew Albee:  Finances and Director
Alright, Hi!  I am
Andrew Albee and I handle scheduling, planning and budgeting for
Meep the Space Bat as well as Misunderstood Creature Entertainment LLC (MCE).For
most of the above and below Harry Thompson, our Project Lead has been discussing Meep the Spacebat and why we are
doing an Indiegogo. I am now going to explain why the goal is
$108,300 and why we have phases explaining what we do if
we don’t reach that target shown below.

First and foremost, $108,300 is our target number for this Indiegogo. This will
get us to a target number of $108,335, which is required to fully
fund our Development Team, get our company set up in a studio and
have the basic equipment we want to finish the game on time. We have
done work on the game up to this point but we can not finish the
project on schedule without help from future backers. Now we are
prepared to finish Meep the Legendary Space Bat even if we do not hit our target for full funding, but first I want to explain how we get
to $108,300.

For our artists, we
need around $50,338.40 to have them working full time on this
project. For our programmer, we need about $29,996.40 to
have him work full time on this project. This total comes to about $80,334.80. At this point outside of me (Andrew Albee) and our Development Head Harry Thompson, we are fully funded to work on this
project. An additional $28,000.20 allows Harry and I to set up a
studio environment for the Company and get some development programs and equipment which we would like to assist our development
team finishing on schedule. So that is how we get to a goal of $108,300.

Below are the phases mentioned earlier, with the first few being below $108,300. This is because we are
prepared to pay our artists and programmers what we can in order to
get as many hours as we can. Everyone on this team wants to finish
this game. So we are working on doing just that. At $22,000 I can pay
most of the team part time and continue to progress the project for about as
much as they are working on the project right now. At $35,000 we can
work on this project with half time pay. The higher the number goes, the more hours our team can focus on this project without doing a
side job to get by, and the quicker the game can be finished. At $80,334.80 we hit a benchmark where the
development team is able to focus full time on this project. 


Every little bit
helps at this point. Our team wants to finish this project, but we
need help from backers and people who want to see this idea be
finished and released. Thus we are doing the Indiegogo so we can make
this a full blown realty.


Phases of how the Finances will Work:PHASE 0 - Loading Game====================================$22,000 - We are able to hire on an additional animator and most everyone is being given a part time pay check to devote most of their time on the project. 
PHASE 1 - Shattering Meteors

==========================================
$35,000 - All people
involved in the project are essentially being payed half-time rather than full-time.
PHASE 2 - Destroying Swab-Es

==========================================



 $80,334.80 - While this number is literally the number required to pay everyone full-time to work on this project, it does not give us the studio and equipment we would like to finish this project as fast as we would want. 

Consider
this a bench-marker.
PHASE 3 - Soaring
to the Planet's Surface

=========================================
$108,335 - With this number we can get a studio set up and our Dev-Team
is paid full-time.  However, we will not have all the equipment and tools that we would like though we can finish development for Meep at full-time.
PHASE 4 - Fully Powered up Meep

===========================================
$137,975.60 - With this number we are able to have a fully functional Studio with everything development wants to finish this project. We will have purchased several new pieces of equipment and programs we don't necessarily need to finish development but they will make the process a lot easier. Everyone can give their full effort to this project, and
not worry about any side jobs or such things in order to pay for rent
etc.   MCE can focus full force
on Meep and we shall make a great game 

 
              
                   
       
PHASE 5 - Bonus Option                
     

 ===========================================
  $167,972.
.00 - Same
as previous, but now we hire an additional programmer to make development go even quicker. 
*$29,996.40 - Per additional programmer (it should be noted we are only going to be
hiring extra programmers as a consideration should we get past PHASE 4)

PHASE 6 - Advanced Video Feed ===========================================
$197,968.40 - At
this point MCE will have its own mini studio 

2
programmers, 2 artists,  2 developers, 2 voice actors and an extra $4,285.20/month dedicated to upgrading all our tech which we will be
showing off throughout development.  While the default web-cams and
mics we have are nice, we would like to give you and everyone helping
us the best quality in everything we're doing.  Thus the upgrades for
everyone on the team.  So those are our phases!  I am now going to hand you back To Harry Thompson.Thank you Andrew and here's some more details on some perks we are excited about... More Exciting Details on the Perks Our base-line perk to buy the game is 15 bucks.The expanded perk: Spacebat Savior, is a copy of the game as well as dedicating 5 dollars to Extra Life, helping children who haven't had the chance to chase their dreams as fervently as we are chasing ours for a mere 20 dollars. 
People
	who give at $100.00 will get to be in the game as a background
	character!  Our backgrounds currently have some empty spaces for
	animations, we're hoping some of you will help us fill up the villages, carts and audiences to battle sequences etc. We call
	this "Digital Immortality." It becomes unavailable when we have
	filled all the empty spaces in the game.  I expect to have room
	for around 120 different people.
At $220.00 dollars we are offering a collectors art book with a leather bound design which looks as close as we could get to the storybook in game. In it printed on its pages are the images of all the artwork in the game.  So you can show it off to your friends, get ideas for some cool fan art, or put it in a pile of other epic art books you happen to own.  
Another
level of funding at $250.00 helps you work with us at MCE to create a
boss for the Random Boss Roulette Arena!  There are going to be 5
bosses, 1 of them we are already working on! We won't tell you until
this reward tier fills up, but when it does we will reveal the
bosses we will want to work on with you. You also get three digital soundtracks and games.

For people who want all the accessories, you can get "Echo's Deal" for $450.00 
Designing a power up at $600.00! 
Even assist in level design for $1,500.00! 
As you can see, there are numerous exciting ways to get involved, and get swag! 


IF We Come Up Short.

Ok, no one wants to fail, but the fact of the matter is it happens.  However, we have made a commitment to this game and to all of our supporters.  Even if we do not reach our entire goal, we will work with what we have gathered
and then get the rest through investment. 

However we want you, the
fans to give us enough through this go-go that we at MCE don’t need
as much as we would without you, and give you a little something extra you wouldn't necessarily have the opportunity for otherwise!  

While it might take a couple more
months to complete than if we got funding, we will get this game done. If
there's one thing we at MCE don’t like, its not finishing a good
project.  As a Gamer, I know people who have gotten burned like
that before and MCE is committed to not being those people.  
   

Why We feel We Need Meep




	We
	need more than Toho and a handful of Space Invader clones.  Meep
	is the start of a series of games I want to make happen. I'm not
	trying to make a game for the sake of making a game, I’m building a
	franchise and Meep is a fun game concept to do it with. 

Meep's
	journey is for great cupcakes. Gradius , Raiden and R-type were
	revolutionary games of their time.  I want to see more of this
	game type and I want to see it given a treatment similar to that of
	what companies like Way-forward has done with old games.
For
	me I wanted to make the game about a creature instead of a ship or a
	girl.  I wanted to do a more traditional story, with some irony and
	parody and for that, MCE provides.
Now is the time to create a
	fun game that has more depth than the infinite runners we currently
	have.  I want to introduce newer mechanics such as team moves, etc into the enemy AI and to give a challenge for the player which forces them to adapt to enemy patterns lending a more strategic element than 5,000 bullets on the screen.

Of course there is also YOU:

Meep
	has successfully tested with multiple live audiences children and
	adults alike


	In
	over 20,000 separate demo tests we never got a bad review

And for US as well:


	MCE
	is committed to making great games happen because we as Gamers want
	to see more of these.  Together we want to make that happen for not
	just us but for you.

While this is our first project, everyone involved is skilled with their craft and dedicated to making this work.


Common Questions about Challenges to Us and Risks on Your End. 

I
shall be listing some risks and challenges in bullet point form then
I'm going to show you why you can trust in us and not worry. 
 - MCE
is a young company
 - MCE
has no previous IP's it has worked on.
 - $125,000
dollars is a lot of money  
                 
Our Responses to these concerns


MCE might be a young company, but the people in MCE and the Meep team in general all have varying degrees of work experience.  They know what it takes to get things done.  While none of the Meep team's Programmers or Artists have previous IP all of us have worked on projects before.

You
	can't solve Youth, that happens over time 


MCE
	currently has nothing but devoted workers that want nothing more
	than to do this game and give it the attention it deserves. While this is our first IP as a team, Conrad and everyone else on the team has been
	involved in successful small projects on their own or in smaller groups. 

Furthermore, with the year of work
	previous to this, our skills can create a great IP in Meep and I can
	tell you personally, everyone on this team wants to do more projects
	after this one.  We have no desire to just make one great thing and
	then go away, we want to make multiple things and are hoping you will
	stay. 



Other
Ways You Can Help


I’m
serious when I say I want to build a community.  Start talking to your
friends and generating awareness.  If you wish to do some video feed
of Meep and be involved with showcasing it you can email us at
meepthespacebatisnifty@gmail.com 

This will allow us to talk to you and share some footage with you with only some minor stipulations. Please share this with as many people
as you can and  get as many people to give as much financial
support as you can.  
The more we generate, the stronger a game we
can build.  

Our finances are based off of making a game within 7 months to a little over a year


And
that's all there is to it.

story:
What is Hado?

Hado is and unique and high end, augmented reality eSport attraction from Japan that serves as a hybrid between physical sports and videogames. It's not VR, it's better!

Think "Tron" but in real life...

  • With AR when you put on a headset you can still see everyone and everything around you. The software layers the game over reality similar to CGI. Think of the technology as a way more advanced Pokemon Go.
  •  By mapping digital elements into the real world, Hado allows players to use their actual surroundings (including their cosplay) as part of the game, providing for a more physical and realistic experience. 
  • There are no cables or controllers, instead you wear light weight headset and a motion sensing wristband.  Leaving you able to run, duck, dodge and jump freely while competing against people who are actually physically there.
  • It's a social experience, rather than playing against opponents over the internet, participants compete in person on a beautiful 20x30 ft court. 

 

 

The game (Hado PvP)...

  • Hado PvP is an in-depth multiplayer dodge ball style game that allows you to raise shields and shoot orbs of energy from your hand reminiscent of Overwatch or Dragon Ball Z.
  • Before each round players can adjust the size and speed of their energy blasts as well as their charge rate and shield strength. This allows for the type of strategic team play that you find in popular team based RPG's and shooters.
  • It's a competitive sport in Japan with the Hado World Cup offering prizes reaching over $100,000 USD!

 

 

We Already Have All The Tech:

In mid 2019, I started my company Nebula Amusements and imported Hado from Japan, securing exclusivity for our region.

  • We held three small events to get our feet wet before we debuted it at Michigan's largest anime convention Youmacon 2019.

 

 

Our Goal:

Our overall goal is three fold:

  • To take Hado to various anime, comic, and gaming conventions throughout the United States and Ontario, Canada, as well as holding our own cosplay themed events for fandoms such as My Hero Academia, Harry Potter, League of Legends, and more!
  • To open a cosplay themed arcade bar and restaurant in our home state of Michigan. We want to combat post-con depression by creating a place where patrons can enjoy the magic of conventions all year round.
  • To establish the first national Hado league in the US and take a team to compete in the Hado World Cup. 

 

With this campaign we are looking to get through the economic downturn of covid-19 and increase the amount of events that we both hold and attend in 2021.  With the profit from those ventures we look to secure a physical location to create a cosplay themed arcade bar and restaurant.

 

Why We Need Your Help:

Due to Covid-19 we were not permitted to hold any events in 2020 and every convention who had booked us for 2020 has been cancelled. As a result we have had absolutely no revenue this year while still having had to pay our bills. This has drained us financially and in order to survive and establish our vison we need your financial support.

 

Additional Ways To Show Your Support:

The most impactful way to show your support is by making a donation, but other ways include:

  • Sharing this campaign on social media and encouraging others donate and share as well.
  • Contacting the major anime, comic, and gaming conventions in your area and letting them know that you want Nebula Amusements to bring Hado AR to their event.
  • Visiting our website and signing up for our emailing list @ www.nebulaamusements.com
  • Following us on social media @ www.facebook.com/nebulaamusements and www.instagram.com/nebulaamusements

 

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
What Is This Campaign About?

Last year, the entire 2016 class at Gameheads applied for and won 4 out of the 20 ESA LOFT Video Game Innovation Fellowships that was offered nationwide. Following in the foot steps Team LUCID who won the 2014 ESA LOFT Video Game Innovation Fellowship with their game on overcoming grief; after winning, they earned their way to E3 2015 thanks to their many contributors. A look into their journey.

UPbeat Oakland Games | Project - LUCiD​

 

The fellowship identifies and promotes innovators who can create video games or mobile apps that will focus on new approaches to address local and global social issues. Each team received a $1000 grant to continue development on their games, national recognition, and tickets for the entire team to this year's Electronic Entertainment Expo (E3); the world's premier event for computer, video and mobile games and related products.

Now, as we follow in the footsteps of our predecessors and take the trip to E3 as well. We need your help! There are a lot more people who are going this year; a total of 12 people, five of which are under 18 and require chaperones to attend as well. 

Now we need your help to get us there. 

We already have the tickets accounted for but we still need $8500 to pay for all of us to attend the event.

This money pays for the:

  • Car rental
  • Gas
  • Hotel expenses
  •  Food
Each team has worked hard over the past year, hoping to make their game come to fruition. Three of these teams are scheduled for completion within the next couple months. So, If you are interested in supporting us, we encourage you to take a look at each team below and follow, like, retweet and/or share our campaign on social media.

Meet The Gameheads

Team Halls High | Project - Halls High

|

Halls High is about a boy named Jeremiah who is failing his classes and is far too lazy to care. One day he meets a mysterious tutor who introduces him to a magical “solution” that begins a wild adventure. Inspired by Persona and Bill and Ted’s Excellent Adventure, Halls High is a coming of age story about a black teenager who must learn the importance of dealing with both fear and success.

 

Team Phantom | Project - Dual Meanings

 

Dual Meanings follows the story of two art students, Seth and Rose, who have been tasked with an assignment to create a work of beauty. Seth uses the opportunity to paint a picture of Rose, but she has differing opinions on beauty. With their convictions at odds, Seth must traverse through obstacles representing their differences with Rose in order to reach a compromise.

 

Team Tastic | Project - Amnesiacs​

|

Amnesiacs is a co-op horror/mystery game. You play as one of four strangers who wakes up in a mysterious town without any knowledge of how you got there. Together you must find away out while you deal with debilitating health issues.

 

Team Evil Goatee | Project - Desolation

A story-based game about immigrants who are crossing from Latin America to the U.S. The main character living in Guatemala all his life must flee. He is exposed to different hazards and problems in his attempt to get into Mexico and through its land before even getting to then across the U.S. border. Using aspects of folklore when we get towards the Mexican-American border allows us to demonstrate the culture and implement some interesting game mechanics.

And If You Can't Give

That's absolutely OK. We're grateful for any support towards spreading the word about Gameheads and this fundraiser.

If you'd like to know more about us feel free to visit any of our websites, where you can find links to our social media pages as well.

If you're interested at all with what we're doing, give us a follow and we'll be sure to keep you up to date as we move forward with our projects, E3, and any other future projects and developments.

Thank You!

Interested in the Gameheads Program?

Over the course of a year, Gameheads teaches video game design and development, education and career counseling, industry exposure, and hands-on training to students from ages 15-24. The students learn how to create, code and design games, building skills across specific fields necessary to thrive in technology, from coding to visual art, creative writing, design thinking, project management, team building, animation and game theory.

As the only tech justice program in the East Bay that focuses strictly on video games, Gameheads have a youth-centered learning focus, which ensures highly engaged youth and an exciting organizational culture, creativity, innovation, and critical thinking about the intersection of technology and multiculturalism are important values of the program.

story:
Guns and Robots is a free to play online third person shooter. The game brings robot action with massive customization. Players get cartoony bright 3D graphics in attractive environments and challenge each other in open arenas. Guns and Robots gives fun, entertaining experience with easy to master gameplay and numerous options to experiment robot constructing skills.

Official website: https://play-gar.com/
Steam webpage: https://store.steampowered.com/app/293540



Massive customization. In Guns and Robots, the robots come in three module classes based on players' assembly and unlimited options for character customization.




Pinpoint enemies with multiple weapons simultaneously. Wide variety of potential combinations per weapon allows players to fine—tune their arsenal according to their game play preferences.




Enjoyable and extremely funny online arenas where players literally blast their way through.



Adrenaline-pumping game play. Different maps add fine mixture of thrill, speed and action to the game play.



Dynamic combat experience. Players can choose to line up for high-level real-time combat.



Player Guilds. Players can join, create guilds and benefit from numerous guild features.



Achievements. Variety of achievements for the players with exceptional performance.

Guns and Robots development was focused on the satisfaction of its players’ needs and preferences. There were no efforts spent on its marketing and spread activities and, even though, it managed to board Steam and many other first-class expansion channels. Now, when we are stepping the final level we need to invest in widening Guns and Robots gamers base mainly through the social features (FB, friends guilds, etc.), game content & tools.



Send automatic invites to friends by Facebook
– and get rewards for each invite

Optimized game performance
– the game will run smoothly even on lowest end hardware

New drone spy and battle device
– remotely control a drone in-game, spy and kill your enemies with it!




Coop Mode
– Players will team up and fight with AI opponents and bosses and will win numerous rewards and prices

Numerous bug fixes and improved balance
– We want to improve your experience in the game and to adjust all our support entirely to your way of thinking and loving

Less waiting in queue
– we will improve the matchmaking logic and make sure that less players lose their precious time to wait in queues and get faster into action




New Game Map
– New Game Map for the PvP and Coop action

New Robot Parts and weapons
– tailor-made according to your wishes, we will provide you with new robot parts and weapons upon your specific private order for the sake of having the chance of choosing from the broadest customization options ever!




Now all of you have the unique opportunity of entering the game, checking its current state and providing the precious to us feedback. We are already dealing with our new development stage where all your comments, suggestions and ideas about Guns and Robots game experience are vital! Our aim is to provide our gamers more fun through the social features like Facebook and the new guns, maps, tools and players.

Enjoy your perks and witness the upcoming blast of
Guns and Robots!
Thank you for your support!

story:
What is Dragon's Gate?

Dragon's Gate is an android game developed by programmer Brad Rowan and graphics designer Dylan Moye. The game is a play till you drop game in which you have to throw mailboxes at dragons to keep them from invading your homeland. You can get sprees, badges, earn coins, change your character, and even select different mailboxes, such as an electric mailbox that electrocutes dragons!

View on Google Play https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=d...


What We Need & What You Get

The hardest part about getting a game started on Google Play is getting downloads so that Google promotes the game. Being in college and highschool, funds are tight, and we don't have tons of money to blow on advertising. What we need is awesome donors who will help us advertise in return for many different things to offer. Every donor will receive the full version of the game with a promo code we will personally email. Then depending on the amount, donors will receive anything from getting to name and design characters to receiving a percent of the revenue!


Why Does a Game Need Money?

The hardest thing for any young developer is getting publicity and advertising. By teaming up with you, we'll be able to promote Dragon's Gate and hopefully earn many times what we invested, and be able to share this with our donors.

Risks & Challenges

Basically the only risk with a game like this is that it will not take off. However, based on Brad's experience and Dylan's creativity we are confident there is a good chance for it to succeed. If it does not do well, we will try to repay our donors in whatever way possible. The Flappy Birds developer supposedly had 42 games before Flappy Birds took off, and in our case we are not intimidated by failure either. 


About The Developers

Programmer: Brad - Brad has been programming for about 7 years now. He has experience in VB, C#, C++, java, and several other languages. He has developed many programs, including a simulator that drove a 100 million dollar expansion for a local business. He is a college student, and also works part time at Deere-Hitachi in Kernersville, developing applications for their assembly.
Graphics Design: Dylan - Dylan is a high school senior with several years of graphics design experience. He, like Brad, works part time, and is looking to go to college to major in something graphics-design related. He is very creative, and designed most of the good looking graphics for Dragon's Gate (Brad was responsible for the iffy ones).

story:
Overview

The ADNS 3050 sensor is an entry level gaming mouse sensor with motion detection up to 60 IPS and a selectable resolution up to 2000 CPI (Counts Per Inch). It tracks motion in the X and Y axis. Unlike laser sensors, the CPI is consistent with changes in speed with variations, whereas laser sensors vary by as much as 5%, which reduces accuracy. This board has everything needed to utilize the ADNS-3050 sensor, including an onboard voltage regulator for 5v operation.

The board is 32 mm x 52 mm with 4 mounting holes.The whole project is entirely open source, the hardware design, code library, and examples are all available for free to download. I've also provided the models of my mouse example to make it easy for those who want to design or print their own. 

Communication

The ADNS 3050 communicates via SPI with only 6 wires needed total (MOSI,MISO,SCLK,PWR,GND, and chip select).

Features

  • Easy to use library
  • High Accuracy
  • Low cost
  • On board voltage regulator
  • Adjustable resolution up to 2000 CPI (250cpi increments)
  • 60 IPS
  • Acceleration up to 20g

Applications

  • Custom Gaming Mice
  • Robotics
  • Motion Tracking
  • Motion Input Devices

Mouse Kit

The mouse kit consists of:

  • Both 3D printed parts printed in PLA at .15mm layer height and cleaned of support material 
  • Two switches for the mouse buttons
  • One sensor board and lens
  • Stranded CAT 5e wire (the wire used in the video is solid, I feel stranded would be better, more flexibility & strength) 
  •  All the necessary miscellaneous bolts, screws and nuts.

The code used in the video to emulate the mouse is also available. Construction is pretty straight forward but instructions will be provided. 

 

 

There will be 3 colors available for the mouse, black  and 2 others that will be suggested by and voted on by the backers. 

References

Design, Code and Examples - https://github.com/Tom101222/Adns-3050-Optical-...

story:
Hey there!

I am Danni (or Roadbloc) and I am currently developing The Mystery of Robot Planet! I love being creative in my spare time and after finishing my latest book I decided to focus my efforts on a video game. As a long time gamer and fan of many games, I have always made time to be developing silly little personal projects. This, however, is my first effort at something decent, something sellable and hopefully something awesome.

What I Need & What You Get

Normally, I would have completed this project in my own time like I did with my books. However, regretfully, I have recently found myself unemployed. This means I cannot continue dedicating time to this project until I find a replacement job ...or I am able to drum up some funds and keep my rent paid.

  • I'm asking for £2000. If I reach this goal, it shall pay my rent for a while and I can continue development throughout my job search.
  • Anything helps. Even if I don't reach the goal any contributions will equate to development time.
  • All contributors who give £2 or more will receive a DRM-free copy of the game upon release for Windows, Mac and Linux.
  • All funds will go on paying rent. I have zero development costs other than my time.
  • Also, if I reach the full amount, I will put time and effort into researching how to make an Android port of the game. And then I'll port it. :)

The Game

The Mystery of Robot Planet is an 8bit-inspired adventure puzzle game. Graphically akin to early GameBoy Pokemon and Zelda titles. Gameplay similar to games like Monkey Island and Beneath a Steel Sky. Here is a list of the features my engine has to offer (so far)-

  • Colourful top-down view of the game's world. In 8(ish) bits!
  • Inspect any world object (for clues, plot exposition or inventory items).
  • Speak to any NPC (again, for clues, plot exposition or inventory items).
  • Inventory system for looking at inventory items, combining inventory items together, giving items to NPCs or using inventory items on world objects.
  • Use in-game "terminals" (PCs) for clues, plot exposition, inventory items or puzzle mechanics.
  • "Cutscene" engine to power automatic movement of player character or movement of NPCs.

For a taste, take a look at the walkthrough video. Or even better, visit my Itch.io page to download the beta for yourself!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot spare me the cash but like what you see, that's cool. But please consider sharing this page!! And the itch.io page!

story:
Short Summary

RthaurG was shut down last September due to some security issues with the hardware and networking. There was also some huge conflict with the owners. However, our passion for creating a better and more enjoyable platform to play on is burning bright. We believe that it is of the best interest for the gaming community and fellow gamers to create and host enjoyable servers to play on.

Join us.

What We Need & What You Get

RthaurG had been running for 2 years and it's a pity to put it all down. I believe we'll need to work together in order to bring it back again. Funding is of utmost importance to RthaurG because hardware and servers are expensive due to huge demand in Asia. We believe it's very important to get top-notch hardware to host our servers. 

Funding will go 100% towards any server development and monthly payment for the services. (The funding is made transparent and shown on Trello).

$500 - Will be put aside strictly for funding the server.(In terms of hardware and networking)      

$250 - Dedicated to building the forums/website

$250 - Any plugins needed to run/maintain the server. ( Plugin development/Hiring individual developers to cater to our needs.)

Perks

With indigogo, as long as you become a backer, you'll get access to the following :

  • ANY game server tests when available.(Alpha and Beta phases)
  • Backer ranking when the servers are up. (This will be EXTREMELY EXCLUSIVE and only one time rank you'll be able to get ONLY on Indiegogo.)
  • A chance to get your own store-tag. - Only 25 backers out of the total fifty will be asked to provide a suggestion for a store tag.
  • A exclusive chance to add the developers on steam and talk to them about the servers!
  • FULL ACCESS to reserved slots (up to 5 per server) when the servers are back up.
  • Shiny and new backer tag on the forums.
  • Private rundown video on how the forums will work
  • Early access to view and sign up on the forums
  • Invitation into the RthaurG Backer Group! 

When you become a veteran backer... you get the following

  • Everything included with being a backer
  • FULL Chance to get a personalized tag [Game servers]
  • FULL Report on what's going on with the servers on a personal steam group
  • Dedicated suggestions will try to be implemented if it fits the gameplay/type of the server. 
  • Veteran backer rank + tag when the servers are up. [ONLY 100]

As a ultimate backer.. you get all this! :

  • Everything included with being a veteran backer and backer
  • FULL Report on what's going on with the servers on a personal steam group 
  • FULL ACCESS to a specialized tag [ONLY 10]
  • Your very own personalized tag[Forums + in game] - Takes priority
  • Personalized email address with RthaurG eg : brian@rthaurg.com / brian@rthaurg.net
  • Ultimate backer rank and tag. [10]
  • A chance to meet the minds behind RthaurG. [SINGAPORE]
  • Personalized forums page.[Not fully]

Being a investor.. 

  • Investor rank on the servers along with the forums
  • Everything included with being a backer to ultimate backer.
  • Personalized email address with RthaurG eg : brian@rthaurg.com / brian@rthaurg.net
  • Personalized forums page[Fully]
  • Investor tag
  • Meet the minds behind RthaurG to have a sit-down discussion during lunch.
  • Chance to join the RthaurG Board.[Development or Management] - More information will be given about this.

The Impact

Project RthaurG is a continuation and revival of a old csgo gaming community. We plan to come back stronger as a better platform.

  • Giving CSGO players a new platform to play on as their playground.
  • To explore different unexplored routes never explored by others
  • Keeping the community nice and friendly whenever someone new is there.
  • Grow esports and to potentially help people with social anxiety.
  • Set-up base camp to get players to donate and encourage people to support charitys.

Risks & Challenges

The staff at RthaurG have faced many challenges and may have stumbled over them, however they have always  got back up.

  1. DDOS is a big challenge that we've faced due to certain notorious people.

With a bigger backing and more support than ever, RthaurG is able to get help from many experts through the internet that have been more than willing to help.

    2. Uncertainties and Trust among staff members.

There had been many trust issues among the owners due to corruption with one of the owners, these issues have now been resolved as I can assure you that the current owners are without a doubt as passionate and as dedicated as ever.

   3. Uncertainties with Donations.

Due to reckless actions in the past with one of the owners,embezzling the funds for personal use. There has been doubt regarding donations. Fret not, Donations will and only can be made via a secured gateway (Paypal) so you can watch where the funds are going. [A webpage will be done for this] : Trello

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share these with any old past RthaurG player and tell them about the good news
  • Provide suggestions and feedback with the upcoming website and test servers!

 

Frequently Asked Questions

These are some of the frequently asked questions that have been brought up during the campaign's duration. Please comment on the campaign page if you have anymore questions!

  • Will there be any form of weapon skins/breaking of valve's community server guidelines like in the past? : No. I do know that in the past we've broken several guidelines but we will now follow and enforce the guidelines to the best of our abilities.

However, our passion for creating a better and more enjoyable platform to play on is burning bright. We believe that it is of the best interest for the gaming community and fellow gamers to create and host enjoyable servers to play on.
Join us.

What We Need & What You Get

Funding is of utmost importance to RthaurG because hardware and servers are expensive due to huge demand in Asia. We believe it's very important to get top-notch hardware to host our servers.

About this project

Meet DASH!!

Dash was riding a bike and somehow his bike has gone rogue. Dash needs your help to make sure that he does not get himself/others hurt and he reaches a safe spot. 

Guide him safely through various traps, clear obstructions from his path, and shift his surroundings to create a safe passage. Solve environment puzzles in a fantasy world, find multiple pathways through the game, and collect stars to experience this fast thrilling environment. 

You are Dash’s only Chance, and your imagination is the key to his Safety. Help Dash from dashing. 

Rogue Bike highlights: 

- Over 40 paths to explore (and more coming with updates) 

- Environment puzzles where you shape the path, move obstacles, use elevators, interact with objects and more to clear Dash's way 

- Visuals optimized for the most powerful Android Devices 

- Quality design from award-winning developers

Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=__S0zHM2mGM

Demo: http://www.holodeckus.com/rogue.html

story:
If you care, share!

If you care, please share via the buttons above the Perks, or copy/paste the URL, write it on a postcard, and mail it to a friend!

Short Summary

I'm Steve Dodge. I started playing in '87 and ran my first tournament in '89. Since then, I've dreamed of bringing the best players in the world to the mainstream. On June 23rd, we will start our journey. On that day, with your help, we would like to take a huge step forward with Live Multi-Card Coverage.

  • Building great DG events (MSDGC, Vibram Open) since 2004.
  • This dream, which I hope you share, is close to fruition.
  • If successful, we will help usher in the Modern Age of Disc Golf.

2016 can be game changing, the year our sport turned the corner and became legitimate to the media, spectators and sponsors.

What We Need & What You Get

We need equipment, bandwidth and people. Two card coverage will cost just south of $10,000. Three card coverage, $20,000.

  • Bandwidth - $2,500: $500 per event X 5 events
  • Teradeck - $5,000 for Beam Transmitter via six channel cell signals
  • Cameraperson - $2,000 for 20 days of coverage (yes, way underpaid, but we are running thin and looking to the future)

The Impact

Your donation will improve live coverage for everyone and bring our sport to the mainstream faster.

  • Witness the death knell of jiggly walking camera.
  • Watch the player on the second card that is making a run.
  • Knowing the story, creating compelling coverage, pushing the envelope.

Risks & Challenges

In disc golf, this has never been done. We have an amazing team in place that, with the correct resources, will be able to make this work. The team at Smashboxx TV have over a decade of experience in covering live disc golf. Additionally, with Joe Hite and Jamie Thomas, we have put together a great editing team and amazing talent.

  • We are ready and capable to make this happen.
  • Your help will give us the opportunity.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share our campaign with your friends.
  • You can even use the IndieGogo tools to share across multiple platforms.

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone!  We're looking to turn our passion into a business.  Rhiannon has been playing video games since around 1990 (including rare systems like the Atari Jaguar and TurboGrafix) and got into D&D and Magic around 1998.  Still a gamer even with 2 kids (up and coming gamers themselves!) but with more focus on video games than tabletop nowadays.  Robert has about the same amount of experience with video games, moreso in different genres, and more experience in CCGs and the like.  

Many of the local shops we have found are small, dark, not much room for gaming.  And nothing really in the general area to play console or PC games unless you want to take a drive to get there.  We want to make a brighter, more welcoming shop with plenty of room for everyone, regardless of the type of gaming.

The reason for this campaign is we want to gauge if others are as interested in a shop like this in the Waterbury/Southington area.  By showing your support you become a part of the shop, you can say YOU HELPED MAKE IT HAPPEN!  And by showing your support we know we are not alone in wanting a full-service shop like this.

What We Need & What You Get

We are trying to raise $70,000 to start this venture up, with stretch goals should we make it.  Starting supplies for each area aren't too much, but when you put everything together it adds up fast.  The biggest amounts being the games, PCs and Consoles.  

We're offering LIMITED EDITION t-shirts, hoodies, wristbands, and gaming time as rewards.  Also, every contributor of $5 or more will have their name on our "Credits" wall in the shop, a permanent reminder of your contribution.

If we don't reach our goal, we can at least take what we do raise to the bank for a loan for the rest.  We'd rather not pay the interest if we don't have to though!

If we DO reach our goal, we have a few stretch goals in mind.  One being a Dance Revolution arcade setup. Another being retro and hard-to-find systems available to play.

The Impact

Having been in the gaming world long enough, we've been in our share of different shops.  We've seen ones that boggle our mind as to how they are still open.  We've seen LAN centers come and go, at least twice, in Waterbury alone.  We feel that offering everything would be a boon to the area.  

Our son is 7 and loves Pokemon.  He's advanced in his reading, in part, due to reading comics and video game dialogue.  When we mentioned the idea to him, his eyes lit up!  He wants to set up a kid's gaming area in the shop.  Many of our friends have the same interests and hobbies.  It's difficult at times to navigate through a small shop when you have kids in tow, we know this from experience.  A kid's room gives them a safe place to play while the parents play.  

Also, with a female co-owner/employee, we're hoping to show that it's ok for girls to be geeks!  Embrace your inner (and outer) geek-ness with us!  Whether you're a PC or Console gamer, Marvel or DC fan, Dr Who or Dr Robotnik, we'll have something for you here!

Risks & Challenges

There is a chance we don't raise enough to cover everything.  If we can at least raise enough to start small, that would work.  There is enough call for this type of shop for our area that I don't think we'll have too much trouble building up to the full store if we don't raise enough.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is tight all around.  We won't take it personally if you can't do the $10 "Thank you".  You reading this, and clicking the link is more help than you can imagine.  So spread the word!  Share the link on social media, tell your friends, and when we open, be sure to stop in and say HI!!

story:
'State of Anarchy' is a casual top-down shooter about a common citizen caught in the middle of a riot in a small town. Pen drawn graphics and moth made sound effects create a unique hilarious atmosphere of mayhem and craziness.
The idea of this game was brainstormed on Minsk Global Game Jam Contest. For almost a year we were working hard to turn this award-winning prototype into a full-fledged game. Finally, we've released it on Steam.
After receiving tons of positive feedback we want to expand the game by adding new gameplay mechanics, weapons, enemies, game stages and other cool stuff! This content will be available as a DLC 'Rage of the Angry Citizen'. And we need your help to make it possible!
Note: DLC content will be available for free for every State of Anarchy owner on Steam.



The idea of this game came at Minsk Global Game Jam Contest in 2015. Right at that moment the country was suffering an economic crisis, banks were overcrowded with people trying to buy foreign currency. So I decided to create a game about a common citizen caught in the middle of economic collapse. The guy is running from one bank to another while shooting his hostile competitors.


In a few hours I managed to gather a team of rag-tag developers and we started to work. There was only 1 artist in our team, so we decided to use very simple graphical style that looks like a pen drawing in a schoolboy note.

This visual style of the game turn out to be a cornerstone of our game which shaped the rest of the concept. It was later enhanced by sound effects made by mouth. These two features provided unique look and feel of the game and helped it to stand out from the crowd.

Game Jam ‘State of Anarchy’ team

The game was made in just two days and turned out to be a big success! People found it a hilarious experience. After receiving ‘best game’ award we decided to continue our work and turn a half-baked prototype into a full fledged game.
This task proved to be much more difficult than we originally expected. The original conception was to create crazy open world arcade shooter with frantic gameplay. While the overall concept of the game seemed to be ok, we had tons of problems while trying to combine different mechanics and create a coherent playing experience. Months of intense work were passing by, but we didn’t give up!
At last, ‘State of Anarchy’ game was born! It was successfully Greenlit and is available on Steam.
State of Anarchy on Steam


Game soundtrack was created by a talented street musician Chatski. I still can't believe he did such amazing job for free!
The game received a very warm welcome from Steam community:

But we also received some criticism:


Overall the main complaint was that the game is too short and shallow. In order to respond to this we want to create an expansion pack with new mechanics and content which will enhance playing experience and moves our game to a new level!

We need your help to achieve this!


Our team has been working on the game for almost a year on pure enthusiasm. So it will take months until the game generate enough profit to cover our costs. By releasing the game we’ve proved it’s worth. We’ve received good very positive feedback and we know it’s fun to play. We want to make a next step right now and we need relatively small amount of money for this. Most importantly - we need to know that there are enough people out there, who likes our game and want to see it in a new shape.

If you think that ‘State of Anarchy’ deserves to be developed into a solid game - let’s do it together!
Note: DLC content will be available for free for every State of Anarchy owner on Steam.



We don’t want just to throw in some extra content.

Our goal is to add new elements for each aspect of gameplay, such as:

  • New core mechanic - rage,

  • New gamplay mode - flying in a jet

  • New types of enemies with different behavior,

  • Cool guns which shoot bouncing bullets or portals to another dimension,

  • Epic final boss battle,

  • New locations, stages, talents, music tracks and other great stuff!


Here is the description of features we have in mind.

Rage mechanic

‘Rage’ is an activated ability of a hero which dramatically increases his speed and rate of fire allowing to quickly clear out a horde of enemies. Rage will be extremely useful in tight situations and during boss fights. Also while enraged the character will shout 'A-A-A!!!' while pulling the trigger. This mechanic was inspired by a short parody video ‘Rambo 94 - Last blood’.

New gameplay mode - flying in a jet

Before you could walk around a town or drive a car. After you'll be able to fly in a combat jet shooting down those pesky UFO's. We don't want another alien invasion, do we?

New weapons

Bouncing Shooter - this gun shoots a burst of three bullets which bounce from the enemies hurting them with each hit.

Bolt Cannon - once a construction tool, now a weapon which shoots steel bolts in ten direction at once!

Warp Gun - this alien weapon creates a gate to another dimension which sucks the enemies in and then spits them out.

New enemies

Jet Rider - This guy is desperate to get you! He flies like a fly (heh-heh) right above your head and throws grenades right in front of you.

UFO - It appears this thing came from outer space to take part in the riot! It positions itself in front of a moving player’s car and attack it with laser beams.

Mad Marksman - unlike other Mad Rioters this guy is taking his time and distance waiting for an opening to deliver a deadly shot.

Epic final boss battle

Every game needs a grand finale! For such a crazy game the final battle must take place on another planet. So it will be an entirely new location with hordes of angry aliens trying to piss you off.

Mid bosses

Mid Bosses are tough opponents that spawns from time to time in a crowd of regular enemies. While Mid Boss poses a higher threat, killing it rewards you with med kit and extra experience points. The decision to fight him or to run away is up to you.

Additional content

  1. New hero’s talents - Righteous Rage (increases Rage duration) and Sharp Shooter (increases weapon range).

  2. New locations - In case we gather enough funds we will add new locations such as supermarket or fast food restaurant. Town map also will be expanded.

  3. New stages - With this new content we can add 11 new stages or even more!

  4. Extended soundtrack - With luck we’ll compose additional music tracks for the game and release it as a DLC.

  5. Hero’s avatars - you’ll be able to choose hero’s look from several avatars.

  6. More colorful graphics and new special effects

  7. Steam Achievments

Stretch goal 1:  $3 000

  • Rage mechanic

  • New weapons

  • New stages

Stretch goal 2: $5 000

  • New enemy types

  • New talents

  • Midbosses

Stretch goal 3: $10 000

  • Hero’s avatars

  • Expanded town map

  • New locations

  • More colorful graphics and new special effects

Stretch goal 4: $20 000

  • Epic final boss battle

  • Steam achievements

  • Extended OST available as DLC

Stretch goal 5: $30 000

  • New gameplay mode - flying in a jet

  • Joystick support

  • Mobile version of the game

Why Indiegogo?

State of Anarchy game was made by enthusiasts with zero funding. Although our game is currently on sale in Steam, it costs about $1. It will take months until it generates some profit to cover our costs. Personally I don’t mind working on the game for free. This is a dream job after all! But I can’t ask the same devotion from my team. Most of the money we gather will be spend on programming, art and music production.

Fellow Citizen: $1

Your name in game credits.

Unlimited

Hard Worker: $5

You’ll receive digital copy of the game after release,

+ your name in game credits.

Unlimited

Team Leader: $10

You’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,

+ your name in game credits.

Unlimited

Big Boss: $50

Your doodle image will be added in the game as a boss or an enemy,

+ you’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,

+ your name in game credits.

Quantity: 30

Friendly Patron: $500

Your doodle image will be added in the game as a hero’s avatar,

+ you’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,

+ your name in game credits.

Quantity: 8

Prosperous Tycoon: $1000

You will become the founder of the town. A magnificent monument with your name will be erected in the town’s center.

+ your doodle image will be added in the game as a hero's avatar, a boss or an enemy,

+ you’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,

+ your name in game credits.

Quantity: 3



Andy Jr - this guy is responsible for the crazy idea of the game and writing this text. He’s a professional game designer with 8 years of experience in game development. He also made all that bang-bang sounds and screaming you hear during the game.



Sergion is a lone wolf coder. Although he joined the project in the middle of a journey, he turned out to be the only one who could handle routine everyday work. Without his incredible working capacity and patience the project would be impossible to complete.



Paulp is a talented artist and indie game developer. His help with graphics and special effects was essential to the project. Whenever you see something beautiful in the game - this is Paulp’s work.

Funds distribution

Programming - 50%

Graphics - 25%

Music - 5%

Platform fees and taxes - 15%

Rewards - 5%

Risks and challenges

We’ve come a long way and proved our worth as an indie game developers. Should we meet at least stretch 1 goal - ‘Rage of the Angry Citizen’ DLC will be developed and released with basic features. If we got lucky and raise more money - the production will take more time, but no longer than 6 months.


If you like our game, please, spread the word about this project!

Together we can achieve anything!
