'State of Anarchy' is a casual top-down shooter about a common citizen caught in the middle of a riot in a small town. Pen drawn graphics and moth made sound effects create a unique hilarious atmosphere of mayhem and craziness.The idea of this game was brainstormed on Minsk Global Game Jam Contest. For almost a year we were working hard to turn this award-winning prototype into a full-fledged game. Finally, we've released it on Steam.After receiving tons of positive feedback we want to expand the game by adding new gameplay mechanics, weapons, enemies, game stages and other cool stuff! This content will be available as a DLC 'Rage of the Angry Citizen'. And we need your help to make it possible!
Note: DLC content will be available for free for every State of Anarchy owner on Steam.









 
The idea of this game came at Minsk Global Game Jam Contest in 2015. Right at that moment the country was suffering an economic crisis, banks were overcrowded with people trying to buy foreign currency. So I decided to create a game about a common citizen caught in the middle of economic collapse. The guy is running from one bank to another while shooting his hostile competitors. 

In a few hours I managed to gather a team of rag-tag developers and we started to work. There was only 1 artist in our team, so we decided to use very simple graphical style that looks like a pen drawing in a schoolboy note.
This visual style of the game turn out to be a cornerstone of our game which shaped the rest of the concept. It was later enhanced by sound effects made by mouth. These two features provided unique look and feel of the game and helped it to stand out from the crowd.




Game Jam ‘State of Anarchy’ team
The game was made in just two days and turned out to be a big success! People found it a hilarious experience. After receiving ‘best game’ award we decided to continue our work and turn a half-baked prototype into a full fledged game.

This task proved to be much more difficult than we originally expected. The original conception was to create crazy open world arcade shooter with frantic gameplay. While the overall concept of the game seemed to be ok, we had tons of problems while trying to combine different mechanics and create a coherent playing experience. Months of intense work were passing by, but we didn’t give up!


At last, ‘State of Anarchy’ game was born! It was successfully Greenlit and is available on Steam.

State of Anarchy on Steam





Game soundtrack was created by a talented street musician Chatski. I still can't believe he did such amazing job for free!

The game received a very warm welcome from Steam community:





But we also received some criticism:




Overall the main complaint was that the game is too short and shallow. In order to respond to this we want to create an expansion pack with new mechanics and content which will enhance playing experience and moves our game to a new level!
We need your help to achieve this!
Our team has been working on the game for almost a year on pure enthusiasm. So it will take months until the game generate enough profit to cover our costs. By releasing the game we’ve proved it’s worth. We’ve received good very positive feedback and we know it’s fun to play. We want to make a next step right now and we need relatively small amount of money for this. Most importantly - we need to know that there are enough people out there, who likes our game and want to see it in a new shape.
If you think that ‘State of Anarchy’ deserves to be developed into a solid game - let’s do it together!
Note: DLC content will be available for free for every State of Anarchy owner on Steam.










We don’t want just to throw in some extra content.
Our goal is to add new elements for each aspect of gameplay, such as:

New core mechanic - rage,
New gamplay mode - flying in a jet
New types of enemies with different behavior,
Cool guns which shoot bouncing bullets or portals to another dimension,
Epic final boss battle,
New locations, stages, talents, music tracks and other great stuff!

Here is the description of features we have in mind.
Rage mechanic
‘Rage’ is an activated ability of a hero which dramatically increases his speed and rate of fire allowing to quickly clear out a horde of enemies. Rage will be extremely useful in tight situations and during boss fights. Also while enraged the character will shout 'A-A-A!!!' while pulling the trigger. This mechanic was inspired by a short parody video ‘Rambo 94 - Last blood’.

New gameplay mode - flying in a jet

Before you could walk around a town or drive a car. After you'll be able to fly in a combat jet shooting down those pesky UFO's. We don't want another alien invasion, do we?

New weapons
Bouncing Shooter - this gun shoots a burst of three bullets which bounce from the enemies hurting them with each hit.
Bolt Cannon - once a construction tool, now a weapon which shoots steel bolts in ten direction at once!
Warp Gun - this alien weapon creates a gate to another dimension which sucks the enemies in and then spits them out.
New enemies

Jet Rider - This guy is desperate to get you! He flies like a fly (heh-heh) right above your head and throws grenades right in front of you.
UFO - It appears this thing came from outer space to take part in the riot! It positions itself in front of a moving player’s car and attack it with laser beams.
Mad Marksman - unlike other Mad Rioters this guy is taking his time and distance waiting for an opening to deliver a deadly shot.
Epic final boss battle
Every game needs a grand finale! For such a crazy game the final battle must take place on another planet. So it will be an entirely new location with hordes of angry aliens trying to piss you off.
Mid bosses
Mid Bosses are tough opponents that spawns from time to time in a crowd of regular enemies. While Mid Boss poses a higher threat, killing it rewards you with med kit and extra experience points. The decision to fight him or to run away is up to you.
Additional content

New hero’s talents - Righteous Rage (increases Rage duration) and Sharp Shooter (increases weapon range).
New locations - In case we gather enough funds we will add new locations such as supermarket or fast food restaurant. Town map also will be expanded.
New stages - With this new content we can add 11 new stages or even more!
Extended soundtrack - With luck we’ll compose additional music tracks for the game and release it as a DLC.
Hero’s avatars - you’ll be able to choose hero’s look from several avatars.
More colorful graphics and new special effects
Steam Achievments


Stretch goal 1:  $3 000

Rage mechanic
New weapons
New stages

Stretch goal 2: $5 000

New enemy types
New talents
Midbosses

Stretch goal 3: $10 000

Hero’s avatars
Expanded town map
New locations
More colorful graphics and new special effects

Stretch goal 4: $20 000

Epic final boss battle
Steam achievements
Extended OST available as DLC


Stretch goal 5: $30 000

New gameplay mode - flying in a jet
Joystick support
Mobile version of the game





Why Indiegogo?State of Anarchy game was made by enthusiasts with zero funding. Although our game is currently on sale in Steam, it costs about $1. It will take months until it generates some profit to cover our costs. Personally I don’t mind working on the game for free. This is a dream job after all! But I can’t ask the same devotion from my team. Most of the money we gather will be spend on programming, art and music production.



Fellow Citizen: $1
Your name in game credits.
Unlimited
Hard Worker: $5
You’ll receive digital copy of the game after release,
+ your name in game credits.
Unlimited
Team Leader: $10
You’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,

+ your name in game credits.Unlimited

Big Boss: $50

Your doodle image will be added in the game as a boss or an enemy,
+ you’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,
+ your name in game credits.Quantity: 30
Friendly Patron: $500

Your doodle image will be added in the game as a hero’s avatar,
+ you’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,
+ your name in game credits.Quantity: 8

Prosperous Tycoon: $1000



You will become the founder of the town. A magnificent monument with your name will be erected in the town’s center.
+ your doodle image will be added in the game as a hero's avatar, a boss or an enemy,
+ you’ll receive digital sound track and digital copy of the game after release,
+ your name in game credits.
Quantity: 3






Andy Jr - this guy is responsible for the crazy idea of the game and writing this text. He’s a professional game designer with 8 years of experience in game development. He also made all that bang-bang sounds and screaming you hear during the game.

Sergion is a lone wolf coder. Although he joined the project in the middle of a journey, he turned out to be the only one who could handle routine everyday work. Without his incredible working capacity and patience the project would be impossible to complete.

Paulp is a talented artist and indie game developer. His help with graphics and special effects was essential to the project. Whenever you see something beautiful in the game - this is Paulp’s work.
Funds distribution


Programming - 50%
Graphics - 25%
Music - 5%
Platform fees and taxes - 15%
Rewards - 5%
Risks and challenges
We’ve come a long way and proved our worth as an indie game developers. Should we meet at least stretch 1 goal - ‘Rage of the Angry Citizen’ DLC will be developed and released with basic features. If we got lucky and raise more money - the production will take more time, but no longer than 6 months.

If you like our game, please, spread the word about this project!
Together we can achieve anything!

story:
BACK US NOW! YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

Hi, I'm Professor Martin Wright and I am running this crowdfunding on behalf of my organisation GamelabUK - specialists in inclusive media. This project will make a difference to the perceptions of sign language among hearing folk as well as bringing  deaf and hearing kids together. No matter how small or large, all contributions backing this project will make a difference to our making a difference - so whether its £10 or £100 or even £1000 -   all support is most welcome. There are wonderful perks to be had too. For those unable to assist financially, we'd still love your support on spreading the Lizzie Lester message far and wide! Share with your friends, share on your social media channels, share everywhere and let the Lizzie message reach every corner of the globe! This is an international project. Now read on.... 

NB Some browsers show a default contribution of £100. You can change this to any value you may wish to donate. Every $/£/€ helps!

We Are . . . 

GamelabUK, a small but very innovative inclusive media studio with nine BAFTA nominations and two TIGA  awards ( The Independent Games Award) to our name

Our Output

GameLabUK specialises in special needs users yet their outputs are so in demand and relevant that they appeal to a mainstream audience. This reverse inclusion has resulted in the production of cool audio games, deaf dramas, musicals, sign recognition games and much more.

Our Latest Creation 

Lizzie Lester is the latest female animation hero to hit our screens and is the star of our series. She is many things – a detective, a squirrel and she is also Deaf. This doesn’t only add to her appeal as an inspirational hero for young kids, but she never lets it hold her back. She is ready to show a world of 4-6 year old ‘can-do’ kids, just what they can achieve when they put their mind to it.

YOUNG DEAF PEOPLE NEED LANGUAGE    

Research indicates that 90% of deaf children are born into hearing families and it would seem that signing awareness can be a serious challenge within these families. It is not unusual for  5 year old D/deaf children to experience severe language deprivation. This in turn can lead to cognitive delay.  The Lizzie Lester game is to be a sign learning game which can be shared by hearing and deaf children alike encouraging sign language acquisition. 

LIZZIE LESTER GAME 

The Lizzie Lester Game aims to create an inclusive space for Deaf and hearing children  to converge. Gaming and online interactions are an ideal way to bring deaf kids to the mainstream. Conversely, it also assists hearing kids with the ability to learn to sign.  Lizzie Lester provides an opportunity to engage parents and siblings of deaf kids with the learning of sign language in a fun and creative way.

The game revolves around the children (aged 4-6 years) searching for hidden objects and clues around several school-like environments. Lizzie signs clues and sets the children off on their treasure hunt adventure.

The novel features of our game include:

  • The ability for Lizzie to sign in a variety of sign languages
  • Development of memory and logic skills
  • Engaging and unique characters
  • Some key word sign recognition (stretch goal)

CURRENT DEVELOPMENT  –  The Lizzie Lester Game is in animation pilot phase with character development, signing motion capture for localisation and initial narratives underway. The foundations have been set to launch the Lizzie Lester game to the next phase of development.

FUNDING TO DATE AND FURTHER REQUIREMENTS

In partnership with Factory Create, Clive Juster Associates and December Media and grants from BSLBT and ACTF we have developed a ‘sizzle reel’ that explores both the characterisations and the signing localisation pipeline.  

We are now seeking further funds to support the initial development of the Lizzie Lester interactive game. The combination of an interactive app and TV animation series proposal will create an appealing investment opportunity for TV broadcasters. The initial buzz surrounding Lizzie Lester will be catapulted to the forefront with the addition of this interactive game component. It will complete the Lizzie Lester offering to create a compelling and irresistible package for Deaf and hearing children and their families across the globe.

Initial Game Funding Tasks include:-

  • Script Writing
  • World builds
  • Character refinement
  • Motion capture
  • Coding
  • User / Audience research / testing
  • Word recognition software – stretch goal

To date we have already speculated much of our own resources into ensuring we have a reliable MoCap system in place as well as loveable characters.

The funding requirements are as follows:

  • Base project : £32 000
  • With stretch goal: £43 000

PERKS:

SPECIAL PERK FOR SCHOOLS

If you have deaf pupils or run a signing club you will be the first to receive this new game by becoming one of our partner schools. You will get the beta version during development and the final game when fully launched. Have a look at the SCHOOLS ONLY PERK.

Perk 1:

Initial artwork of the principal character Lizzie Lester together with a cardboard cut-out on 350gsm card.

This is your chance to own a piece of history with a limited-edition initial artwork of the principal character and star of the series, Lizzie Lester. Frame for a special place on your child’s wall or keep for years to come. Be the proud owner of our signing hero and at the same time, make a valuable contribution to the awareness of signing among hearing families of deaf children.

 

Perk 2:

 the Lizzie Lester projects goes global, you will be the proud owner of a limited certified edition A3 giclée print of the initial character development. See the entire Lizzie Lester team in the initial thought stages before they were bought to life.

Perk 3:

Become part of the team with a pre-release beta version of the game.

This is your chance to sample the game live before it is released to the world. Take the first steps in the virtual word of Lizzie Lester – an exclusive opportunity to the select supporters of the

The Impact

THE STATISTICS

Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss.   90% of deaf children are born to hearing parents with little or no experience of deafness or knowledge of how to communicate with a deaf person. There are over 45,000 deaf children living in the UK.  Approximately 125,000 deaf people in the UK use British Sign Language (BSL) as their first or preferred language. 

According to the World Health Organization (WHO), over 5% of the world's population suffers from disabling hearing loss. Five percent may seem like a small number, but that totals over 360 million people across the globe.

The most widely used sign language is probably American Sign Language (ASL), which is used is the USA, Canada, parts of Mexico and, with modifications, in quite a few other countries in Central America, Asia and Africa.

THE NEED - We are in dire need of fresh and innovative media content that can be shared by Deaf and hearing kids and their families. It not only brings children together in an educational and fun environment but encourages inclusivity with deaf language and culture fully embedded in the product. Children are exposed to new cultures and human interactions without any hesitations, or pre-conceived judgements. The environment is inclusive, welcoming and a place for hearing and Deaf children to merge and be accepted and communicate feely as they are.

IMPACT – The Lizzie Lester app will be the world’s first, truly bilingual (Sign language and spoken language) application. This game changing app will bridge the gap between Deaf and hearing children, creating an inclusive and appealing platform to engage young children to communicate in ways they never thought possible.

Risks & Challenges

The single greatest challenge is an aesthetic one in which we can create signing cartoon characters who will have toon style motion but still produce acceptable sign language. Sign language not only involves the use of hands and arms but also facial expression and body language.  We have on our team a deaf director and a motion capture technician  as well as access to deaf communities and experts for validation. Our MoCap system technically can capture all body motion, finger activity and facial expression.

 Other challenges are in the area of localisation. We have already developed and tested our pipeline methodology but this will involve continuous refinement.

Our ultimate challenge will be the use of webcam for sign recognition. We already have experience with sign recognition games with our award winning Boris Games. Our challenge will be to transfer that experience to alternative technologies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary contributions aren’t the only way to help! We greatly appreciate any monetary contributions towards the development of our Lizzie Lester project. But the support doesn’t stop there! For those unable to assist financially, we would love your support on spreading the Lizzie Lester message far and wide! Share with your friends, on your social media channels and let the Lizzie message reach every corner of the globe!
